It can cast any of the spells as though it were {@action Activate an Item||Activating} the staff, and regains 1 charge per 4 hours spent in torpor, to a maximum of 8 charges. A typical demilich has the spells from a greater staff of necromancy, but it could have spells from another staff of 8th level or lower instead.
bot.name: Staff Gems

entries: Ten blight quartz gemstones on the demilich's skull can trap the souls of the living. The Activated gem casts bind soul. This bind soul can target and affect a {@condition dying} creature instead of a corpse. The {@condition dying} creature can attempt a DC 38 Fortitude save; if it succeeds, it doesn't die and its soul is not trapped but it's enervated 2 (or is unaffected entirely on a critical success). When the soul of a creature gets trapped, the creature's body swiftly turns to dust. The gemstones work like the black sapphires used in bind soul, except that they can hold creatures of up to 17th level and have a value of 200 gp apiece. The demilich can Devour a Soul it has trapped.
bot.name: Trap Soul

entries: A dero magister takes 10 damage for every hour they're exposed to sunlight.
mid.name: Vulnerable to Sunlight

entries: The magister focuses their gaze on a creature they can see within 30 feet. The target is {@condition dazzled} for 1 round and must succeed at a DC 24 Will saving throw or be {@condition confused} for 1 round.
bot.name: Cytillesh Stare

entries: A dero stalker takes 4 damage for every hour they're exposed to sunlight.
mid.name: Vulnerable to Sunlight

mid.trigger: A creature targets the dero with an attack and the dero can see the attacker.
mid.requirements: The dero stalker is not {@condition encumbered}.
entries: The dero dodges out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
mid.name: Nimble Dodge

entries: A dero stalker deals {@dice 1d6} extra precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: A dero strangler takes 8 damage for every hour they're exposed to sunlight.
mid.name: Vulnerable to Sunlight

bot.name: Strangle
bot.requirement: The dero must have two free hands, or be wielding an aklys and have one hand free.
entries: The dero attempts an Athletics check to Grab with a +2 circumstance bonus. On a success, the target takes 1d6+6 bludgeoning damage. Double the damage on a critical success.

mid.trigger: The desert drake is targeted with an attack.
entries: The desert drake raises its wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the desert drake is flying at the time it is attacked, it descends 10 feet after the attack is complete.
mid.name: Wing Deflection

entries: The desert drake makes two fangs {@action Strike||Strikes} and one tail {@action Strike} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: The desert drake spits a ball of electrically charged sand to a range of 60 feet that explodes into a cloud with a 15-foot-radius burst. Creatures in the area take {@damage 9d6} electricity damage (DC 27 basic Reflex save). The cloud remains for {@dice 1d4} rounds, granting concealment to everything within. The desert drake can't use Sandstorm Breath again for {@dice 1d6} rounds.
bot.name: Sandstorm Breath
Speed Surge
entries: The desert drake {@action Stride||Strides} or {@action Fly||Flies} twice.

30 feet. A creature entering the emanation must attempt a DC 27 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature is {@condition sickened 1}, and on a critical failure is also {@condition slowed 1}. While within the aura, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the {@condition sickened} condition. A creature that succeeds at the save is temporarily immune to this effect for 1 minute.
mid.name: Stench

entries: {@damage 2d6+2} bludgeoning.
bot.name: Constrict

entries: Until the next time it acts, the dezullon appears to be a normal pitcher plant. It has an automatic result of 41 (44 in forests or swamps) on {@skill Deception} checks and DCs to pass as a non-creature plant.
bot.name: Root

abilities: +2 circumstance to all saves vs. disease

mid.name: Blood of the Night
entries: The dhampir's penalty and Hit Point reduction from the {@condition drained} condition are reduced as though the condition value were 1 lower.
DC 20
mid.name: Buck

entries: The dire wolf's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal {@damage 1d6} extra damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the wolf's allies.
bot.name: Pack Attack

bot.requirements: The dire wolf has a creature {@condition grabbed} with its jaws.
entries: The dire wolf fiercely shakes the {@condition grabbed} creature with its teeth, dealing {@dice 1d10+2} damage (DC 20 basic Fortitude save).
bot.name: Worry

spells.name: plane shift
note: to Astral Plane, Elemental Planes or Material Plane only

entries: 20 feet. All squares in the djinni's aura are {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} for {@action Stride||Striding} and Flying creatures. Creatures with the {@trait air} trait are immune.
mid.name: Whirlwind

entries: The djinni all creatures in its whirlwind pushes back 20 feet, or forces all creatures in the aura to move 20 feet clockwise or counterclockwise. Each creature must attempt a DC 21 Fortitude save. On a success, it avoids being moved, and on a critical failure it falls {@condition prone} in addition to being moved. Creatures with the {@trait air} trait are immune.
bot.name: Hurricane Blast

mid.trigger: The doppelganger is transformed with Change Shape and another creature moves adjacent to it or takes a {@condition hostile} action against it.
entries: The doppelganger reverts to its natural form and can make a {@action Strike} against the triggering creature. If the creature was unaware the doppelganger was in disguise, that creature is {@condition flat-footed} against this attack.
mid.name: End the Charade

entries: The doppelganger takes on the specific appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid who it has seen and whose appearance it remembers. This doesn't change the doppelganger's Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its {@action Strike||Strikes} but might change the damage type its {@action Strike||Strikes} deal (typically to bludgeoning).
bot.name: Change Shape

mid.trigger: A creature adjacent to the dragon turtle targets it with a melee attack.
entries: The dragon turtle rolls its shell toward the triggering creature, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack.
mid.name: Shell Block

entries: The dragon turtle breathes a massive blast of steam that deals {@damage 10d6} fire damage to creatures within a 50-foot cone (DC 27 basic Reflex save). This steam blast affects creatures within the water, as well as outside. The dragon turtle can't use its Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds or until it takes a critical hit (whichever comes first).
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The dragon turtle tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of its size or smaller. The dragon turtle must succeed at an {@skill Athletics} check with a DC of 30 or the pilot's {@skill Lore||Sailing Lore} DC, whichever is higher.
bot.name: Capsize

entries: The dragon turtle makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} and one jaws {@action Strike} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: The drakauthix exudes a cloud of spores that it uses to see. This is an imprecise sense that functions only in areas without strong wind currents. Sporesight does not function underwater.
top.name: Sporesight

entries: Whenever the drakauthix takes at least 10 slashing damage, it releases a cloud of brown spores that has the effect of obscuring mist for 1 minute, centered around the drakauthix. This cloud of spores does not move with the drakauthix, nor is it displaced by its movement.
mid.name: Obscuring Spores

entries: The drakauthix pulls all creatures it has {@condition grabbed 15} feet closer to itself.
bot.name: Reel In

entries: The tendrils that cover the drakauthix's body reach out and infest adjacent creatures, dealing {@damage 4d6} poison damage and {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent poison damage}. A creature can attempt a basic DC 27 Reflex save to reduce this damage, but one {@condition grabbed} by the drakauthix takes a –4 circumstance penalty to this save.
bot.name: Spore Tendrils

entries: ]The drakauthix whirls, whipping creatures around it. The drakauthix makes a tentacle {@action Strike} against every creature within its reach.
bot.name: Whirlwind of Hooks

entries: A creature hit by a drider's web attack is {@condition immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface ({@action Escape} DC 21).
bot.name: Web Trap

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: The drow fighter draws a weapon using the {@action Interact} action, then {@action Strike||Strikes} with that weapon.
bot.name: Quick Draw

entries: The drow fighter {@action Strike||Strikes} with its rapier, and gains a +1 circumstance bonus to the attack roll. A creature damaged by the attack takes {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage}.
bot.name: Skewer

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, +2 status to all saves vs. mental
+1 status to all saves vs. magic, +2 status to all saves vs. mental

mid.trigger: The drow rogue is hit or critically hit by an attack made by a creature the drow rogue can see.
mid.requirements: A drow rogue can't use this reaction while {@condition encumbered}.
entries: The drow rogue gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their Armor Class against the triggering attack.
mid.name: Nimble Dodge

entries: The drow rogue draws a weapon using the {@action Interact} action, then {@action Strike||Strikes} with that weapon.
bot.name: Quick Draw

entries: The drow rogue deals {@dice 1d6} extra precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, +2 status to all saves vs. mental

entries: The dryad can use {@skill Diplomacy} to {@action Make an Impression} on and make very simple Requests of animals and plants.
top.name: Nature Empathy

entries: A dryad is mystically bonded to a single great tree and must remain within 300 feet of it. If she moves beyond that range, she becomes {@condition sickened 1} and is unable to recover. She must attempt a DC 18 Fortitude save every hour or increase the {@condition sickened} value by 1 (to a maximum of {@condition sickened 4}). After 24 hours, she becomes {@condition drained 1}, with this value increasing by 1 every additional 24 hours. A dryad can perform a 24-hour ritual to bond herself to a new tree.
mid.name: Tree Dependent

entries: The dryad touches a tree of enough volume to contain her and merges into it for as long as she wishes. She can {@action Cast a Spell} while inside as long as the spell doesn't require a line of effect outside the tree. She can hear, but not see, what's going on outside the tree. She can {@action Dismiss} this effect.
Significant physical damage dealt to the tree expels the dryad from the tree and deals {@dice 3d6} damage to her. Passwall expels the dryad without dealing damage.

If a dryad uses this ability on her bonded tree, she instead enters an extradimensional living space within the tree; Tree Meld gains the {@trait extradimensional} trait. A dryad can bring up to two other creatures with her when entering her home within her bonded tree. The dryad can still be expelled from this space as above.
bot.name: Tree Meld

entries: The dryad can use {@skill Diplomacy} to {@action Make an Impression} on and make very simple Requests of animals and plants.
top.name: Nature Empathy

entries: DC 30. On a failed save, the target is {@condition immobilized} in awe for 1 minute.
mid.name: Nymph's Beauty

entries: On a failed save, if the target was already affected by the dryad queen's beauty, the target suffers the effects of a failed save against charm.
bot.name: Focus Beauty

entries: As dryad, except the hamadryad can enter and exit her extradimensional domain from any tree in her domain and she can bring up to eight other creatures with her when she does so.
bot.name: Tree Meld

entries: A duergar bombardier's items listed as infused last for 24 hours, or until the next time they make their daily preparations.
top.name: Infused Items

entries: {@item lesser acid flask}, {@item lesser alchemist's fire}, {@item lesser tanglefoot bag}.
bot.name: Alchemical Formulas (1st)

entries: The duergar bombardier has a range increment of 30 feet with their bombs instead of 20 feet.
bot.name: Far Lobber

entries: The duergar bombardier creates a single alchemical item from their formula book (see Alchemical Formulas). This item has the {@trait infused} trait, but it remains potent only until the start of the duergar bombardier's next turn.
bot.name: Quick Alchemy

entries: The duergar can use {@action Interact} to draw a bomb, then {@action Strike} with it.
bot.name: Quick Bomber

savingThrows.abilities: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: This shot deals no damage, but on a hit, the target must succeed at a DC 16 Reflex save or be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition immobilized} until it is freed with a successful DC 15 check to {@action Escape}. This check can be attempted either by the target or a creature adjacent to the target.
bot.name: Bola Bolt

entries: Duergar taskmasters automatically {@quickref disbelieve all illusion|CRB|2|disbelieving illusions|0} of 1st level or lower.
mid.name: Iron Mind

entries: The duergar taskmaster smashes their maul into the ground and invokes Droskar's name to rally their allies to action. All allied duergars of equal or lower level that are within 20 feet of the duergar taskmaster gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls until the end of the duergar taskmaster's next turn.
bot.name: Take Them Down!

savingThrows.abilities: +2 status to all saves vs. magic, iron mind

entries: 30 feet, DC 23
mid.name: Frightful Presence

entries: Any slashing weapon a dullahan wields becomes keen, and any hatchet it wields becomes returning. If the dullahan kills a creature with a critical hit using a slashing weapon, the target is decapitated as though the dullahan had used Reap on the target. These effects remain only while the dullahan holds the weapon.
bot.name: Head Hunter

entries: The dullahan removes the head of a dead creature within reach. Each creature within the area of the dullahan's frightful presence must attempt a new save, even if they are temporarily immune.
bot.name: Reap

entries: The dullahan summons a {@creature war horse} with elite adjustments (page 6) and the {@trait fiend} trait. This steed remains until it is slain, the dullahan Dismisses it, or the dullahan summons another steed.
bot.name: Summon Steed

entries: The duskwalker's weapons have the benefits of the {@item ghost touch} property rune on attacks against incorporeal undead.
bot.name: Ghost Hunter

entries: The duskwalker designates as its prey a single creature that it can see and hear or that it is {@action Track||Tracking}. It gains a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Perception} checks when it Seeks its prey and a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Survival} checks when it Tracks its prey. It also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within its second range increment against its prey.

Lastly, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Deception} checks, {@skill Intimidation} checks, and {@skill Stealth} checks against its prey and to any check to {@action Recall Knowledge} about its prey, as well as a +1 circumstance bonus to AC against its prey's attacks. The duskwalker can have only one prey designated at a time.
bot.name: Hunt Prey

entries: The duskwalker makes two longbow {@action Strike||Strikes} against its hunted prey. If both {@action Strike||Strikes} hit, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.
bot.name: Hunted Shot

immunities: effects that would transform their body or soul to an undead

entries: The eagle Flies up to double its fly Speed in a straight line, descending at least 10 feet, and then makes a talon {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Eagle Dive

entries: The earth mephit breathes rocks in a 15-foot cone that deals {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage to each creature within the area (DC 17 basic Reflex save). The earth mephit can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

spells.name: plane shift
spells.note: Elemental Planes, or {@place Material Plane} only

entries: When the efreeti grabs a creature, that creature takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage, and takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage at the end of each of its turns as long as it remains {@condition grabbed}.
bot.name: Burning Grasp

entries: The efreeti changes a creature's size. This works as a 4th-level {@spell enlarge} or {@spell shrink} spell but can target an unwilling creature (DC 29 Fortitude save negates).
bot.name: Change Size

bot.requirements: The efreeti has one hand free.
entries: The efreeti makes a melee {@action Strike} while keeping one hand free. If the {@action Strike} hits, the target is {@condition grabbed} in the efreeti's free hand.
bot.name: Combat Grab

mid.trigger: The elananx takes damage from a {@condition hostile} source.
entries: The elananx disperses into a cloud of smoke and cinders, filling its space and a 20-foot emanation. While in this form, the elananx can't be attacked or targeted, and it doesn't take up space. Anything inside this cloud is {@condition concealed}, and any creature ending its turn there takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage. At the start of its turn, the elananx returns to its normal form in any square the cloud covered. If the elananx {@action Strike||Strikes} a creature using its first action after returning to its normal form, the target is {@condition flat-footed} and the {@action Strike} deals an extra {@damage 1d6} fire damage.
mid.name: Cinder Dispersal

entries: The elananx's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal an extra {@dice 1d6} damage to creatures within the reach of at least two of its allies.
bot.name: Pack Attack

entries: The elananx {@action Stride||Strides} and makes a {@action Strike} at the end of that movement. If the elananx began this action {@condition hidden}, it remains {@condition hidden} until after the attack.
bot.name: Pounce

entries: Hailing from the Plane of Air, these beings appear in a variety of sizes and shapes.
bot.name: Elemental, Air

attacks.name: tail
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d4+1} bludgeoning plus {@damage 1d4} electricity and stunning shock

entries: A creature critically hit by the electric eel's tail must attempt a DC 17 Fortitude save.

entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition stunned 2}.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition stunned 3}.

bot.name: Stunning Shock

entries: When not touching solid ground, the elemental avalanche is {@condition slowed 1}, can't use reactions, and can't Trample.
top.name: Earthbound

entries: 10 feet. Spikes of rock rise up from all stone surfaces in the emanation, creating {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain}. A creature moving in the terrain takes {@damage 2d8} piercing damage for each square of spikes it moves into (a Large or larger creature takes damage only once for each square it moves, even if its space covers multiple squares of spikes). Creatures with the {@trait earth} trait ignore all effects within the area. The elemental avalanche can disable or activate spike stones as a single action, which has the {@trait concentrate} trait.
mid.name: Spike Stones

entries: The elemental avalanche crumbles into the ground, Burrowing down 10 feet. This Burrowing does not trigger reactions. The elemental avalanche can't Crumble again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
mid.name: Crumble
mid.trigger: The elemental avalanche takes damage from a {@condition hostile} source while atop rock or earth.

entries: The elemental avalanche can {@action Burrow} through any earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, the elemental avalanche moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.
bot.name: Earth Glide

entries: Large or smaller, fist, DC 30
bot.name: Trample

entries: 20 feet. Air within the emanation is {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} for Flying creatures that do not have the {@trait air} trait.
mid.name: High Winds

entries: The elemental hurricane disperses. Until the end of the current turn, it can't be attacked or targeted, doesn't take up space, and any auras or emanations it has are suppressed. At the end of the turn, the elemental hurricane reforms in any space in which it can fit within 100 feet of where it dispersed and any auras or emanations it has are restored as long as their duration didn't run out while it was dispersed.
mid.name: Disperse
mid.trigger: The living whirlwind takes damage from a {@condition hostile} action.

entries: The elemental breathes a 30-foot cone of air. Creatures in the cone must succeed at a DC 29 Fortitude save or be knocked away from the elemental. A creature knocked into a solid object stops moving and takes {@damage 10d6} bludgeoning damage. The elemental hurricane can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entries.Failure: The creature is Pushed 40 feet.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is Pushed 40 feet and knocked {@condition prone}.

bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The elemental's movement doesn't trigger reactions.
bot.name: Swiftness

entries: Earth elementals make excellent bodyguards for adventuresome spelunkers and are ideal protectors of important subterranean locations such as vaults and treasuries.
bot.name: Elemental, Earth

entries: The elemental inferno ignores the {@condition concealed} condition from smoke.
top.name: Smoke Vision

entries: When the elemental inferno dies, it explodes, dealing {@damage 7d6} fire damage to each creature in a 10-foot emanation (DC 30 basic Reflex save).
mid.name: Explosion

entries: 10 feet, {@damage 7d6} fire, DC 28 basic Reflex.
mid.name: Intense Heat

entries: When the elemental inferno scores a critical hit, its body surges with blue flames, increasing the damage of its intense heat and Inferno {@action Leap} by {@dice 3d6} until the start of its next turn.
bot.name: Blue Flames

entries: The elemental inferno jumps horizontally and vertically with a maximum height and distance each equal to its Speed. Its intense heat is suppressed until the end of the jump. At any point during the jump, flames explode from the elemental in a 30-foot emanation, dealing {@damage 12d6} fire damage to each creature within the area (DC 30 basic Reflex save). The elemental inferno can't Inferno {@action Leap} again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Inferno Leap

entries: Mephits—sometimes known as elemental scamps—are little bipedal critters with bat-like wings who serve stronger elementals on the Elemental Planes or neophyte spellcasters who summon them to the Material Plane. All mephits have an inkling of magical power as well as a breath weapon.
bot.name: Elemental, Mephit

attacks.name: wave
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d12+12} bludgeoning plus Push or Pull 10 feet

entries: When not touching water, the living waterfall is {@condition slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
top.name: Water-Bound

entries: 30 feet. Water in the area that is in the same body of water as the living waterfall is {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} for Swimming creatures that don't have the {@trait water} trait.
mid.name: Vortex

entries: The elemental puts out all fires in a 20-foot emanation. It extinguishes all non-magical fires automatically and attempts to counteract magical fires (+20 counteract modifier).
bot.name: Drench

entries: The elemental tsunami quickly expands its space to fill the area of its vortex. Creatures within the vortex's emanation take {@damage 5d12+6} bludgeoning damage (DC 31 basic Fortitude save). A creature that fails this save is Pushed 20 feet. The elemental tsunami then retracts to its former space. The elemental tsunami can't Surge again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Surge

entries: A Medium or smaller creature hit by the elephant's trunk is {@condition grabbed}. If the elephant moves, it can bring the {@condition grabbed} creature along with it.
bot.name: Grabbing Trunk

entries: Large or smaller, foot, DC 24
bot.name: Trample

entries: Any weapon an erinys holds gains the effects of a flaming rune while they hold it.
bot.name: Flames of Fury

entries: The erinys hovers in place if they are flying and fires one arrow at any number of creatures in a 30-foot cone. Each attack is rolled separately. This counts as one attack for the purpose of the erinys's multiple attack penalty.
bot.name: Furious Fusillade

entries: An erinys carries a coil of rope woven of their hair (use the statistics for rope) that animates in their hands. When a creature is hit by the erinys's rope, a segment of the rope tears loose and wraps itself around the creature, imposing a 10–foot circumstance penalty to Speed. The piece that tears off is 10 feet long for a Medium or smaller creature, and doubles in length for each size larger than Medium. When a creature {@action Escape||Escapes} the effect (DC 26), the detached segment of rope withers away into useless black sludge.
bot.name: Rope Snare

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

attacks.name: fangs
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d10+7} piercing plus ether spider venom and Grab

entries: The ether spider shifts to either the Ethereal Plane or the Material Plane. The ether spider can remain on the Ethereal Plane indefinitely without ill effect. While there, it can see clearly onto the Material Plane with a range of 60 feet. On its first round in an encounter, the ether spider can use this ability once as a free action.
bot.name: Ethereal Step

entries: A creature hit by the ether spider's web attack is {@condition immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface ({@action Escape} DC 22).
bot.name: Ethereal Web Trap

entries: The ether spider flings a gout of stored webs in a 30-foot cone. These webs can pass between the Material Plane and the Ethereal Plane. Each creature in the area is {@condition immobilized}, as ethereal web trap, unless it succeeds at a DC 22 Reflex save.
bot.name: Web Burst

entries: Each of an ettin's heads rolls its own initiative and has its own turn. Neither head can {@action Delay}. At the start of a head's turn, that head gets 2 actions and 1 reaction. Each brain controls one of the ettin's arms, but both can move the legs. Any ability that would sever an ettin's head (such as the vorpal weapon property) doesn't cause the ettin to die if it still has its other head, but does cause it to lose the turns, actions, and reactions of the severed head. {@trait Mental} effects that target a single creature affect only one of the ettin's heads.
Items flail (2)
top.name: Independent Brains

entries: The faceless stalker spends 10 minutes reshaping its appearance to take on the shape of any Small or Medium humanoid. It gains a +4 circumstance bonus to {@skill Deception} checks to pass as that creature.
bot.name: Assume Form

entries: The faceless stalker uses its three-pronged tongue to drink the blood of an adjacent {@condition restrained} or {@condition unconscious} creature. The creature gains {@condition drained 1}.
bot.name: Blood Nourishment

entries: When the faceless stalker successfully Squeezes, it moves through the tight space at full speed. Narrow confines are not {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} for a faceless stalker.
bot.name: Compression

bot.requirements: The faceless stalker is in an assumed form.
entries: The faceless stalker resumes its true form. Until the start of its next turn, it gains a +2 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, saving throws, and skill checks.
bot.name: Revert Form

entries: The faceless stalker deals {@dice 1d6} extra precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: The dragon breathes euphoric gas in a 10-foot cone. Each creature in the area must succeed at a DC 18 Fortitude save or become {@condition stupefied 2} and {@condition slowed 1} for {@dice 1d4} rounds; on a critical failure, the duration is 1 minute. The faerie dragon can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The fire giant imbues its blade with flames and makes a greatsword {@action Strike} with a –2 circumstance penalty against each creature in a 15-foot line. It makes only one attack roll and compares the result to each creature's AC. This {@action Strike} deals an additional {@damage 1d6} fire damage and counts as one attack for the fire giant's multiple attack penalty.
bot.name: Flaming Stroke

entries: A rock thrown by a fire giant deals an additional {@damage 1d6} fire damage on a hit.
bot.name: Throw Rock

entries: The fire mephit ignores the {@condition concealed} condition from smoke.
top.name: Smoke Vision

entries: The fire mephit breathes flames in a 15-foot cone that deals {@damage 2d4} fire and {@damage 1d4} {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire damage} to each creature within the area (DC 17 basic Reflex save). The fire mephit can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The firewyrm ignores the {@condition concealed} condition from smoke.
top.name: Smoke Vision

entries: When the firewyrm dies, it explodes, dealing {@damage 6d6} fire damage to each creature in a 10-foot emanation (DC 28 basic Reflex save).
mid.name: Explosion

entries: 10 feet, {@damage 4d6} fire, DC 25 basic Reflex.
mid.name: Intense Heat

entries: The firewyrm breathes a 30-foot cone of fire dealing {@damage 7d6} fire and {@damage 2d8} {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire damage} to every creature within the cone (DC 28 basic Reflex save). The firewyrm can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: Smoke doesn't impair a flame drake's vision; it ignores concealment from smoke.
top.name: Smoke Vision

entries: Fangs only.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: The flame drake makes two fangs {@action Strike||Strikes} and one tail {@action Strike} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: The flame drake expels a ball of flame to a range of 180 feet that explodes in a 20-foot burst. Creatures in the burst take {@damage 6d6} fire damage (DC 22 basic Reflex save). The flame drake can't use Fireball Breath again for {@dice 1d6} rounds.
bot.name: Fireball Breath
Speed Surge
entries: The flame drake {@action Stride||Strides} or {@action Fly||Flies} twice.
10 feet. The flash beetle's bioluminescent organs fill the area with bright light.
mid.name: Luminescent Aura

entries: The flash beetle creates a brilliant flash of light. All creatures in its luminescent aura must succeed at a DC 17 Fortitude save or be {@condition dazzled} for 1 minute. The flash beetle's glow then goes out, disabling its aura for 24 hours, during which time it cannot use Light Flash.
bot.name: Light Flash

entries: A severely damaged flesh golem has a chance of going berserk. If it has 40 or fewer HP at the start of its turn, the golem must succeed at a DC {@flatDC 5} flat check or go berserk. A berserk golem wildly attacks the nearest living creature, or the nearest object if no creatures are nearby.
mid.name: Berserk

entries: harmed by fire ({@dice 5d8}, {@dice 3d4} from areas or {@condition persistent damage}); healed by electricity (area {@dice 2d4} HP); {@condition slowed} by cold.
mid.name: Golem Antimagic

entries: Casting a {@spell flesh to stone} spell on the flesh golem affects the golem normally.
mid.name: Vulnerable to Flesh to Stone

mid.trigger: The golem takes electricity damage and a creature is adjacent to it.
entries: The golem lashes out and tries to grab a nearby creature. The golem attempts an {@skill Athletics} check to {@action Grapple} an adjacent creature. The creature also takes {@damage 3d6} electricity damage on a success, or {@damage 6d6} electricity damage on a critical success.
mid.name: Electric Reflexes

bot.requirements: The flesh golem is berserk.
entries: The flesh golem {@action Strike||Strikes} with its fist at a –1 circumstance penalty. If it hits, it deals {@damage 1d6} extra damage and knocks the target {@condition prone}.
bot.name: Berserk Slam

entries: Snow doesn't impair a frost drake's vision; it ignores concealment from snowfall.
top.name: Snow Vision

mid.trigger: A creature within reach of the frost drake's tail successfully damages the frost drake with a {@action Strike}.
entries: The frost drake attempts to {@action Strike} with its tail. If the {@action Strike} hits, it deals an additional {@dice 1d6} damage.
mid.name: Retaliatory Strike

entries: The frost drake makes two gangs {@action Strike||Strikes} and one tail {@action Strike} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: The frost drake spits a ball of liquid up to 60 feet that explodes into a 20-foot-burst cloud of freezing mist. Those in the burst take {@damage 8d6} cold damage (DC 25 basic Reflex save). The mist cakes all surfaces in the area with a sheet of slippery ice that turns the area into {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} for {@dice 2d4} rounds. It can't use Freezing Mist Breath again for {@dice 1d6} rounds.
bot.name: Freezing Mist Breath

entries: A frost drake can climb on ice as though it had the listed climb Speed. It ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} and {@quickref greater difficult terrain||3|terrain} from ice and snow and doesn't risk falling when crossing ice.
bot.name: Ice Climb
Speed Surge
entries: The frost drake {@action Stride||Strides} or {@action Fly||Flies} twice.

The frost giant breathes out a 15-foot cone of freezing moisture that quickly condenses into ice, dealing {@damage 4d6} cold damage. Each creature in the cone must attempt a DC 28 basic Reflex save. A creature that fails its save is also {@condition immobilized} and takes {@damage 2d6} cold damage at the end of each of its turns until it gets free ({@action Escape} DC 28). The giant can't use Chill Breath again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Chill Breath

entries: A frost giant isn't impeded by {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} caused by snow or ice, nor does it need to attempt {@skill Acrobatics} checks to keep from falling on slippery ice.
bot.name: Ice Stride

entries: The frost giant makes a single greataxe {@action Strike} and compares the attack roll result to the ACs of up to two foes within its reach. This counts as two attacks for the frost giant's multiple attack penalty.
bot.name: Wide Swing

entries: As leaf leshy, except only fungi are healed, they regain {@dice 2d8} Hit Points, and the area sprouts fungi.
mid.name: Verdant Burst

entries: As leaf leshy, except the fungus leshy transforms into a giant mushroom or patch of fungi.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: A fungus leshy can unleash a cloud of spores that irritates the eyes and throats of non-fungi creatures in a 15-foot emanation. Each creature must succeed at a DC 16 Fortitude save or take 1 {@condition persistent damage||persistent poison damage}. A creature has its vision reduced as long as the {@condition persistent damage} continues and can see only within 20 feet (or 10 feet, on a critical failure).
bot.name: Spore Cloud

entries: A creature that takes damage from a fungus leshy's spore pod {@action Strike} must attempt a saving throw with the same DC and effect as its Spore Cloud ability.
bot.name: Spores

entries: A gancanagh's lungs can't tolerate smoke. They take a –2 circumstance penalty to saving throws against effects that create some form of smoke.
mid.name: Vulnerable to Smoke

entries: The gancanagh can take on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their {@action Strike||Strikes}, but might change the damage type their {@action Strike||Strikes} deal (typically to bludgeoning).
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: The gancanagh embraces or kisses a willing creature, infusing that creature with their invigorating passion. The creature gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and 10 temporary Hit Points for 10 minutes. After that time, the target becomes {@condition fatigued} for 10 minutes unless they succeed at a DC 21 Fortitude save.
bot.name: Invigorating Passion

mid.trigger: The gargoyle is Flying, and a creature moves into an adjacent square below it.
entries: The gargoyle makes a claw {@action Strike} against the triggering creature.
mid.name: Clawed Feet

entries: Until the next time it acts, the gargoyle appears to be a statue. It has an automatic result of 32 on {@skill Deception} checks and DCs to pass as a statue.
bot.name: Statue

entries: A sewer ooze can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.
top.name: Motion Sense

entries: A gelatinous cube is so clear that it's difficult to spot. A successful DC 23 {@skill Perception} check is required to notice a stationary cube, and a creature must be {@action Search||Searching} to attempt this check. A creature that walks into the cube is automatically Engulfed (this usually causes the GM to call for initiative).
top.name: Transparent

entries: DC 19, {@damage 2d6} acid, {@action Escape} DC 19, Rupture 7. A creature Engulfed by the gelatinous cube must also attempt a saving throw against paralysis.
bot.name: Engulf

entries: A creature Engulfed by the cube or hit by its attack is {@condition paralyzed} unless it succeeds at a DC 20 Fortitude save. A victim can attempt a new save to recover at the end of each of its turns.
bot.name: Paralysis

entries: A gelatinous cube's acid damages only organic material—not metal, stone, or other inorganic substances.
bot.name: Weak Acid

attacks.name: frost longspear
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d8+12} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} cold, {@damage 1d6} evil, and slowing frost

attacks.name: tail
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d6+12} bludgeoning plus {@damage 2d6} cold, {@damage 1d6} evil, and slowing frost

entries: 10 feet, DC 31
mid.name: Frightful Presence

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

attacks.name: holy greatsword
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d12+13} slashing plus {@damage 1d6} good and {@dice 1d6} other (see Choose Weakness)

attacks.name: light ray
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d12} chaotic plus {@damage 1d12} good plus {@dice 2d6+6} other (see Choose Weakness)

mid.trigger: The ghaele ends its turn while unable to act or attempts a greatsword {@action Strike} that would take a circumstance or status penalty.
entries: A ghaele's blade is implacable in the pursuit of freedom, and its energies can overpower any effect that would interfere with its swordplay. The ghaele attempts to counteract each effect that prevents it from making a greatsword {@action Strike}, gives it a penalty to its greatsword {@action Strike}, or prevents it from acting. The ghaele can use this ability even if it's otherwise unable to act.
mid.name: Free Blade

entries: A ghaele's body is partially corporeal and partially composed of light, with a color corresponding to the elemental energy currently residing in its blade (see Choose Weakness). It can move through solid objects but can't end its action within a solid object.
mid.name: Light Form

entries: A ghaele attempts to {@action Recall Knowledge} about a foe it is facing. If successful, it can change the elemental damage dealt by its greatsword and light ray to acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic, usually to match the a foe's weakness. It can also change its energy resistance to any of these energy types (this can be a different type than for its attacks). The choices remain until it next uses Choose Weakness.
bot.name: Choose Weakness

entries: When a ghaele fixes its gaze upon a non-good creature, the creature suffers the effects of divine decree (DC 33 Will save). If it survives, the creature is temporarily immune to Ghaele's Gaze for 1 minute.
bot.name: Ghaele's Gaze

entries: Any weapon becomes a +2 holy striking weapon while the ghaele wields it.
bot.name: Holy Blade

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d6+5} piercing plus ghast fever and paralysis

entries: 10 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a DC 16 Fortitude save or become {@condition sickened 1} (plus {@condition slowed 1} as long as it's {@condition sickened} on a critical failure). While within the aura, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to saves against {@trait disease} and to recover from the {@condition sickened} condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.
mid.name: Stench

bot.requirements: The ghast is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.
entries: The ghast regains {@dice 3d6} Hit Points. It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.
bot.name: Consume Flesh

stages.entry: {@damage 3d8} negative damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing
{@damage 3d8} negative damage and gains no benefit from healing
dead, and rises as a {@creature ghast|b1} the next midnight

entries: Any living creature hit by a ghast's attack must succeed at a DC 15 Fortitude save or become {@condition paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.
bot.name: Paralysis
Swift Leap
entries: The ghast jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.
Setting right the injustice that led to the commoner's death allows it to move on to the afterlife.
mid.name: Rejuvenation

entries: DC 21
bot.name: Frightful Moan

resistances.name: all damage
resistances.note: (except force, {@item ghost touch}, or positive; double resistance vs. non-magical)

entries: Completing the ghost mage's project allows it to move on to the afterlife.
mid.name: Rejuvenation

entries: DC 29
bot.name: Frightful Moan

entries: {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning, DC 29
bot.name: Telekinetic Assault

resistances.name: all damage
resistances.note: (except force, {@item ghost touch}, or positive; double resistance vs. non-magical)

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d6+1} piercing plus ghoul fever and paralysis

bot.requirements: The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.
entries: The ghoul regains {@dice 1d6} Hit Points. It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.
bot.name: Consume Flesh

stages.entry: {@damage 2d6} negative damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing
{@damage 2d6} negative damage and gains no benefit from healing
dead, and rises as a {@creature ghoul|b1} the next midnight

entries: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a DC 15 Fortitude save or become {@condition paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.
bot.name: Paralysis
Swift Leap
entries: The ghoul jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.
The DC of the {@action Escape} check is increased by 2.
mid.name: Tighten Coils
mid.trigger: A creature {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by the ball python attempts to {@action Escape}.

entries: {@damage 1d10+7} bludgeoning, DC 26
bot.name: Greater Constrict

entries: The giant anaconda {@action Stride||Strides}, Climbs, or Swims up to half its Speed, pulling any creatures it has {@condition grabbed} with it.
bot.name: Slither

entries: Large, {@damage 1d10+7} bludgeoning, Rupture 21.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

bot.requirements: A Large or smaller creature is {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} in the giant anaconda's jaws.
entries: The giant anaconda moves the creature into its coils, freeing its jaws to make attacks, then uses Greater Constrict against the creature. The giant anaconda's coils can hold as many creatures as will fit in its space.
bot.name: Wrap in Coils

entries: Like normal objects, a giant animated statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once a giant animated statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 22.
mid.name: Construct Armor

entries: The statue carries a wide brazier full of hot coals. To make flaming coal {@action Strike||Strikes} or use Burn Alive, the statue must have the brazier held in one hand or otherwise have it within reach. Instead of targeting the statue with an attack, a creature can target the brazier directly. The brazier has the same AC and saves as the statue. Dealing 15 cold damage to the brazier or dousing it with at least 2 gallons of water extinguishes the coals. This prevents the statue from using Burn Alive and causes its ranged attacks to no longer deal {@damage 2d8} fire damage.
bot.name: Brazier

entries: The statue grinds a creature it has {@condition grabbed} into the red-hot coals of its brazier. The target takes {@damage 3d8} fire damage and {@damage 1d8} {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire damage}.
bot.name: Burn Alive

entries: A bat can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.
top.name: Echolocation

mid.trigger: An adjacent enemy damages the giant bat.
entries: The bat makes one or two wing {@action Strike||Strikes}—one against the triggering creature and one against another adjacent creature.
mid.name: Wing Thrash

entries: When a giant eagle rolls a success on a Reflex save, it gets a critical success instead.
mid.name: Evasion

entries: The giant eagle Flies up to double its fly Speed in a straight line, descending at least 10 feet, and then makes a talon {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Eagle Dive

entries: A giant eagle can {@action Fly} at half Speed while it has a creature {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} in its talons, carrying that creature along with it.
bot.name: Snatch

attacks.name: leaf
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d8+7} piercing plus {@damage 2d6} acid and {@ability Improved Grab}

entries: The flytrap makes a leaf {@action Strike} against the triggering creature. If it hits, the creature is {@condition grabbed} in that leaf.
mid.name: Quick Capture
mid.trigger: A creature hits or touches the flytrap.

entries: The flytrap attacks a single target all four of its leaves. The flytrap makes one leaf {@action Strike}. On a success, the flytrap deals the damage from one leaf {@action Strike} plus an additional {@dice 1d8} damage for every leaf beyond the first. On a failure, the flytrap deals the damage from one leaf {@action Strike}, but it can't use {@ability Improved Grab}. It deals no damage on a critical failure. This counts toward the flytrap's multiple attack penalty as a number of attacks equal to the number of leaves the flytrap has.
bot.name: Focused Assault

entries: The flytrap makes four leaf {@action Strike||Strikes} at a –2 penalty, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the flytrap's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all its attacks.
bot.name: Hungry Flurry

entries: Large, {@damage 2d8+3} bludgeoning plus {@damage 2d6} acid, Rupture 17.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: The giant frilled lizard {@action Stride||Strides}. If it ends that {@action Stride} adjacent to at least one other creature, it suddenly displays its colorful neck frills and issues a frightening hiss. Each adjacent creature must succeed at a DC 21 Will save or become {@condition frightened 2} (or {@condition frightened 3} on a critical failure). The creature is then temporarily immune to Intimidating Display for 1 minute.
bot.name: Intimidating Display

entries: A giant gecko's feet allow it to climb virtually any surface, no matter how slick or sheer. If a giant gecko attempts an {@skill Athletics} check to climb and critically fails, it gets a failure instead.
top.name: Uncanny Climber

bot.trigger: The giant mantis Grabs a creature with its leg.
entries: The mantis pulls the creature adjacent to it, then makes a mandibles {@action Strike} against the creature.
bot.name: Deadly Mandibles

entries: The giant mantis lunges forward, making a leg {@action Strike} with an extended reach of 20 feet.
bot.name: Lunging Strike

entries: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted are {@condition flat-footed} to the giant mantis.
bot.name: Sudden Strike

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d10+3} piercing plus Grab and monitor lizard venom

mid.trigger: A creature {@condition grabbed} by the giant monitor lizard's jaws fails a check to {@action Escape}.
entries: The giant monitor lizard's jaws deal {@damage 1d6} piercing damage and the triggering creature is exposed to monitor lizard venom.
mid.name: Gnashing Grip

entries: The giant monitor lizard {@action Stride||Strides} twice and then makes a jaws {@action Strike}. If the lizard moved at least 20 feet away from its starting position, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to this attack roll.
bot.name: Lurching Charge

mid.trigger: A target creature passes within 20 feet of the giant moray eel's hiding place and has not detected the giant moray eel.
entries: The giant moray eel lunges out of its hiding place, Swims directly toward the triggering creature, and makes a jaws {@action Strike} against it. The target creature is {@condition flat-footed} to this attack.
mid.name: Ambush

bot.requirements: The giant moray eel has a creature {@condition grabbed} in its jaws.
entries: The giant moray eel uses its second set of jaws to pull the prey into its gullet. The eel deals {@damage 1d6+4} piercing damage to the {@condition grabbed} creature and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its Swallow Whole attempts and to the DC for the creature to {@action Escape}. This effect ends if the target {@action Escape||Escapes} or the giant moray eel Swallows it Whole.
bot.name: Pharyngeal Jaws

entries: Small, {@damage 1d6+6} bludgeoning, Rupture 12.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: A giant octopus can move through a gap at least 2 feet wide without {@action Squeeze||Squeezing}, and can {@action Squeeze} through a gap at least 1 foot wide.
bot.name: Compression

entries: {@damage 1d8+9} bludgeoning.
bot.name: Constrict

entries: The octopus emits a cloud of black ink in a 30-foot emanation. This cloud has no effect outside of water. Creatures inside the cloud are {@condition undetected} and can't use their sense of smell. The cloud dissipates after 1 minute. The octopus can't use Ink Cloud again for {@dice 2d6} rounds.
bot.name: Ink Cloud

entries: The octopus moves up to 200 feet in a straight line through the water without triggering reactions.
bot.name: Jet

entries: The giant octopus makes up to four {@action Strike||Strikes} with different arms, each against a different target. Each attack counts separately for the octopus's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase the penalty until the octopus has made all the attacks. If the octopus subsequently uses the Grab action, it can Grab any number of creatures it hit with Writhing Arms.
bot.name: Writhing Arms

bot.note: The {@condition sickened} and {@condition unconscious} conditions from filth fever don't improve on their own until the disease is cured.
bot.name: Filth Fever

entries: Stinger only.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: {@damage 1d6+4} bludgeoning, DC 20
bot.name: Constrict

entries: Medium or smaller, foot, DC 21
bot.name: Trample

entries: The tarantula flicks its legs, flinging spiky hairs in a 15-foot cone. This deals {@damage 4d6} piercing damage with a DC 25 basic Reflex save.
bot.name: Hair Barrage

entries: As {@action Attack of Opportunity}, but the snake can use this reaction only if it's Coiled.
mid.name: Coiled Opportunity
mid.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

entries: The giant viper uses an action to coil itself, increasing its reach with its fangs from 5 to 10 feet. After the giant viper {@action Strike||Strikes} with its fangs, it becomes uncoiled.
bot.name: Coil

entries: The giant wasp lays eggs in an adjacent creature that is {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition unconscious}, exposing it to the wasp larva disease.
bot.name: Implant Eggs

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d8+5} piercing plus {@damage 1d4} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} and Grab

entries: Each creature that begins its turn within 60 feet of a gibbering mouther must attempt a DC 19 Will save. On a failure, they are {@condition confused} for 1 round. On a success, they are temporarily immune for 1 minute.
mid.name: Gibbering

mid.trigger: An adjacent creature deals the gibbering mouther slashing damage.
entries: The gibbering mouther's wound opens into another maw. It makes a jaws {@action Strike} against the triggering creature.
mid.name: Reactive Gnaw

entries: A creature that takes damage from a gibbering mouther's spittle must succeed at a DC 22 Fortitude save or be {@condition dazzled} for 1 round (or {@condition blinded} for 1 round on a critical failure).
bot.name: Burn Eyes

entries: DC 22, {@damage 3d8} piercing, {@action Escape} DC 22, Rupture 8.
bot.name: Engulf

entries: The gibbering mouther causes stone and earth under its body to grow soft and muddy, remaining so for 1 minute after the mouther moves off the location. A gibbering mouther can move through these areas with ease, but other creatures treat them as {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain}.
bot.name: Ground Manipulation

entries: Hungersense allows the gimmerling to sense creatures that require food to live.
top.name: Hungersense

entries: 15 feet. Tangled roots, jagged divots, sharp rocks and other hazards appear on surfaces in the aura, creating {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain}.
mid.name: Treacherous Aura

mid.trigger: A creature critically fails a melee attack to hit the gimmerling or moves into a space within the gimmerling's treacherous aura.
entries: The triggering creature must attempt a DC 32 Reflex save.

entries.Success: The target is {@condition flat-footed} until the start of its next turn.
entries.Failure: The target takes {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage and is {@condition flat-footed} until the start of its next turn.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, and the target is knocked {@condition prone}.

mid.name: Trip Up

entries: The gimmerling changes into its natural form or that of any humanoid. In humanoid form, it loses its treacherous aura, and its equipment appears to be trinkets or toys. As a humanoid that lacks claws or fangs, it loses the matching {@action Strike}. If it loses its claw {@action Strike}, it gains a fist {@action Strike} that is identical except that it deals bludgeoning damage.
bot.name: Change Shape

bot.requirements: The gimmerling's last action was a success with a {@action Strike} that has {@action Disarm} in its damage entry.
entries: The gimmerling knocks a held or carried weapon to the ground in the target's space.
bot.name: Disarm

entries: The gimmerling deals {@dice 2d6} extra precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: The gimmerling ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} and doesn't trigger traps with its movement.
bot.name: Trickster's Step

abilities: +1 status bonus to all saves vs. magic

mid.name: Aura of Peace
entries: 50 feet. A creature that starts its turn in the aura must attempt a DC 37 Will save or be affected by {@spell calm emotions}. Creatures that successfully save are unaffected, but must attempt another save each turn they start in the aura.

mid.name: Sacrilegious Aura
entries: 30 feet. +17

bot.name: Devastating Blast
entries: {@damage 6d12} cold, DC 29

bot.name: Phantom Mount
entries: HP 58; AC 27,

A glabrezu's lies sustain them, and the truth can destroy them. Whenever a {@trait revelation} effect counteracts or reveals the glabrezu's illusions or the glabrezu fails a save against an effect that would prevent them from lying (such as zone of truth), the demon takes {@damage 3d6} mental damage. They take this damage only once per effect, even if the effect reveals multiple illusions or prevents multiple lies.
mid.name: Truth Vulnerability

bot.requirements: A creature is {@condition grabbed} in the glabrezu's pincer.
entries: The glabrezu pulls the {@condition grabbed} creature up to 5 feet closer, then makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} against it. Those {@action Strike||Strikes} count as one attack when determining a treachery demon's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after both {@action Strike||Strikes}.
bot.name: Captive Rake

entries: When a reaction would disrupt a glabrezu's spell, the demon can attempt a DC {@flatDC 15} flat check, avoiding the disruption on a success.
bot.name: Steady Spellcasting

entries: A glabrezu can always use {@skill Deception} when rolling initiative as long as they're aware of at least one opponent before initiative is rolled. When using {@skill Deception} for initiative, the demon gains a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Deception}.
bot.name: Sudden Betrayal

entries: A glabrezu's illusory disguise can allow it to appear as a creature of any size.
bot.name: Treacherous Veil

entries: Once per month, a glabrezu can grant a mortal humanoid the effects of a {@spell miracle} spell granted by an Abyssal patron, though the glabrezu always perverts the miracle according to their own treacherous nature.
bot.name: Twisted Desires

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: A gnoll hunter deals {@damage 1d4} extra damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the gnoll hunter's allies.
bot.name: Pack Attack

entries: A gnoll ignores the first square of {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} it moves into each time it {@action Step||Steps} or {@action Stride||Strides}.
bot.name: Rugged Travel

entries: A gnoll hunter deals {@damage 1d4} extra damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the gnoll hunter's allies.
bot.name: Pack Attack

entries: A gnoll ignores the first square of {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} it moves into each time it {@action Step||Steps} or {@action Stride||Strides}.
bot.name: Rugged Travel

entries: The gnoll sergeant commands its allies to reposition. Any allies who hear and understand this order can use a reaction to {@action Step}.
bot.name: Bark Orders

entries: A gnoll hunter deals {@damage 1d4} extra damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the gnoll hunter's allies.
bot.name: Pack Attack

entries: A gnoll ignores the first square of {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} it moves into each time it {@action Step||Steps} or {@action Stride||Strides}.
bot.name: Rugged Travel

entries: The goblin commando {@action Step||Steps}.
mid.name: Goblin Scuttle
mid.trigger: A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to the commando.

entries: DC 17
mid.name: Buck

entries: A creature that hits the goblin dog with an unarmed attack, tries to {@action Grapple} it, or otherwise touches it is exposed to goblin pox.
mid.name: Irritating Dander

mid.trigger: The rider issues a command to the goblin dog.
mid.requirements: A creature must be mounted on the goblin dog.
entries: The goblin dog {@action Step||Steps} before following the command.
mid.name: Juke

bot.name: Goblin Pox
bot.note: Goblins and goblin dogs are immune to goblin pox.

stages.entry: {@condition sickened 2} and can't reduce its {@condition sickened} value below 1.

entries: The goblin dog vigorously scratches itself, exposing all adjacent creatures to goblin pox.
bot.name: Scratch

entries: The goblin pyro {@action Step||Steps}.
mid.name: Goblin Scuttle
mid.trigger: A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to the pyro.

entries: The goblin war chanter {@action Step||Steps}.
mid.name: Goblin Scuttle
mid.trigger: A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to the war chanter.

entries: The war chanter sings annoying goblin songs, distracting foes with silly and repetitive lyrics. The chanter attempts a {@skill Performance} check against the Will DCs of up to two enemies within 30 feet. This has the usual traits and restrictions for a {@skill Performance} check.

entries.Critical Success: The target takes a –1 status penalty to {@skill Perception} checks and Will saves for 1 minute.
entries.Success: As critical success, but the target is affected for only 1 round.
entries.Critical Failure: The target is temporarily immune to Goblin Song for 1 hour.

bot.name: Goblin Song

mid.trigger: A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to the warrior.
entries: The goblin warrior {@action Step||Steps}.
mid.name: Goblin Scuttle

mid.trigger: A creature that starts its move outside the gogiteth's reach moves into its reach.
entries: The gogiteth moves 10 feet. This does not trigger reactions.
mid.name: Skittering Reposition

entries: The gogiteth can move at its full Speed while it has a creature {@condition grabbed} in its jaws, bringing the {@condition grabbed} creature along.
bot.name: Carry Off Prey

entries: {@damage 3d6+12} bludgeoning, DC 32
bot.name: Constrict

entries: The gogiteth {@action Stride||Strides} three times. Once per {@action Stride}, it can attempt a leg {@action Strike} against a creature in its reach at any point during the {@action Stride}; it must make each attack against a different creature, but it doesn't apply its multiple attack penalty until after making all its {@action Strike||Strikes}. If any of the {@action Strike||Strikes} result in a critical failure, Skittering Assault ends.
bot.name: Skittering Assault

entries: The spider swarm has imprecise {@ability tremorsense} to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its web.
top.name: Web Sense

entries: The goliath spider automatically notices the creature and {@action Stride||Strides}, Climbs, or Descends on a Web before it rolls initiative.
mid.name: Spring Upon Prey
mid.trigger: A creature touches the goliath spider's web while the spider is on it.
mid.requirements: Initiative has not yet been rolled.

bot.name: Descend on a Web
entries: The goliath spider moves straight down up to 120 feet, suspended by a web line. It can hang from the web or drop off. The distance it Descends on a Web doesn't count for falling damage. A creature that successfully {@action Strike||Strikes} the web (AC 20, Hardness 5, 20 HP) severs it, causing the spider to fall.

A creature hit by the spider's web {@action Strike} is {@condition restrained} and tethered to the spider, preventing it from moving farther away from the spider. The spider can have one creature tethered at a time. The DC to {@action Escape} or {@action Force Open} the web is 30. The tether can be severed with a {@action Strike} (AC 20, Hardness 5, HP 20), but this doesn't free the {@condition restrained} creature.
bot.name: Web Tether

entries: The gorilla beats its chest in a terrifying display. Creatures within 30 feet must attempt a DC 20 Will save. While a creature is {@condition frightened} by this ability, it is {@condition flat-footed} to the gorilla.

entries.Critical Success: No effect and temporarily immune for 1 minute.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened 1}.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened 2}.

bot.name: Frightening Display

entries: The leshy can store an item of light Bulk or less in its head, concealing it as nondetection. If stored for 24 hours, the item benefits from mending.
top.name: Keepsake

entries: As leaf leshy, except plants regain {@dice 1d8} Hit Points and the area sprouts gourds instead of tree saplings.
mid.name: Verdant Burst

entries: As leaf leshy, except the gourd leshy transforms into a gourd-bearing plant.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: When the gourd leshy damages a creature with a fist or seed {@action Strike}, vines lash out from the leshy (or seed) and wrap around the target's limbs. The target must attempt a DC 17 Reflex save. On a failure, the target takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speed for 1 round; on a critical failure, the target is {@condition immobilized} for 1 round and the penalty to Speed lasts for 1 minute.
bot.name: Ensnare

mid.trigger: The great cyclops succeeds at an attack roll.

frequency.special: once per day, and recharges when the great cyclops uses Ferocity

entries: The attack becomes a critical success.
mid.name: Flash of Brutality

entries: The great cyclops {@action Stride||Strides} twice and makes a horn {@action Strike}. If it moved at least 20 feet away from its starting position, the {@action Strike}'s damage is increased to {@dice 3d10+20}.
bot.name: Powerful Charge

entries: The shark can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.
top.name: Blood Scent

entries: The shark Swims up to its swim Speed, then Leaps vertically out of the water up to 25 feet high, making a {@action Strike} against a creature at any point during the jump (this lets it attack a creature within 30 feet of the water's surface). After the {@action Strike}, the shark splashes back down into the water.
bot.name: Breach

bot.requirements: The shark hit with a jaws {@action Strike} on its most recent action this turn.
entries: The creature the shark hit takes {@damage 1d12} slashing damage.
bot.name: Savage
Strafing Chomp
entries: The shark Swims up to half its swim Speed, makes a jaws {@action Strike}, and then Swims up to half its Speed further. The {@action Strike} deals half damage.

The barghest takes on the shape of a goblinoid (a goblin, hobgoblin, or bugbear) or a wolf, or it transforms back into its true form. When the barghest is a goblinoid, it loses its jaws and claw {@action Strike||Strikes}, it becomes Small if it is a goblin, and its Speed changes to 20 feet. When the barghest is a wolf, its Speed changes to 40 feet and its jaws gain Knockdown. Each individual barghest has only one goblinoid form and one wolf form.
bot.name: Change Shape

bot.trigger: The barghest completes a {@action Strike}.
entries: The process of consuming corpses to evolve into a greater barghest results in odd and unpredictable physiological changes. A greater barghest has one mutation, typically chosen from the following options.

items: {@bold Fangs} (poison) The barghest grows elongated fangs that seep poison. Its jaws deal {@dice 1d6} additional poison damage and {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent poison damage}.

{@bold Toxic Breath} (divine, evocation, poison) The barghest breathes a cloud of toxic gas that deals {@damage 8d6} poison damage to all creatures in a 30-foot cone (DC 25 basic Fortitude save). It can't use Toxic Breath again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

{@bold Vestigial Arm Strike} {@as F} Frequency once per round; The barghest makes a claw {@action Strike} with a shriveled third arm hanging from its torso. This attack doesn't count for the barghest's multiple attack penalty, nor does that penalty apply on the attack.
{@bold Wings} The barghest has malformed wings extending from its back. It gains a fly Speed of 25 feet.

bot.name: Mutations

entries: 20 feet. The nightmare continually exhales black smoke that creates concealment in an aura around it. Nightmares and their riders can see through this smoke. A creature that begins its turn in the area becomes {@condition sickened 2} (DC 28 Fortitude negates) and is then temporarily immune sickness from the smoke for 1 minute. The nightmare, its rider, any creature currently holding its breath (or that does not need to breathe), and any creature immune to poison are immune to the aura's {@condition sickened} effect but not the concealment.
top.name: Smoke

entries: The nightmare {@action Stride||Strides} or Flies up to triple its Speed. Its hooves burst with intense flame, dealing {@damage 6d6} fire damage (DC 30 basic Reflex save) once to each creature other than the nightmare's rider that the nightmare moves adjacent to during its gallop.
bot.name: Flaming Gallop

entries: Large or smaller, hoof, DC 30
bot.name: Trample

entries: An object shedding magical light (such as from the {@spell light} spell) is treated as magical when used to attack the shadow.
mid.name: Light Vulnerability

entries: When a creature's shadow is pulled free by Steal Shadow, it becomes a shadow spawn under the command of the shadow that created it. This shadow spawn doesn't have Steal Shadow. If the creature the shadow spawn was pulled from dies, the shadow spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous shadow. If the creature recovers from its enfeeblement, its shadow returns to it and the shadow spawn is extinguished.
bot.name: Shadow Spawn

entries: The shadow can {@action Hide} or end its {@action Sneak} in a creature's or object's shadow.
bot.name: Slink in Shadows

bot.requirements: The shadow hit a living creature with a shadow hand {@action Strike} on its previous action
entries: The shadow pulls at the target's shadow, making the creature {@condition enfeebled 2} (or {@condition enfeebled 3} on a critical hit). This is cumulative with other {@condition enfeebled} conditions from shadows, to a maximum of {@condition enfeebled 4}. If this increases a creature's {@condition enfeebled} value to 3 or more, the target's shadow is separated from its body (see shadow spawn). {@condition Enfeebled} from Steal Shadow decreases by 1 every hour.
bot.name: Steal Shadow

resistances.name: all
resistances.note: (except force, {@item ghost touch}, or positive; double resistance against non-magical)

entries: A green hag adds entangle, outcast's curse, and wall of thorns to her coven's spells.
top.name: Coven

entries: A green hag who succeeds at a {@skill Deception} check to {@action Lie} can mimic the sounds of any animal found near her lair. She has a +4 circumstance bonus to this check.
mid.name: Sound Imitation

entries: The green hag touches a creature that doesn't realize the hag is an enemy. The betrayed creature is affected by the hag's enfeebling humors and takes a –4 circumstance penalty to their saving throw against that effect.
bot.name: Betraying Touch

entries: The green hag can take on the appearance of any Medium humanoid woman. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her {@action Strike||Strikes}, but might change the damage type her {@action Strike||Strikes} deal (typically to bludgeoning).
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: A creature damaged by a hag's claw must succeed at a DC 20 Fortitude save or be {@condition enfeebled 1} for 1 day. On a critical failure, or if it gets hit again and fails its save a second time, it's {@condition enfeebled 2} for 1 day.
bot.name: Enfeebling Humors

entries: The green hag exhales a miasma of green vapors. Each living creature in a 15-foot cone is affected by her enfeebling humors (attempting a save as normal). She can't use Exhale Miasma again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Exhale Miasma

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: The griffon Flies up to its fly Speed and makes two talon {@action Strike||Strikes} at any point during that movement. Each {@action Strike} must target a different creature. The attacks take the normal multiple attack penalty.
bot.name: Flying Strafe

entries: The griffon {@action Stride||Strides} and makes a talon {@action Strike} at the end of that movement. If the griffon began this action {@condition hidden}, it remains {@condition hidden} until after the attack.
bot.name: Pounce

entries: A grig can rub its legs together to create a catchy fiddling tune that compels others within 30 feet to dance about, with varying effects depending on a DC 18 Will save. A listener is temporarily immune for 10 minutes on a success, but otherwise, if the grig continues to Fiddle each round, the creature receives no additional saves.

entries.Failure: {@condition Flat-footed} and –10-foot status penalty to Speeds.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, and also {@condition slowed 1}.

bot.name: Fiddle

entries: The grikkitog implants its core into an adjacent section of earth or stone, melding seamlessly and changing its visual appearance to match the surrounding rock. It's {@condition immobilized} but automatically succeeds at its {@skill Deception} check to {@action Impersonate} the stone around it; creatures actively searching for it can still attempt {@skill Perception} checks against its {@skill Deception} DC as normal. A grikkitog can release its implantation as a free action, which has the {@trait manipulate} trait. A grikkitog's infestation aura and manifold vision are only active while implanted.
top.name: Implant Core

entries: While its core is implanted, the grikkitog can see through the eyes it creates throughout the area of its infestation aura, gaining the benefits of all-around vision.
top.name: Manifold Vision

entries: 120 feet. While its core is implanted, a grikkitog infests all earth and stone within 120 feet, as long as there is a contiguous physical connection between the earth, including stone objects touching on the ground. This effect spreads even if the grikkitog does not have line of effect, though it can affect earth or stone on the surface and exposed to the air only if at least part of its core is exposed as well. Within the aura, it can grow maws and eyes everywhere. It can make jaws attacks against any creature, originating from any earth or stone in the aura adjacent to that creature. Determine cover from the origin point of the attack, not from the grikkitog's core.
mid.name: Infestation Aura

entries: Striking a creature with its jaws, the grikkitog can extend its barbed teeth, immobilizing the target unless it succeeds at a DC 34 Reflex save. While {@condition immobilized}, the victim takes {@damage 3d8} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} and the grikkitog feeds upon its flesh. The creature is {@condition immobilized} until the grikkitog ends the effect as a free action or the target succeeds at a DC 38 check to {@action Escape}. The grikkitog can immobilize any number of creatures with these maws.
bot.name: Barbed Maw Upon

entries: The grikkitog can {@action Burrow} through dirt and stone at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.
bot.name: Earth Glide

attacks.name: keen scythe
attacks.damage: {@damage 4d10+23} slashing plus death strike and energy drain

entries: The grim reaper can choose whether or not it counts as undead for effects that affect undead differently. Even if it does not count as undead, the grim reaper still never counts as a living creature.
top.name: Death's Grace

entries: The grim reaper automatically knows the Hit Points, conditions, afflictions, and emotions of all creatures it can see.
top.name: Status Sight

entries: 20 feet. Living creatures in the aura must roll twice on all d20 rolls and use the lower result.
mid.name: Aura of Misfortune

entries: The grim reaper can choose whether or not it takes positive damage.
mid.name: Negative Healing

mid.trigger: A creature within 100 feet makes a ranged attack or uses an action that has the concentrate, {@trait manipulate}, or {@trait move} trait.
entries: The grim reaper teleports to a square adjacent to the triggering creature and makes a melee {@action Strike} against it. If the {@action Strike} hits, the grim reaper disrupts the triggering action.
mid.name: Lurking Death

entries: A creature critically hit by any of the grim reaper's attacks or that critically fails against any of its spells must succeed at a DC 47 Fortitude save or die.
bot.name: Death Strike

entries: When the grim reaper hits and deals damage with its scythe, it regains 20 Hit Points, and the target must succeed at a DC 43 Fortitude save or become {@condition doomed 1}. If the target is already {@condition doomed}, the {@condition doomed} value increases by 1 (to a maximum of {@condition doomed 3}).
bot.name: Energy Drain

entries: A creature killed by the grim reaper can't be brought back to life by any means short of divine intervention.
bot.name: Final Death

entries: Any scythe gains the {@trait agile} trait, can't be disarmed, and becomes a +3 major striking keen scythe while the grim reaper wields it. If the grim reaper {@action Strike||Strikes} a creature with a weakness to any specific type of damage, the scythe's damage counts as that type of damage, in addition to slashing.
bot.name: Infuse Weapon

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: The grizzly bear gains a +2 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures it has {@condition grabbed}.
bot.name: Mauler

entries: The grizzly bear {@action Stride||Strides} and makes a {@action Strike} at the end of that movement. During the {@action Stride}, the grizzly bear gains a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed.
bot.name: Rush

attacks.name: digestive spew
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d6} acid damage plus {@dice 1d6} splash acid damage

entries: When the grothlut is reduced to 0 Hit Points, its digestive organs rupture, unleashing alchemical acid and poison upon all creatures in a 30-foot emanation. Each creature in the area must succeed at a DC 19 Fortitude save or take {@damage 2d6} acid damage and become {@condition sickened 1} (double damage and {@condition sickened 2} on a critical failure).
mid.name: Disgusting Demise

entries: 60 feet. Each non-grothlut creature that enters or starts its turn within the area must succeed at a DC 17 Will saving throw or become {@condition sickened 1} ({@condition sickened 2} on a critical failure). The creature then becomes temporarily immune for 1 minute. The grothlut can activate or deactivate the aura by using a single free action that has the {@trait concentrate} trait. A grothlut usually does not begin moaning until it senses the presence of a non-grothlut creature, and it usually stops once it doesn't sense any more such creatures.
mid.name: Piteous Moan

entries: The dog's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal {@damage 1d4} extra damage to creatures within the reach of at least two of the dog's allies.
bot.name: Pack Attack

entries: Despite its size, the gug's multiple joints allow it to fit through tight spaces as if it were a Medium creature. While {@action Squeeze||Squeezing}, it can move at its full Speed.
bot.name: Eerie Flexibility

entries: The gug makes up to four claw {@action Strike||Strikes}, each against a different target. These attacks all count toward the gug's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after the gug makes all its attacks.
bot.name: Furious Claws

attacks.name: fist
attacks.damage: {@damage 4d12+18} bludgeoning plus {@ability Improved Grab} or Improved Push 20 feet

entries: 120 feet. The guthallath erodes away the physical integrity of all around it. Creatures and objects in the emanation other than the guthallath have their hardness and resistances reduced by 10. At the start of its turn, a creature in the erosion aura's area takes {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage (basic Fortitude DC 39).
mid.name: Erosion Aura

entries: The guthallath is immune to spells of lower than 7th level and the activated effects of magic items of lower than 14th level.
mid.name: Immunity to Magic

entries: A guthallath releases two beams of destruction from its eyes. Each beam is a 120-foot line. Everything in either line takes the effect of a hit from a 10th-level {@spell disintegrate} spell (DC 41 Fortitude). There is no additional effect on creatures in any area where the beams overlap. The guthallath can't use this ability again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Annihilation Beams
