bot.requirements: The guthallath has a creature {@condition grabbed}.
entries: The guthallath throws the creature into the air, 100 feet high and 50 feet away. If the flung creature lands on another creature, the creature it lands on takes the same amount of bludgeoning damage. The creature being landed on can attempt a DC 41 basic Reflex save.
bot.name: Deadly Throw

entries: If a guthallath hits with an attack and rolls a natural 19 on the d20 roll, the attack is a critical hit. This has no effect if the 19 would be a failure.
bot.name: Powerful Blows

entries: Huge or smaller, foot, DC 45
bot.name: Trample

entries: The harpy cries out an eerie, compelling melody. Each non-harpy creature within a 300-foot aura must attempt a DC 21 Will save to avoid becoming captivated by the harpy's song. The effect lasts for 1 round, but if the harpy uses this ability again on subsequent rounds, it extends the duration by 1 round for all affected creatures. Once a creature succeeds at any save against Captivating Song, that creature is temporarily immune to Captivating Songs for 24 hours.

entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition fascinated}, and it must spend each of its actions to move closer to the harpy as expediently as possible, while avoiding obvious dangers. If a captivated creature is adjacent to the harpy, it stays still and doesn't act. If attacked by the harpy, the creature is freed from captivation at the end of the harpy's turn.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but if attacked by the harpy, the creature can attempt a new save at the start of its next turn, rather than being freed at the end of the harpy's turn.

bot.name: Captivating Song

entries: The hell hound breathes flames that deal {@damage 4d6} fire damage to all creatures in a 15-foot cone (DC 19 basic Reflex save). The hell hound can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds. If the hell hound would take fire damage or be targeted by a {@trait fire} effect, its Breath Weapon recharges.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The hill giant makes a single greatclub {@action Strike} and compares the attack roll result to the ACs of up to two foes within its reach. This counts as two attacks for the hill giant's multiple attack penalty.
bot.name: Wide Swing

entries: The hive mother makes a mandibles {@action Strike}; if the {@action Strike} hits, the target's armor takes the damage and the acid damage bypasses the armor's Hardness.
bot.name: Armor-Rending Bite

entries: The hive mother unleashes a pheromone that causes all other ankhravs within a 100-foot emanation to become {@condition quickened 1} until the start of the hive mother's next turn, and they can use the extra action only for {@action Burrow}, {@action Stride}, or {@action Strike} actions. The hive mother can't unleash the pheromone again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Frenzy Pheromone

entries: The hive mother spews acid in a 60-foot cone, dealing {@damage 8d6} acid damage and {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent acid damage} (DC 26 basic Reflex save). It can't spew acid again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Spray Acid

entries: When it's adjacent to at least two other allies, the hobgoblin archer gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saving throws. This bonus increases to +2 to Reflex saves against area effects.
mid.name: Formation

entries: The first time the archer hits with a crossbow attack in a round, it deals {@dice 1d8} extra precision damage.
bot.name: Crossbow Precision

entries: The hobgoblin archer ignores the {@condition concealed} condition. Their targets don't benefit from lesser cover, and they reduce the AC bonus from standard cover by 2 against the hobgoblin archer's attack.
bot.name: Perfect Aim

entries: The archer {@action Stride||Strides}, {@action Step||Steps}, or {@action Sneak||Sneaks}, then Interacts to reload.
bot.name: Running Reload

entries: When a hobgoblin general rolls initiative, as long as they can perceive at least one foe, they can yell a mighty battle cry. The hobgoblin general attempts an Intimidate check to {@action Demoralize} a single foe within 60 feet as a free action. If successful, any ally with the {@trait goblin} trait can, as its first action on its first turn of the combat, {@action Stride} up to double its speed as a single action.
top.name: General's Cry

entries: When it's adjacent to at least two other allies, the hobgoblin general gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saving throws. This bonus increases to +2 to Reflex saves against area effects.
mid.name: Formation

entries: On a critical hit, the target of the critical hit is moved 5 feet in a direction of the hobgoblin general's choice.
bot.name: Polearm Critical Specialization

entries: When it's adjacent to at least two other allies, the hobgoblin soldier gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saving throws. This bonus increases to +2 to Reflex saves against area effects.
mid.name: Formation

entries: A homunculus can't speak, but it is telepathically linked to its creator. It can share information back and forth, including its master's knowledge and everything the homunculus hears. The range of this link is 1,500 feet. The homunculus adopts the same alignment as its creator and is utterly faithful. If the homunculus is destroyed, the master takes {@damage 2d10} mental damage. If the master is slain, the homunculus becomes mindless, claims its current location as its lair, and instinctively attacks anyone who comes near.
top.name: Master Link

bot.name: Homunculus Poison
bot.note: A homunculus has one dose of poison in a reservoir in its head. It can refill this poison from its reserves with an {@action Interact} action.

entries: 30 feet. Enemies that start their turn in the area or enter it must attempt a DC 19 Will save. On a failure, they take a –1 status penalty to attack rolls, spell rolls, and damage rolls against any other target while in the aura for 24 hours or until they damage the archon, whichever comes first. On a critical failure, they can't use {@condition hostile} actions against any other target while in the area for 24 hours or until they damage the archon, whichever comes first. Regardless of the result, a creature is then temporarily immune to further menacing guardian auras for 24 hours.
mid.name: Menacing Guardian

entries: A horned archon can also make a {@action Retributive Strike} with its composite longbow.
mid.name: Retributive Strike

entries: Once per day, if an archon sees another creature cast {@spell dimension door}, it can cast an innate dimension door (heightened to 5th level) within 1 round to attempt to follow that creature to the maximum distance of the archon's dimension door. If the archon's dimension door has enough distance, the archon appears the same distance and direction from the creature as before either used dimension door.
bot.name: Archon's Door

entries: A horned archon can touch another creature to take on that creature's wounds, transferring up to 30 of the horned archon's HP to the touched creature. The horned archon can't transfer more HP than it currently has.
bot.name: Touch of Charity

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: The spider swarm has imprecise {@ability tremorsense} to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its web.
top.name: Web Sense

mid.trigger: A creature touches the hunting spider's web while the spider is on it.
mid.requirements: Initiative has not yet been rolled.
entries: The hunting spider automatically notices the creature and {@action Stride||Strides}, Climbs, or Descends on a Web before it rolls initiative.
mid.name: Spring Upon Prey

bot.name: Descend on a Web
entries: The hunting spider moves straight down up to 40 feet, suspended by a web line. It can hang from the web or drop off. The distance it Descends on a Web doesn't count for falling damage. A creature that successfully {@action Strike||Strikes} the web (AC 20, Hardness 3, 5 HP) severs it, causing the spider to fall.
A creature hit by the hunting spider's web attack is {@condition immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface until it {@action Escape||Escapes} (DC 17).
bot.name: Web Trap

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d10+5} piercing plus Knockdown and bonecrunching bite

entries: A creature that is critically hit by a hyaenodon must succeed at a DC 20 Fortitude save or become {@condition wounded 1} as the creature's bones or cartilage are crushed by the beast's jaws.
bot.name: Bonecrunching Bite

entries: The hyena makes a jaws {@action Strike} against a {@condition prone} enemy. If it hits, in addition to dealing damage, the hyena {@action Stride||Strides} up to 10 feet, dragging the enemy along.
bot.name: Drag

entries: The hyaenodon deals an extra {@dice 1d6} damage to any creature within reach of at least two of the hyaenodon's allies.
bot.name: Pack Attack

entries: A hydra ordinarily has five heads. A creature can attempt to sever one of the hydra's heads by specifically targeting it and dealing damage equal to the head's Hit Points. A head that is not completely severed returns to full Hit Points at the end of any creature's turn.

A hydra can regrow a severed head using Hydra Regeneration. A creature can prevent this regrowth by dealing acid or fire damage to the stump, cauterizing it. Single-target {@trait acid} or {@trait fire} effects need to be targeted at a specific stump, but effects that deal splash damage or affect areas covering the hydra's whole space cauterize all stumps if they deal acid or fire damage. If the attack that severs a head deals any acid or fire damage, the stump is cauterized instantly. If all five heads are cauterized, the hydra dies.
mid.name: Head Regrowth

entries: The hydra has regeneration equal to 3  the number of heads it has. If a hydra's body is missing any heads and the remaining stumps have not been cauterized, the hydra attempts a DC 25 Fortitude save after it regains Hit Points from regeneration. On a success, one uncauterized stump regrows two heads; on a critical success, two uncauterized stumps regrow into two heads each. The hydra can never grow more than double the number of heads it ordinarily has. The hydra's regeneration only fully deactivates if all its heads are severed and all stumps are cauterized, at which point it dies.
mid.name: Hydra Regeneration

entries: A hydra gains an extra reaction per round for each of its heads beyond the first, which it can use only to make Attacks of Opportunity. It can't use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares within its reach, and the hydra must use a different head for each {@action Attack of Opportunity} it makes. Whenever one of the hydra's heads is severed, the hydra loses 1 of its extra reactions per round.
mid.name: Multiple Opportunities

entries: The hydra attacks a single target with its heads, overwhelming its foe with multiple attacks and leaving almost nowhere to dodge. The hydra {@action Strike||Strikes} with its fangs. On a successful attack, the hydra deals damage from its fangs {@action Strike} to the target, plus an additional {@dice 1d6} damage for every head it has beyond the first. Even on a failed attack, the hydra deals the damage from one fangs {@action Strike} to the target creature, though it still misses completely on a critical failure. This counts toward the hydra's multiple attack penalty as a number of attacks equal to the number of heads the hydra has.
bot.name: Focused Assault

entries: The hydra makes a number of {@action Strike||Strikes} up to its number of heads, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the hydra's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after the hydra makes all its attacks.
bot.name: Storm of Jaws

entries: The hyena makes a jaws {@action Strike} against a {@condition prone} enemy. If it hits, in addition to dealing damage, the hyena {@action Stride||Strides} up to 10 feet, dragging the enemy along.
bot.name: Drag

entries: The hyena deals an extra {@dice 1d4} damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the hyena's allies.
bot.name: Pack Attack

entries: When a creature slays an ice linnorm, it must succeed at a DC 40 Will save or permanently gain weakness to cold 15.
mid.name: Curse of Frost

entries: Tail only.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: The ice linnorm spews out a blast of freezing, viscous ooze in a 60-foot cone that deals {@damage 15d6} cold damage to creatures within the area (DC 38 basic Reflex save). The freezing ooze clings to those struck and hardens into thick sheets of ice. A creature that fails the saving throw is {@condition immobilized} by the ice until it succeeds at a check to {@action Escape} or it or an ally Forces Open the ice (DC 34 for either case). At the start of its turn, a creature still {@condition immobilized} by the ice takes {@damage 4d6} cold damage. Another creature can free a frozen target by dealing a total of 20 fire damage to the frozen target. Left unattended, the ice crumbles away in 1 minute on its own. Creatures with the {@trait fire} trait can't be frozen in place by this breath weapon. Flying creatures fall if frozen, and swimming creatures that are frozen rise toward the surface of the water at a speed of 60 feet per round. An ice linnorm can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: {@damage 2d6+18} bludgeoning, DC 38
bot.name: Constrict

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

attacks.name: stinger
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d4-1} piercing plus {@damage 1d4} evil and imp venom

items: {@bold Boar size} Medium; {@ability scent} (imprecise) 30 feet; Speed 40 feet; Melee tusk +9 (finesse), Damage {@dice 1d10-1} piercing
{@bold Giant Spider size} Medium; Speed 25 feet, climb 25 feet; Melee fangs +9 (finesse, poison), Damage {@dice 1d6-1} piercing plus {@damage 1d4} poison
Rat {@ability scent}; Speed 20 feet; Melee jaws +9 (agile, finesse), Damage 1 piercing
Raven {@ability scent}; Speed 10 feet, fly 40 feet; Melee beak +9 (finesse), Damage 1 piercing

entries: The imp regains {@dice 1d6} Hit Points.
bot.name: Diabolic Healing

entries: The imp offers a non-fiend within 15 feet a bargain, granting a boon of good luck if the creature accepts. The boon lasts for 1 hour once accepted. If the creature dies while the boon is in place, its soul travels to Hell, where it is bound for eternity and unable to be raised or resurrected except by wish or similar magic. Once during the hour, the creature can roll an attack roll or saving throw twice and use the higher result.
bot.name: Infernal Temptation

entries: The {@condition invisible} stalker is {@condition invisible} at all times, though when it takes a {@condition hostile} action of any kind, it is {@condition hidden} instead of {@condition undetected} until the start of its next turn, as the vague outline of its humanoid form is faintly visible for a short period of time.
mid.name: Naturally Invisible

entries: The {@condition invisible} stalker deals {@dice 2d6} extra precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: The {@condition invisible} stalker moves at full Speed while {@action Track||Tracking}.
bot.name: Swift Tracker

entries: harmed by acid ({@dice 6d10}, {@dice 2d8} from areas and {@condition persistent damage}); healed by fire (area {@dice 2d8} HP); {@condition slowed} by electricity.
mid.name: Golem Antimagic

entries: Casting neutralize poison on the golem deactivates its Breath Weapon for 1 minute.
mid.name: Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison

entries: Magical rusting effects, like a rust monster's antennae, affect the iron golem normally.
mid.name: Vulnerable to Rust

entries: The iron golem exhales poisonous gas in a 10-foot radius centered on the corner of one of the iron golem's squares. The gas persists for 1 round. Any creature in the area (or that later enters the area) is exposed to the iron golem's poison. The golem can't use its Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The iron golem {@action Stride||Strides} up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can attempt to bar the way by succeeding at a DC 37 Fortitude save. On a critical success, the resisting creature takes no damage; otherwise, it is damaged as if hit by the golem's fist.
bot.name: Inexorable March
Iron Golem Poison
bot.note: Any {@condition drained} value from this poison is reduced by 1 every hour.

languages: one elemental language (aquan, auran, ignan, or terran)
one planar language (abyssal, celestial, or infernal)

entries: A janni can survive on any Elemental Plane for up to 48 hours, after which it takes 1 damage per hour until it leaves or dies.
mid.name: Elemental Endurance

entries: The janni changes a creature's size. This works as a 4th-level {@spell enlarge} or {@spell shrink} spell but can target an unwilling creature (DC 21 Fortitude save negates).
bot.name: Change Size

entries: The jinkin deals {@dice 1d6} extra precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: A group of six jinkins can work together for an hour to imbue an item with a curse at a range of 60 feet. While this process is lengthy, it's also unobtrusive and can be performed while Hiding. Jinkins prefer to use this ability on magic items. The curse makes the item unreliable (DC {@flatDC 5} flat check or waste any action to {@action Interact} with or Activate the item), adds a bizarre requirement to use the item, or imparts some other curse of a similar caliber.
bot.name: Tinker

mid.trigger: A creature within reach of the jungle drake's stinger uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using.
entries: The jungle drake {@action Strike||Strikes} the target with its stinger. If it hits, the jungle drake disrupts the creature's action.
mid.name: Twisting Tail

entries: The jungle drake makes one fangs {@action Strike} and two stinger {@action Strike||Strikes} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: As {@ability Grab}, but the jungle drake's {@ability Grab} does not end if it moves away. Instead, it carries the {@condition grabbed} creature with it. A jungle drake can't {@action Fly} while grabbing a creature unless that creature can also {@action Fly}.
bot.name: Predatory Grab
Speed Surge
entries: The jungle drake {@action Stride||Strides} or {@action Fly||Flies} twice.

bot.name: Spit Venom
entries: A jungle drake can spit a sticky glob of its venom to a range of 50 feet that explodes in a 10-foot burst. Those in the burst must succeed at a DC 24 Reflex save or be exposed to jungle drake venom. The jungle drake can't use Spit Venom again for {@dice 1d6} rounds.

bot.name: Woodland Stride
entries: The jungle drake ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} and {@quickref greater difficult terrain||3|terrain} from non-magical foliage.

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d10+15} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} chaotic and warpwave strike

attacks.name: claw
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d10+15} slashing plus {@damage 1d6} chaotic and warpwave strike

entries: A voidworm can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants it the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. A creature under the effects of nondetection or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.
top.name: Entropy Sense

entries: A voidworm's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the voidworm takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The voidworm is immune to {@trait polymorph} effects unless it is a willing target. If {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened}, the voidworm automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.
mid.name: Protean Anatomy

entries: 30 feet. A creature using a teleportation ability within the aura or arriving in it via teleportation must succeed at a DC 38 Fortitude save or wink out of existence for {@dice 1d4} rounds before completing the teleport. The creature can't act, sense anything, or be targeted. On a successful save, the creature completes the teleport normally but is {@condition stunned 1}. Keketars are immune to this effect.
mid.name: Spatial Riptide

entries: The keketar can take the appearance of any Huge or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its {@action Strike||Strikes}, but might change the damage type its {@action Strike||Strikes} deal.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: {@damage 1d10+15} bludgeoning, DC 42
bot.name: Constrict

entries: When the keketar casts hallucinatory terrain, it infuses the illusion with quasi-real substance. Creatures that do not {@quickref disbelieve the illusion|CRB|2|disbelieving illusions|0} treat structures and terrain created through the spell as though they were real, ascending illusory stairs, becoming trapped by illusory quicksand, and so on.
bot.name: Reshape Reality

entries: A creature struck by a keketar's jaws or claw {@action Strike} must succeed at a DC 36 Fortitude save or be subject to a warpwave (page 266).
bot.name: Warpwave Strike

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: A kobold dragon mage's resistance depends on the color of its scales: Black acid 5, Blue electricity 5, Green poison 5, Red fire 5, White cold 5.
mid.name: Dragonscaled

bot.requirements: The kobold dragon mage is adjacent to at least one enemy.
entries: The dragon mage creates an illusion of itself in its square and then becomes {@condition invisible} (with the effects of a 2nd-level {@spell invisibility} spell) for {@dice 1d4} rounds. The dragon mage can move up to half its Speed, but it must end its movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemies. This is a 1st-level spell that requires a somatic component.
bot.name: Illusory Retreat

entries: The dragon mage deals an extra {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: The kobold scout {@action Stride||Strides} up to its Speed plus 5 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. It must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.
bot.name: Hurried Retreat
bot.requirements: The kobold scout is adjacent to at least one enemy.

entries: The kobold scout deals an extra {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

bot.requirements: The kobold warrior is adjacent to at least one enemy.
entries: The kobold warrior {@action Stride||Strides} up to its Speed plus 5 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. It must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.
bot.name: Hurried Retreat

entries: The kobold warrior deals an extra {@damage 1d4} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: A kolyarut can speak with and understand any creature that has a language.
Items +1 striking bastard sword.
top.name: Truespeech

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: A kraken reshapes the weather within 2 miles of it, with the effect of the control weather ritual centered on the kraken and based on its emotional state, at the GM's discretion. If the kraken dies, the weather returns to normal immediately.
mid.name: Altered Weather

entries: {@damage 2d10+17} bludgeoning, DC 40. On a failed save, a creature that is holding its breath loses {@dice 1d4} rounds worth of air.
bot.name: Constrict

entries: The kraken makes two {@action Strike||Strikes} with two different arms or tentacles, each limb targeting a different creature. Double Attack counts as two attacks toward the kraken's multiple attack penalty for further actions, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks are made. If the kraken subsequently uses the Grab action, it Grabs any number of creatures it hit with Double Attack.
bot.name: Double Attack

entries: The kraken emits a cloud of black, venomous ink in an 80-foot emanation. This cloud has no effect outside water. Creatures inside the ink cloud are exposed to kraken ink poison and are {@condition undetected} while inside the cloud. The kraken can't use Ink Cloud again for {@dice 2d6} rounds, and the cloud dissipates after 1 minute.
bot.name: Ink Cloud

entries: The kraken moves through the water up to 280 feet in a straight line without triggering reactions.
bot.name: Jet
Kraken Ink
bot.note: Krakens are immune to this poison.

entries: Tail only.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: Whenever the krooth is damaged by a critical hit, it gains a +2 status bonus to attack and damage rolls until the end of its next turn. It can't use reactions while this frenzy lasts.
mid.name: Pain Frenzy

bot.requirements: The krooth damaged a creature with its jaws on its most recent action this turn.
entries: The krooth snaps off one of its teeth in the creature it hit. The creature takes {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} and is {@condition drained 1}. Neither can be healed while the tooth remains. Removing the tooth safely requires a successful DC 26 check to {@action Administer First Aid}. Instead of ending bleeding or stabilizing, this removes the {@condition drained} condition, but it doesn't automatically end the bleed damage.
bot.name: Poison Tooth

savingThrows.abilities: +4 status to all saves vs. fear

entries: The lamia touches a creature, who must succeed at a DC 23 Will save or become {@condition stupefied 1}. If the target fails additional saves against this ability, the condition value increases by 1 (to a maximum of {@condition stupefied 4}). This condition value decreases by 1 every 24 hours.
bot.name: Lamia's Caress

entries: The lamia matriarch can take on the appearance of a Medium humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage modifiers with their {@action Strike||Strikes}, but it does prevent them from using their cursed touch. Each lamia matriarch has a fixed humanoid form—they cannot adopt a different appearance each time they use this ability, and the appearance resembles that of their upper torso when in their true form.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: The lamia matriarch makes a scimitar attack against each enemy within reach. Each attack counts toward their multiple attack penalty, but the penalty does not increase until after all the attacks. The first enemy she damages is subject to matriarch's caress.
bot.name: Dervish Strike

entries: The lamia touches a creature, who must succeed at a DC 28 Will save or become {@condition stupefied 1} (or {@condition stupefied 2} on a critical failure). If the target fails additional saves against this ability, the condition value increases by 1 (or 2 if it critically fails; to a maximum of {@condition stupefied 4}). This condition value decreases by 1 every 24 hours.
bot.name: Matriarch's Caress

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: A lantern archon can also make a {@action Retributive Strike} with its light ray.
mid.name: Retributive Strike

entries: Nine lantern archons can use this activity, all within 1 round of the first, to merge together to form a composite being for 7 rounds that appears as a glowing warrior of light. The gestalt has the base statistics of a legion archon (AC, saving throws, attacks, skills, Speeds, and so on) but the spells and special abilities of a lantern archon. Additionally, it has a ranged light ray {@action Strike} (+18 attack, Damage {@damage 3d4} fire and {@damage 3d4} good), and the bonus from its Lantern of Hope increases to +3. When the gestalt separates, its remaining Hit Points are divided evenly among the lantern archons, and if the gestalt had fewer than 9 HP, some of the lantern archons die.
bot.name: Gestalt

entries: The lantern archon shines as a beacon of hope. Good allies within 30 feet gain a +1 status bonus to damage rolls and to saving throws against crushing despair.
bot.name: Lantern of Hope

entries: When a leaf leshy dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from its body, restoring {@dice 1d4} Hit Points to each plant creature in a 30-foot emanation. This area is filled with tree saplings, becoming {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain}. If the terrain is not a viable environment for these trees, they wither after 24 hours.
mid.name: Verdant Burst

entries: The leaf leshy transforms into a Small tree. This ability otherwise uses the effects of tree shape.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: When a leaf leshy hits with its seedpod {@action Strike}, the target must attempt a DC 16 Fortitude save.

entries.Critical Success: The target is unaffected and temporarily immune for 24 hours.
entries.Failure: The target is {@condition deafened} for 1 round.
entries.Critical Failure: The target is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute.

bot.name: Deafening Blow

entries: The leshy glides gently through the air, moving 5 feet toward the ground and up to 25 feet forward. As long as the leshy spends at least 1 action gliding each round, it remains in the air at the end of each turn. For the purpose of determining damage from falls, a leaf leshy always treats falls as if they were 20 feet shorter.
bot.name: Glide

entries: 30 feet. Enemies that start their turn in the area or enter it must attempt a DC 23 Will save. On a failure, they take a –1 status penalty to attack rolls, spell rolls, and damage rolls against any other target while in the aura for 24 hours or until they damage the archon, whichever comes first. On a critical failure, they can't use {@condition hostile} actions against any other target while in the area for 24 hours or until they damage the archon, whichever comes first. Regardless of the result, a creature is then temporarily immune to further menacing guardian auras for 24 hours.
mid.name: Menacing Guardian

entries: A legion archon can also make a {@action Retributive Strike} by throwing its flame of justice.
mid.name: Retributive Strike

entries: Once per day, if an archon sees another creature cast {@spell dimension door}, it can cast an innate dimension door (heightened to 5th level) within 1 round to attempt to follow that creature to the maximum distance of the archon's dimension door. If the archon's dimension door has enough distance, the archon appears the same distance and direction from the creature as before either used dimension door.
bot.name: Archon's Door

entries: A legion archon's spirit of righteousness manifests in its hands as a mighty two-handed sword called the flame.
bot.name: Flame of Justice

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: Lemures have little drive of their own, but other devils can take command of them. A non-lemure devil can issue a command to all lemures within 60 feet of it with a single action, which has the {@trait auditory} and {@trait concentrate} traits. The devil picks one of the following orders lemures can understand, and the lemures follow that order. The command and its effects end once the commander is out of the lemure's sight, a new command is issued by the same or another devil, or the lemure dies.

items: {@bold Kill} The lemure attacks one target the commander singles out and gains a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls against the target.
{@bold Defend} The lemure circles the commander and attacks any creature that comes near. It gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saves.
{@bold Fetch} The lemure gains a +10–foot circumstance bonus to its Speed and attempts to get an object or person the commander singles out. It attacks anyone and anything that gets in the way.
{@bold Work} The lemure performs drudge work dictated by the commander.

bot.name: Subservience

entries: The leopard makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} against a creature it has {@condition grabbed}. Both count toward its multiple attack penalty, but the penalty increases only after both attacks are made.
bot.name: Maul

entries: The leopard {@action Stride||Strides} and makes a {@action Strike} at the end of that movement. If the leopard began this action {@condition hidden}, it remains {@condition hidden} until after this ability's {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Pounce

entries: The leopard deals {@dice 1d4} extra precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: The grim reaper can choose whether or not it counts as undead for effects that affect undead differently. Even if it does not count as undead, the grim reaper still never counts as a living creature.
top.name: Death's Grace

entries: The grim reaper automatically knows the Hit Points, conditions, afflictions, and emotions of all creatures it can see.
top.name: Status Sight

entries: 20 feet. Living creatures in the aura must roll twice on all d20 rolls and use the lower result.
mid.name: Aura of Misfortune

entries: A lesser death can choose whether or not it takes positive damage.
mid.name: Negative Healing

entries: As grim reaper, except the triggering creature must be within 60 feet.
mid.name: Lurking Death

entries: Any scythe gains the {@trait agile} trait, can't be disarmed, and becomes a +2 greater striking keen scythe while the lesser death wields it.
bot.name: Infuse Weapon

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d12+9} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} evil and daemonic pestilence

attacks.name: claw
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d8+9} slashing plus {@damage 1d6} evil and daemonic pestilence

attacks.name: composite longbow
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d8+9} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} evil and Daemonic Pestilence

entries: A leukodaemon senses any creature with a disease, and it knows the type and current stage of all diseases carried by any creature within range.
top.name: Plaguesense

entries: 30 feet. Leukodaemons radiate infection. All creatures within 30 feet of a leukodaemon take a –2 status penalty to saves against {@trait disease} effects. If a creature within range contracts or progresses a disease, all adjacent creatures are exposed to the same disease, at the same DC.
mid.name: Infectious Aura

entries: The leukodaemon exhales a cloud of corpse-bloated, biting black flies in a 20-foot cone. Creatures within the cone take {@damage 4d8} piercing damage (DC 28 basic Reflex save)
A creature that fails the save becomes {@condition sickened 1} (or {@condition sickened 2} on a critical failure).
bot.name: Breath Weapon
Daemonic Pestilence
bot.note: The leukodaemon can telepathically communicate with the afflicted creature at any distance on the same plane

entries: The leukodaemon coaxes a disease into full bloom. It chooses a target in its aura of pestilence that's currently affected by a disease. That creature must attempt a Fortitude save against the disease as if the interval for the disease's current stage had passed.
bot.name: Quicken Pestilence

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: 60 feet, DC 29
mid.name: Frightful Presence

mid.trigger: A creature casts a spell the lich has prepared.
entries: The lich expends a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of that same spell. The lich loses its spell slot as if it had cast the triggering spell. The lich then attempts to counteract the triggering spell.
mid.name: Counterspell

entries: 6th level.
bot.name: Drain Phylactery

entries: DC 32
bot.name: Paralyzing Touch

entries: If a reaction would disrupt the lich's spellcasting action, the lich attempts a DC {@flatDC 15} flat check. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.
bot.name: Steady Spellcasting

attacks.name: tail
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d6+10} bludgeoning plus {@damage 1d6} chaotic, {@damage 1d6} good, and Grab

entries: A lillend's {@trait auditory} and {@trait sonic} effects attempt to counteract any effect that would directly control, manipulate, or prevent them from expressing themself freely, such as silence. She can also spend an action, which has {@trait concentrate} trait, to speak forcefully and counteract such effects.
mid.name: Free Expression

entries: The lion deals {@damage 1d4} extra damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the lion's allies.
bot.name: Pack Attack

entries: The lion {@action Stride||Strides} and makes a {@action Strike} at the end of that movement. If the lion began this action {@condition hidden}, it remains {@condition hidden} until after the ability's {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Pounce

entries: The lion deals {@dice 1d6} extra precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: When not touching solid ground, the living landslide is {@condition slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
top.name: Earthbound

mid.trigger: The living landslide takes damage from a {@condition hostile} source while atop rock or earth.
entries: The living landslide crumbles into the ground, Burrowing down 10 feet. This Burrowing does not trigger reactions. The living landslide can't Crumble again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
mid.name: Crumble

entries: The living landslide can {@action Burrow} through any earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, the living landslide moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.
bot.name: Earth Glide

attacks.name: wave
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d8+7} bludgeoning plus Push or Pull 5 feet

entries: When not touching water, the living waterfall is {@condition slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
top.name: Water-Bound

entries: 30 feet. Water in the area that is in the same body of water as the living waterfall is {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} for Swimming creatures that don't have the {@trait water} trait.
mid.name: Vortex

entries: The elemental puts out all fires in a 5-foot emanation. It extinguishes all non-magical fires automatically and attempts to counteract magical fires (+14 counteract modifier).
bot.name: Drench

mid.trigger: The living whirlwind takes damage from a {@condition hostile} action.
entries: The living whirlwind disperses. Until the end of the current turn, it can't be attacked or targeted, doesn't take up space, and any auras or emanations it has are suppressed. At the end of the turn, the living whirlwind reforms in any space in which it can fit within 25 feet of where it dispersed and any auras or emanations it has are restored as long as their duration didn't run out while it was dispersed.
mid.name: Disperse

entries: The living whirlwind's movement doesn't trigger reactions.
bot.name: Swiftness

entries: The living wildfire ignores the {@condition concealed} condition from smoke.
top.name: Smoke Vision

entries: When the living wildfire dies, it explodes, dealing {@damage 3d6} fire damage to each creature in a 10-foot emanation (DC 19 basic Reflex save).
mid.name: Explosion

entries: A lizardfolk defender can hold their breath for 175 rounds (17-1/2 minutes).
bot.name: Deep Breath

entries: Non-lizardfolk creatures in {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} and non-lizardfolk creatures that are in water and lack a swim Speed are {@condition flat-footed} to the lizardfolk defender.
bot.name: Terrain Advantage

creature.name: Lizardfolk Scout
items: blowgun (10 darts, 1 of which is coated with giant centipede venom)

entries: A lizardfolk scout can hold their breath for 150 rounds (15 minutes).
bot.name: Deep Breath

entries: If the lizardfolk scout starts its turn {@condition undetected} by a creature or {@condition hidden} from it, that creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the scout's attacks until the end of the scout's turn.
bot.name: Hidden Movement

entries: The lizardfolk scout deals an extra {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: Non-lizardfolk creatures in {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} and non-lizardfolk creatures that are in water and lack a swim Speed are {@condition flat-footed} to the lizardfolk defender.
bot.name: Terrain Advantage

entries: A lizardfolk stargazer can hold their breath for 200 rounds (20 minutes).
bot.name: Deep Breath

entries: The lyrakien unleashes a blast of holy starlight in a 5-foot burst centered on itself. Creatures in the area take {@damage 1d6} chaotic damage and {@damage 1d6} good damage (DC 17 basic Reflex save). The lyrakien can't use Starlight Blast or its starlight ray ranged attack for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Starlight Blast

entries: The mammoth reduces the effects it suffers from cold environments by one step.
mid.name: Cold Adaptation

entries: The mammoth makes two tusk {@action Strike||Strikes}, each against a different creature. This counts as one attack for the mammoth's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.
bot.name: Dual Tusks

entries: A Medium or smaller creature hit by the elephant's trunk is {@condition grabbed}. If the elephant moves, it can bring the {@condition grabbed} creature along with it.
bot.name: Grabbing Trunk

entries: Large or smaller, foot, DC 28
bot.name: Trample

entries: The manticore flings up to two spikes from its tail, targeting either two different creatures or a single creature. If the manticore targets two different creatures, these creatures must be within 20 feet of one another, and the manticore makes a separate {@action Strike} against each; this counts as only one {@action Strike} for the manticore's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks. If the manticore fires both spikes at the same creature, it makes a single {@action Strike}. If the attack hits, it deals the damage of a single spike, but the target is pinned in place, rendering it {@condition immobilized}. A creature that succeeds at a DC 23 {@skill Athletics} check (attempted as a single action) can pull the spike free.
A manticore can hurl no more than 12 spikes in 24 hours.
bot.name: Spike Volley

spells.name: plane shift
note: to Astral Plane, Elemental Planes or Material Plane only

entries: 40 feet. Water in the aura that is also in the same body of water as the marid is {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} for Swimming creatures. Creatures with the {@trait water} trait are immune.
mid.name: Vortex

entries: The marid can take on the appearance of any water elemental or humanoid. This ability doesn't change the marid's Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its {@action Strike||Strikes}.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: The marid releases a jet of water in a 60-foot line, dealing {@damage 9d6} bludgeoning damage (DC 28 basic Reflex save). A creature that fails its save is also pushed 10 feet (20 feet on a critical failure). The marid can't use Rush of Water again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Rush of Water

entries: The marid makes a trident {@action Strike}, dealing an extra {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} on a hit ({@dice 4d6} on a critical hit).
bot.name: Skewer

entries: 100 feet. Commanded or allied evil creatures in the aura of lower level than the marilith gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, AC, saves, and skill checks.

entries.Failure: Vulnerability A marilith's pride feeds their strength, so the sting of failure wounds them. If the marilith uses a damaging spell or makes a {@action Strike} on their turn but doesn't deal any damage that turn, they take {@damage 3d6+10} mental damage at the end of their turn and their commander's aura deactivates until the end of their next turn.

mid.name: Commander's Aura

entries: A marilith gains 5 extra reactions per round that they can use only to make Attacks of Opportunity. The demon can't use more than one on the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares in the marilith's reach, and the marilith must use a different weapon for each {@action Attack of Opportunity}.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: The marilith makes up to six longsword {@action Strike||Strikes}, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the marilith's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.
bot.name: Bladestorm

entries: The marilith makes two {@action Strike||Strikes}, each with a different weapon, and they use the remaining weapons for protection. The demon gains a circumstance bonus to AC for 1 round equal to the number of weapons not used for attacks. If the marilith later uses any of those weapons to attack (including for an {@action Attack of Opportunity}), the bonus to AC decreases by 1 for each weapon used.
bot.name: Defensive Assault

entries: The marilith attacks a single target with all the weapons they wield in their arms, overwhelming the target with multiple attacks and leaving almost nowhere to dodge. The demon makes a longsword {@action Strike}. On a successful attack, the marilith deals longsword damage to the target, plus an additional {@dice 1d8} damage for every longsword they wield beyond the first (typically {@damage 5d8} extra damage). Even on a failed attack, the marilith deals the damage from one longsword to the target, though they still miss completely on a critical failure. This counts toward the marilith's multiple attack penalty as a number of attacks equal to the number of longswords the pride demon wields.
bot.name: Focused Assault

entries: {@damage 2d12+13} bludgeoning, DC 39
bot.name: Greater Constrict

entries: Any weapon becomes a +2 greater striking weapon made of cold iron and silver while a marilith wields it. The marilith can change its evil damage to chaotic whenever it attacks.
bot.name: Infuse Weapons

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a DC 25 Fortitude save. If the creature fails, it becomes {@condition slowed 1} for 1 minute. The medusa can deactivate or activate this aura by using a single action, which has the {@trait concentrate} trait.
mid.name: Petrifying Gaze

mid.trigger: A creature ends its turn adjacent to the medusa.
entries: The medusa makes a snake fangs {@action Strike} against the creature.
mid.name: Biting Snakes

entries: The medusa fixes their glare at a creature they can see within 30 feet. The target must immediately attempt a Fortitude save against the medusa's petrifying gaze. If the creature was already {@condition slowed} by petrifying gaze before attempting its save, a failed save causes it to be {@condition petrified} permanently. After attempting its save, the creature is then temporarily immune until the start of the medusa's next turn.
bot.name: Focus Gaze

entries: The shark can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.
top.name: Blood Scent

entries: The megalodon Swims up to its swim Speed, then Leaps vertically out of the water up to 25 feet high, making a {@action Strike} against a creature at any point during the jump (this lets it attack a creature within 35 feet of the water's surface or 40 feet with its tail). After the {@action Strike}, the shark splashes back down into the water.
bot.name: Breach

entries: The creature the megalodon hit takes {@damage 2d12} slashing damage.
bot.name: Savage
bot.requirements: The megalodon hit with a jaws {@action Strike} on its most recent action this turn.

entries: Huge, {@damage 2d8+5} bludgeoning, Rupture 20.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: A megaprimatus makes two fist {@action Strike||Strikes} against the same target. If both hit, the attack deals an additional {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage, the target is {@condition flat-footed}, and the target takes a –20-foot status penalty to all Speeds until the end of its next turn.
bot.name: Mangling Rend

entries: The megaprimatus beats its chest in a terrifying display. Creatures within 50 feet must attempt a DC 27 Will save. While a creature is {@condition frightened} by this ability, it is {@condition flat-footed} to the megaprimatus and to gorillas.

entries.Critical Success: No effect and temporarily immune for 1 minute.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened 1}.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened 2} and {@condition fleeing} until the end of its next turn.

bot.name: Terrifying Display

entries: The merfolk warrior swims and attacks in one of two patterns. They either {@action Swim} twice and {@action Strike} one opponent at the end of their movement, or {@action Swim} once and {@action Strike} at any point during their movement.
bot.name: Aquatic Dash

bot.requirements: The target is fully submerged in water, within 30 feet of the merfolk wavecaller, and holding its breath.
entries: The merfolk wavecaller commands the tides to crush their foe's throat, rooting the target in place and forcing it to choke up precious air. The target must succeed at a DC 18 Fortitude save or become {@condition immobilized} for 1 round and immediately lose {@dice 1d4} actions' worth of air (or twice that on a critical failure).
bot.name: Hydraulic Asphyxiation

entries: The mimic is coated in an adhesive slime. Any creature that hits the mimic, is hit by the mimic, or otherwise touches the mimic must succeed at a DC 23 Reflex save or become {@condition grabbed} ({@action Escape} DC 23). A weapon that hits the mimic is stuck to the mimic and can be removed with a successful DC 23 {@skill Athletics} check (made as a single action). A mimic can have any number of objects or creatures stuck to it at a time. The mimic can release a stuck creature or object by using a single action, and the adhesive dissolves 1 minute after the mimic dies, releasing all stuck objects and creatures.
mid.name: Adhesive

mid.trigger: A creature touches or physically interacts with the mimic while the mimic is transformed using Mimic Object.
entries: The triggering creature is automatically stuck by the mimic's adhesive (it receives no save). The mimic then makes a pseudopod {@action Strike} against any creature adjacent to the mimic. Object Lesson can't be used again until the mimic escapes and takes on a new disguise.
mid.name: Object Lesson

entries: The mimic assumes the shape of any Medium object. This doesn't change the mimic's texture or overall size but can alter its coloration and visual appearance. It has an automatic result of 28 on {@skill Deception} checks and DCs to pass as the object that it's mimicking.
bot.name: Mimic Object

entries: A minotaur automatically critically succeeds at {@skill Survival} checks to avoid becoming lost or to find its way, including those from the {@spell maze} spell.
top.name: Natural Cunning

entries: The minotaur swings its axe in a wide arc, making greataxe {@action Strike||Strikes} against any two foes who are adjacent to each other and within the minotaur's reach. The multiple attack penalty does not increase until after both attacks are resolved.
bot.name: Axe Swipe

entries: The minotaur snorts and clomps as it hunts its prey, inspiring terror. The minotaur makes an {@skill Intimidation} check to {@action Demoralize} all living creatures within 60 feet that can hear the minotaur but not see it. Roll once and apply the result to all creatures. If the targets are in a maze or similarly difficult-to-navigate structure, the minotaur gains a +4 circumstance bonus to this check. Creatures that become {@condition frightened} as a result also take a –2 circumstance penalty to {@skill Survival} checks to avoid getting lost for 1 minute. This use of {@action Demoralize} doesn't have the {@trait visual} trait. Each target is temporarily immune for 1 minute.
bot.name: Hunted Fear

entries: The minotaur {@action Stride||Strides} twice, then makes a horn {@action Strike}. If it moved at least 20 feet from its starting position, the {@action Strike}'s damage is increased to {@dice 2d8+10}.
bot.name: Powerful Charge

entries: A mitflit's self-loathing makes it easy to influence. It takes a –4 penalty to its Will DC against checks to {@action Coerce}, {@action Demoralize}, {@action Make an Impression}, and {@action Request}.
top.name: Self-Loathing

entries: Mitflits can use {@skill Diplomacy} to {@action Make an Impression} on and {@action Request} things of arthropods (insects, spiders, scorpions, crabs, and similar invertebrate animals). Most arthropods have a starting attitude of {@condition indifferent} to mitflits.
top.name: Vermin Empathy

entries: As long as it isn't {@condition frightened}, a mitflit gains a +2 status bonus to damage rolls against a creature that has previously damaged or tormented it.
bot.name: Vengeful Anger

attacks.name: web wrappings
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d12+14} bludgeoning plus Grab and spirit touch

entries: A psychopomp senses the vital essence of living and undead creatures within the listed range.
top.name: Lifesense

mid.trigger: A creature within reach of the morrigna's web wrappings uses an action to {@action Strike} or attempt a skill check.
entries: The morrigna makes a web wrappings {@action Strike} against the triggering creature. If the strike is a critical hit, the triggering action is disrupted.
mid.name: Wrappings Lash

entries: A morrigna can take the appearance of any Small or Medium animal or humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage modifiers with their {@action Strike||Strikes}, but it might change the damage type their {@action Strike||Strikes} deal. Unless they choose to manifest their web wrappings in their new form, they cannot make web wrappings {@action Strike||Strikes}.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: The morrigna summons a {@creature giant tarantula} or {@creature spider swarm}. These spiders have the summoned trait and remain for 10 minutes or until reduced to 0 Hit Points, whichever comes first. The morrigna does not need to {@action Sustain a Spell||Sustain the Spell} to direct these summoned creatures, and the morrigna can have any number of summoned spiders in existence at once. The morrigna can see through the eyes of any of their summoned spiders at any time.
bot.name: Spider Minions

entries: A morrigna's {@action Strike||Strikes} affect incorporeal creatures as though etched with a {@item ghost touch} property rune and deal {@damage 4d6} negative damage to living creatures or {@damage 4d6} positive damage to undead.
bot.name: Spirit Touch

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: The mu spore senses vibrations in the air through its aerial spores.
top.name: Windsense

entries: A mu spore is a massive creature and takes up a space of 10 squares by 10 squares (50 feet by 50 feet).
mid.name: Enormous

entries: 60 feet. A living creature that enters the area or ends its turn within it is corrupted by spores. It must succeed at a DC 42 Fortitude save or be {@condition clumsy 1}, {@condition enfeebled 1}, and {@condition slowed 1} for 1 round. Fungi and plants are immune.
mid.name: Spores

mid.trigger: A creature within 10 feet of the mu spore moves or attacks the mu spore.
entries: The spore uses Grab on the triggering creature. There is no limit to how many creatures it can grab with the sticky tendrils that cover its body.
mid.name: Grasping Tendrils

entries: The mu spore releases a cloud of burrowing spores in a 400-foot cone. The spores deal {@damage 22d6} piercing damage to all creatures, objects, and wooden structures in the area, but not to plants or fungi (DC 46 basic Reflex save). The mu spore can't use this ability again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Cough Spores

entries: The mu spore pulls all creatures and objects in a 400-foot cone 400 feet toward its mouth. A successful DC 43 Fortitude save halves the distance, or avoids the pull on a critical success. The mu spore automatically attempts to Swallow Whole each creature adjacent to it at the end of the inhalation.
bot.name: Enormous Inhalation

bot.trigger: The mu spore Grabs a creature with its jaws.
entries: The spore uses Swallow Whole.
bot.name: Fast Swallow

entries: 15 bludgeoning, DC 45
bot.name: Greater Constrict

entries: The mu spore still deals 18 piercing damage if its jaws {@action Strike} is a failure (but not on a critical failure).
bot.name: Overpowering Jaws

entries: Gargantuan, {@damage 20d6+9} acid, Rupture 37.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

mid.trigger: The mukradi would be {@condition confused}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition slowed}, or {@condition stunned}.
entries: The mukradi confines the debilitating effect to a certain portion of its nervous system, ignoring the effect but causing a maw of its choice to go dormant for the effect's duration. That maw can't be used for a {@action Strike} or Breath Weapon during that time. This ability can't be used if all the mukradi's heads are dormant.
mid.name: Partitioned Anatomy

mid.trigger: A creature scores a critical hit on the mukradi.
entries: The mukradi's Breath Weapon recharges. It can use its Breath Weapon immediately as part of this reaction. It can't use this reaction again until it recharges its Breath Weapon naturally.
mid.name: Spitting Rage

entries: The mukradi breathes a blast of energy from one of its three heads; each creature in the area must attempt a DC 36 basic Reflex save. The mukradi can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

items: {@bold Acid Maw} (acid) 10-foot-wide, 60-foot line of acid dealing {@damage 16d6} acid damage.
{@bold Flame Maw} (fire) 60-foot cone of fire dealing {@damage 16d6} fire damage.
{@bold Shock Maw} (electricity) 120-foot line of electricity dealing {@damage 16d6} electricity damage.

bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The mukradi makes two {@action Strike||Strikes} with different maws against the same target. If both hit, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d12+13} slashing damage, with a DC 36 basic Fortitude save. On a critical failure, the creature is torn to pieces and dies. The mukradi's multiple attack penalty increases only after all the attacks are made.
bot.name: Pull Apart

entries: The mukradi {@action Strike||Strikes} once against each creature in its reach. It can {@action Strike} up to once with each maw, once with its tail lash, and any number of times with its legs. Each attack takes a –2 circumstance penalty and counts toward the mukradi's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks are made.
bot.name: Thrash

entries: Huge or smaller, leg, DC 36
bot.name: Trample

entries: 30 feet. Living creatures are {@condition frightened 1} while in a mummy guardian's despair aura. They can't naturally recover from this fear while in the area but recover instantly once they leave the area. When a creature first enters the area, it must succeed at a DC 22 Will save (after taking the penalty from being {@condition frightened}) or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 round. The creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.
mid.name: Despair

bot.name: Mummy Rot
bot.note: This disease and any damage from it can't be healed until this curse is removed. A creature killed by mummy rot turns to dust and can't be resurrected except by a 7th-level resurrect ritual or similar magic.

entries: 30 feet. As the mummy guardian's despair, except the DC is 26 and the paralysis lasts {@dice 1d4} rounds.
mid.name: Great Despair

entries: When a mummy pharaoh is destroyed, necromantic energies rebuild its body in its tomb over {@dice 1d10} days. If the re-forming body is destroyed during that time, the process starts anew. A slain mummy pharaoh can be destroyed for good with a consecrate ritual.
mid.name: Rejuvenation

entries: 100 feet. Commanded or allied undead in the aura that have a lower level than the mummy pharaoh gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, AC, saves, and skill checks.
mid.name: Undead Mastery

entries: The mummy pharaoh can use {@action Attack of Opportunity} when a creature within its reach uses a concentrate action, in addition to its normal trigger. It can disrupt triggering concentrate actions, and it disrupts actions on any hit, not just a critical hit.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: The mummy pharaoh can deliver insidious mummy rot through melee weapons it wields.
bot.name: Channel Rot
Insidious Mummy Rot
bot.note: This disease and any damage from it can't be healed until this curse is removed. A creature killed by insidious mummy rot turns to sand and can't be resurrected except by a 7th-level resurrect ritual or similar magic.

entries: The mummy pharaoh exhales a 60-foot cone of superheated sand that deals {@damage 5d6} fire and {@damage 5d6} slashing damage (DC 28 basic Reflex save). The mummy pharaoh can't use Sandstorm Wrath again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Sandstorm Wrath

entries: The naiad can use {@skill Diplomacy} to {@action Make an Impression} on and make very simple Requests of animals.
top.name: Wild Empathy

entries: A naiad bonds to a spring, pool, pond, or similar-sized water feature. While within 300 feet of her bonded body of water, she can use her innate tidal surge at will. She doesn't recover Hit Points or reduce the {@condition drained} condition when resting beyond that range. Unlike most other nymphs, she doesn't suffer penalties from being apart from her bonded body of water. A naiad can perform a 24-hour ritual to bond herself to a new body of water.
mid.name: Water Dependent

entries: While within her bonded body of water (see water dependent above), the naiad heals 1 Hit Point every 10 minutes.
bot.name: Water Healing

entries: The naiad can use {@skill Diplomacy} to {@action Make an Impression} on and make very simple Requests of animals.
top.name: Wild Empathy

entries: 30 feet. DC 23. On a failed save, the target is {@condition stunned 1} for this turn and whenever it begins its turn within 30 feet of the naiad queen for the next 24 hours, even if it can't see her on subsequent turns.
mid.name: Nymph's Beauty

entries: On a failed save, if the target was already affected by the naiad queen's beauty, the image of the queen sears into the creature's mind, allowing no further sight and effectively blinding the creature until restored via restore senses or a similar effect, or until the naiad queen chooses to remove the effect using a single action, which has the {@trait concentrate} trait.
bot.name: Focus Beauty

entries: As naiad, but the naiad queen can heal in any body of water in her domain and regains 28 HP.
bot.name: Water Healing

attacks.name: tentacle
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d8+6} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} chaotic and confounding slam

entries: A voidworm can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants it the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. A creature under the effects of nondetection or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.
top.name: Entropy Sense

entries: A voidworm's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the voidworm takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The voidworm is immune to {@trait polymorph} effects unless it is a willing target. If {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened}, the voidworm automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.
mid.name: Protean Anatomy

entries: The naunet chooses adamantine, cold iron, or silver; its melee {@action Strike||Strikes} count as that type for 1 minute or until it uses Adaptive {@action Strike} again.
bot.name: Adaptive Strike

entries: The naunet can take the appearance of any Small, Medium, or Large animal, beast, or humanoid. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its {@action Strike||Strikes} but might change the damage type its {@action Strike||Strikes} deal.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: A creature hit by the naunet's tentacle {@action Strike} is {@condition stupefied 2} for {@dice 1d4} rounds (DC 24 Will negates). If the creature was already {@condition stupefied} in this way, the duration extends by 1 round instead. A chaotic creature is only {@condition stupefied 1} instead.
bot.name: Confounding Slam

entries: {@damage 1d8+8} bludgeoning, DC 26
bot.name: Constrict

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

mid.trigger: The Nessian warhound is critically hit by any {@action Strike}.
entries: The Nessian warhound's Breath Weapon recharges. It can immediately use it as part of this reaction.
mid.name: Hellish Revenge

entries: The warhound breathes flames that deal {@damage 10d6} fire damage to all creatures in a 15-foot cone (DC 28 basic Reflex save.) The warhound can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds. If the Nessian warhound would take fire damage or be targeted by a {@trait fire} effect, its Breath Weapon recharges.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d8+8} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} evil and Abyssal plague

entries: A night hag adds dominate, nightmare, scrying, and spellwrack to her coven's spells.
top.name: Coven

entries: When a night hag rides a {@creature nightmare}, the nightmare also gains the night hag's status bonus to saves against magic, and both the hag and rider benefit when the night hag uses her heartstone's ethereal jaunt innate spell.
top.name: Nightmare Rider

bot.name: Abyssal Plague
bot.note: A creature can't recover from {@condition drained} until abyssal plague is cured.

entries: The night hag can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her {@action Strike||Strikes}, but might change the damage type her {@action Strike||Strikes} deal (typically to bludgeoning).
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: If a night hag is ethereal and hovering over a sleeping chaotic or evil creature, she can ride the victim's back until dawn. The creature endures tormenting dreams as the hag casts nightmare on it, and is exposed to abyssal plague. Any {@condition drained} caused by dream haunting is cumulative. Only an ethereal being can confront the night hag and stop her dream haunting.
bot.name: Dream Haunting

entries: A creature {@condition flat-footed} to the night hag takes a –2 circumstance penalty to checks and DCs to defend against her spells.
bot.name: Spell Ambush

savingThrows.abilities: +2 status to all saves vs. magic, –2 to all saves if the night hag does not have her heartstone

entries: 15 feet. The nightmare continually exhales black smoke that creates concealment in an aura around it. Nightmares and their riders can see through this smoke. A creature that begins its turn in the area becomes {@condition sickened 2} (DC 23 Fortitude negates) and is then temporarily immune sickness from the smoke for 1 minute. The nightmare, its rider, any creature currently holding its breath (or that does not need to breathe), and any creature immune to poison are immune to the aura's {@condition sickened} effect but not the concealment.
top.name: Smoke

entries: The nightmare {@action Stride||Strides} or Flies up to triple its Speed. Its hooves burst with intense flame, dealing {@damage 3d6} fire damage (DC 24 basic Reflex save) once to each creature other than the nightmare's rider that the nightmare moves adjacent to during its gallop.
bot.name: Flaming Gallop

bot.requirements: The nilith has a creature {@condition grabbed}.
entries: The nilith reaches into the mind of the {@condition grabbed} creature and implants disjointed images of the victim's worst fears and nightmares. The {@condition grabbed} creature takes {@damage 6d6} mental damage (DC 31 basic Will save). On a critical failure, the target is also affected as though by feeblemind, and it must attempt a second Will save against that effect.
bot.name: Mind Crush

entries: A psychopomp senses the vital essence of living and undead creatures within the listed range.
top.name: Lifesense

entries: The nosoi takes the appearance of a raven or songbird. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage modifiers with its {@action Strike||Strikes}.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: The nosoi croons an entrancing song. Each living or undead creature within a 60-foot emanation must attempt a DC 18 Will save. The effect lasts for 1 round, but a nosoi can use this ability again on subsequent rounds to extend the duration by 1 round for all affected creatures. A creature that succeeds at any save is temporarily immune for 24 hours. Despite being a {@trait mental} effect, this ability affects mindless undead. Psychopomps are immune to this ability.

entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition fascinated}.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, and the creature must spend each of its actions on its turn to move closer to the nosoi as expediently as possible while avoiding obvious dangers. If a {@condition fascinated} creature is adjacent to the nosoi, it stays still and doesn't act. If the creature is attacked, the fascination ends.

bot.name: Haunting Melody

entries: A nosoi's {@action Strike||Strikes} affect incorporeal creatures as though etched with a {@item ghost touch} property rune and deal {@damage 1d6} negative damage to living creatures or {@damage 1d6} positive damage to undead.
bot.name: Spirit Touch

entries: A sewer ooze can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.
top.name: Motion Sense

entries: Whenever an ochre jelly is hit by an attack or effect that would deal slashing, piercing, or electricity damage and the ochre jelly has at least 10 HP, the jelly splits into two identical jellies with half the original's HP. One jelly is in the same space as the original, and the other appears in an adjacent unoccupied space. If no adjacent space is unoccupied, it automatically pushes creatures and objects out of the way to fill a space (the GM decides if an object or creature is too big or sturdy to push).
mid.name: Split

entries: {@damage 1d8+3} bludgeoning plus {@damage 1d4} acid, DC 23
bot.name: Constrict

entries: An ochre jelly's acid damages only flesh—not bone, stone, wood, or other materials.
bot.name: Ochre Acid

entries: 30 feet. A creature entering the aura must succeed at a DC 28 Fortitude save or become {@condition sickened 1} until the end of its turn (plus {@condition slowed 1} for as long as it is {@condition sickened} on a critical failure). While within the aura, an affected creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the {@condition sickened} condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.
mid.name: Putrid Stench

entries: A ofalth gains fast healing 2 when in an area with a high concentration of debris, junk, or excrement, such as a refuse heap or sewer.
mid.name: Filth Wallow

stages.entry: {@damage 2d8} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} every hour and {@condition enfeebled 1}
{@damage 2d8} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} every hour and {@condition enfeebled 2}

entries: The ogre boss issues a command to hasten their fellows. Each ogre ally who hears and understands this command becomes {@condition quickened} until the end of that ally's next turn, but can use the extra action only to {@action Step} or {@action Stride}.
bot.name: Bellowing Command

bot.trigger: The ogre boss successfully Trips a creature using an ogre hook.
entries: The ogre boss makes an ogre hook {@action Strike} against the creature they tripped.
bot.name: Sweeping Hook

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d8+8} piercing plus Grab and glutton's feast

entries: If the ogre glutton damages a living creature with their jaws {@action Strike}, they gain {@dice 1d4} temporary Hit Points for 1 minute.
bot.name: Glutton's Feast

entries: The ogre glutton {@action Stride||Strides} twice and makes a jaws {@action Strike}. If they damage a living creature with this {@action Strike}, the temporary Hit Points they receive from glutton's feast is increased to {@dice 2d4}.
bot.name: Glutton's Rush

entries: Small, {@damage 2d4+4} bludgeoning, Rupture 14.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: Bellowing mightily, the warchief gives themself and all orc allies within 60 feet a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls until the start of the orc warchief's next turn.
bot.name: Battle Cry

entries: 40 feet. A creature entering the aura must succeed at a DC 20 Fortitude save or be {@condition sickened 1} (plus {@condition slowed 1} for the same duration on a critical failure). On a success, the creature is temporarily immune to the {@condition sickened} and {@condition slowed} effects of this stench for 1 hour. Regardless of the save, while within the aura, creatures take a –2 circumstance penalty to saves against diseases. An otyugh's stench is due to the offal and refuse that it wallows in, so cleaning the creature thoroughly (with create water and sufficient scrubbing, for example) deactivates the aura, while a sufficiently plugged nose allows an individual to avoid exposure to the stench.
mid.name: Stench

entries: {@damage 1d6+6} bludgeoning, DC 22
bot.name: Constrict

entries: The otyugh attempts to move all creatures that it has {@condition grabbed} into other spaces within the reach of its tentacles, rolling a single {@skill Athletics} check and comparing the result against each creature's Fortitude DC. On a failure, the creature remains in place, and on a critical failure, the creature is no longer {@condition grabbed}.
bot.name: Reposition
Filth Fever
bot.note: The {@condition sickened} and {@condition unconscious} conditions from filth fever don't improve on their own until the disease is cured.

stages.entry: {@condition sickened 1} and {@condition slowed 1} as long as it remains {@condition sickened}

entries: The owlbear unleashes a loud screech that terrifies its prey. Each creature in an 80-foot emanation must attempt a DC 20 Will save. Regardless of the result, creatures are temporarily immune for 1 minute.

entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened 2}.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition fleeing} for 1 round and {@condition frightened 3}.

bot.name: Bloodcurdling Screech

bot.requirements: The owlbear has a creature {@condition grabbed} with its talons.
entries: The owlbear attempts to disembowel the creature with a beak {@action Strike}. If the {@action Strike} hits, the target must attempt a DC 22 Will save.

entries.Failure: The target is {@condition sickened 1} and {@condition slowed 1} as long as it remains {@condition sickened}.

bot.name: Gnaw

entries: The owlbear makes a Bloodcurdling Screech and {@action Stride||Strides} twice. All creatures within 80 feet of the owlbear at any point during this movement are subjected to the effects of Bloodcurdling Screech.
bot.name: Screeching Advance

entries: DC 19
mid.name: Buck

bot.requirements: The pegasus is Flying without a rider.
entries: The pegasus Flies. At any point during the movement, it can allow a willing adjacent creature to {@action Mount} it. That creature must use a reaction to do so.
bot.name: Assisted Mount

entries: The pegasus uses 2 move actions, each of which can be either {@action Stride} or {@action Fly}. It gains a +20-foot circumstance bonus to its Speeds during a Gallop.
bot.name: Gallop

attacks.name: binding contract
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d6+11} slashing plus {@damage 1d6} evil, Grab, and infernal wound

entries: A signed contract carried by a living contract devil (including draped over its horns) is immune to damage from all creatures other than that contract devil. A contract devil is immune to {@trait mental} effects that would make it destroy, nullify, or alter a contract.
mid.name: Ward Contract

entries: The contract devil produces an infernal contract for a single living mortal. This contract can grant a wide range of abilities and effects, akin to the power of a {@spell wish} spell but fulfilled to the letter by the contract devil. To receive any of those benefits, the mortal must willingly sign its true name to the contract. At that point, the mortal's soul is bound to the contract devil and Hell.

While the contract is in effect, the victim can't be restored to life except by wish or similar magic. If the mortal is restored to life by those means, the contract devil knows which mortal came to life and can locate the creature or creatures who restored the mortal to life for 1 year, gaining the effects of a {@spell locate} spell with unlimited range. Avoiding the terms of an infernal contract is difficult and often dangerous.
bot.name: Draft Contract

entries: A contract devil can cast a 10th-level innate {@spell scrying} spell at will, but only to target a creature with which it has a contract. The target automatically critically fails its save.
bot.name: Infernal Investment

entries: A contract devil's glaive {@action Strike} also deals {@damage 3d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} that resists attempts to heal it. The flat check to stop the bleeding starts at DC 20. The DC is reduced to 15 only if the bleeding creature or an ally successfully assists with the recovery.

The DC to {@action Administer First Aid} to a creature with an infernal wound is increased by 5. A spellcaster or item attempting to use healing magic on a creature suffering from an infernal wound must succeed at a DC 29 counteract check or the magic fails to heal the creature.
bot.name: Infernal Wound

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

attacks.name: beak
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d12+9} piercing plus {@damage 3d8} fire and {@damage 2d10} {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire}

attacks.name: talon
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d6+6} piercing plus {@damage 3d8} fire and {@damage 2d10} {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire}

entries: When a phoenix dies, it collapses into a pile of smoldering ashes before returning to life fully healed {@dice 1d4} rounds later, as if subject to a 7th-level resurrect ritual. Self-resurrection happens only if there are some remains to resurrect; for instance, a phoenix killed by a {@spell disintegrate} spell can't use this ability. A phoenix whose remains rest within an area devoted to an evil deity by consecrate can't self-resurrect until its remains are no longer in that area. A phoenix can self-resurrect only once per year.
mid.name: Self-Resurrection

entries: 20 feet. {@damage 4d6} fire, DC 37 basic Reflex save. While this aura is active, any adjacent creature that hits the phoenix with a melee attack or otherwise touches it takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage. The phoenix can activate or deactivate the aura with a single action, which has the {@trait concentrate} trait.
mid.name: Shroud of Flame

entries: The phoenix blazes with superheated flame and Flies up to its Speed. It deals {@damage 6d6} fire damage to each creature within 20 feet of each square it moves through (DC 37 basic Reflex save).
bot.name: Flaming Strafe
