savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 4d10+17} piercing plus {@damage 2d6} evil and pit fiend venom

attacks.name: tail
attacks.damage: {@damage 4d10+17} bludgeoning plus {@damage 2d6} evil and {@ability Improved Grab}

entries: 100 feet. Commanded or allied evil creatures in the aura of lower level than the pit fiend gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, AC, saves, and skill checks.
mid.name: Commander's Aura

entries: 20 feet, DC 42
mid.name: Frightful Presence

entries: The pit fiend can make an {@action Attack of Opportunity} when a creature within reach uses a concentrate action, in addition to the usual trigger. The devil can disrupt triggering concentrate actions, and they disrupt actions on any hit, not only a critical hit.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: {@damage 2d10+17} bludgeoning plus {@damage 2d6} evil, DC 43
bot.name: Constrict

entries: The pit fiend reshapes a large number of lemures within a 600-foot radius into more powerful devils to swell Hell's legions. The pit fiend must have available the number of lemures listed on the table in the sidebar on page 92. The pit fiend can shape 100 lemures per day, to a maximum of 1,100 lemures in 11 days. Devils created in this way are in thrall to the pit fiend and follow its orders, with the exception of created pit fiends or other devils of similar power, which are always independent. As a result, few pit fiends choose to create peers. At the end of the Devil Shaping activity, the pit fiend attempts an incredibly hard {@skill Religion} check of the desired devil's level, with results as follows.

entries.Critical Success: The pit fiend shapes two devils from the massed lemures instead of one.
entries.Success: The pit fiend shapes a devil of the desired type and level.
entries.Failure: The devil shaped from the lemures is 2 levels lower than the intended devil.
entries.Critical Failure: The pit fiend fails to shape any devils and draws the ire of an archdevil for its waste of resources.

bot.name: Devil Shaping

entries: The pit fiend Flies and makes a wing {@action Strike} at any point during its movement.
bot.name: Fast Swoop

entries: If the pit fiend's next action is to cast an 8th-level or lower innate spell, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).
bot.name: Masterful Quickened Casting

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: The pixie sprinkles pixie dust onto one of its arrows. If the pixie hits a creature with that arrow before the pixie's next turn, the arrow inflicts one of the following special effects instead of dealing damage. Each effect depends on the target's DC 21 Will save. On a critical hit, the target treats its save result as one degree worse.

items: {@bold Charm} (emotion, enchantment, incapacitation, mental) The target suffers the effects of a {@spell charm} spell, except it doesn't gain a bonus to its save if the only {@condition hostile} act was the pixie firing its bow, and the pixie can choose to direct the target's adoration toward another creature rather than itself.
{@bold Memory Loss} (divination, mental) On a failed Will save, the target loses the last 5 minutes of its memory.
{@bold Sleep} (enchantment, incapacitation, mental, sleep) The target suffers the effects of a 3rd-level {@spell sleep} spell.
{@bold Subdual} (enchantment, mental, nonlethal) The target takes {@damage 4d6} mental damage, depending on its basic Will save.

bot.name: Sprinkle Pixie Dust

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

attacks.name: fist
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d8+4} bludgeoning plus Grab and zombie rot

entries: A zombie is permanently {@condition slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
top.name: Slow

entries: The zombie makes a jaws unarmed melee {@action Strike} against the {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} creature with an attack modifier of +9 that deals {@damage 1d12+4} piercing damage. A creature damaged by the jaws is exposed to zombie rot.
bot.name: Jaws
bot.requirements: The zombie has a creature {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained}.

bot.name: Zombie Rot
bot.note: An infected creature can't heal damage it takes from zombie rot until it has been cured of the disease.

attacks.name: energy touch (agile, lawful, magical)
attacks.damage: {@damage 5d8+18} positive or negative damage plus {@damage 1d6} lawful

entries: Pleromas care little for communication with other creatures, but when they do convey information, they do so wordlessly through a series of psychic projections. This acts as telepathy with a range of 100 feet but is understandable to all creatures regardless of whether they have a language, though the aeon's meaning to non-aeons can be vague and is often mysterious. An aeon can use this ability to communicate flawlessly with any other aeon on the same plane as itself.
top.name: Envisioning

mid.trigger: The pleroma critically fails the saving throw.
entries: The critical failure becomes a normal failure.
mid.name: Reality Twist

entries: A pleroma's touch deals its choice of positive or negative damage, but neither energy can be used to heal a creature.
bot.name: Energy Touch

entries: Three times per day, a pleroma can manifest a 2-foot-diameter sphere of white energy that hovers above its left hand. By using a single action, which has the {@trait concentrate} trait, the pleroma can cause the sphere to fly 10 feet. The sphere can move in any direction, ignoring {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain}, but it can't move farther than 300 feet away from the pleroma. Wherever the sphere travels, it leaves behind a 5-foot-wide path of new matter, creating either new terrain (the pleroma's choice of normal, difficult, or {@quickref greater difficult terrain||3|terrain}) or a 5-foot-square solid barrier of a single natural substance (such as clay, wood, or stone). The sphere can enter the space of a creature; when it does, the creature must succeed at a DC 43 Fortitude save or be absorbed into the sphere. On a successful save, the creature is pushed to a space of the GM's choice away from the sphere. Those who fail take {@damage 20d6} positive damage (even if they are living) and are pushed away as a success. Those who critically fail, or are reduced to 0 HP by the damage from a failure, become one with the new material and can be restored only via a 10th-level spell. A pleroma can have only one Sphere of Creation in existence at a time, and the sphere automatically vanishes in a flash of blinding light after {@dice 1d4} minutes. All creatures within 30 feet of the sphere of creation when it vanishes must succeed at a DC 43 Fortitude save or be permanently {@condition blinded}.
bot.name: Sphere of Creation

entries: Three times per day, a pleroma can manifest a 2-foot-diameter sphere of complete and utter darkness that hovers above its right hand. It can move and control the sphere in the same manner as its Sphere of Creation. The sphere is an empty void that lasts for 1 minute before collapsing in on itself and winking out of existence. Once manifested, the sphere can be used as a ranged attack, but it blinks out of existence immediately after that attack is resolved. Any unattended object that touches the void is sucked in and completely destroyed. Larger objects (such as ships or buildings) are destroyed at a rate of one 10-foot cube per round of contact. The sphere can enter the space of a creature, with effects similar to the Sphere of Creation except that it deals negative damage (even to undead) on a failure and annihilates rather than incorporating the creature into material. Such a destroyed creature can be restored only by a 10th-level spell.
bot.name: Sphere of Oblivion

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

attacks.name: telekinetic object
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d12} bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing (depending on object)

entries: A poltergeist is tied to a location and can't travel more than 120 feet from the place where it was created or formed. Some poltergeists are instead bound to a specific room, building, or similar area.
top.name: Site Bound

entries: A poltergeist is naturally {@condition invisible}. It becomes visible only when it uses Frighten.
mid.name: Natural Invisibility

entries: When a poltergeist is destroyed, it re-forms, fully healed, where it was destroyed after {@dice 2d4} days. A poltergeist can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.
mid.name: Rejuvenation

mid.trigger: A creature approaches within 10 feet of the poltergeist.
entries: The poltergeist makes a telekinetic object {@action Strike} against the triggering creature.
mid.name: Telekinetic Defense

bot.requirements: The poltergeist must be {@condition invisible}.
entries: The poltergeist becomes visible, appearing as a skeletal, ghostlike humanoid. Each creature within 30 feet must attempt a DC 21 Will save, becoming {@condition frightened 2} on a failure. On a critical failure, it's also {@condition fleeing} for as long as it's {@condition frightened}. On a success, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute. At the start of its next turn, the poltergeist becomes {@condition invisible} again.
bot.name: Frighten

entries: The poltergeist telekinetically throws numerous small objects, such as dozens of pieces of silverware or books, either spreading them out among multiple foes or directing them at one target.

items: When this effect is spread out among multiple foes, the poltergeist makes a telekinetic object {@action Strike} at a –2 penalty against each creature within 30 feet. These count as one attack for the poltergeist's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.

When this effect has only one target, the poltergeist makes a telekinetic object {@action Strike} against the target, and the damage increases to {@dice 3d12}. It deals {@dice 1d12} damage on a failure, and no damage on a critical failure.

bot.name: Telekinetic Storm

resistances.name: all damage
resistances.note: (except force, {@item ghost touch}, or positive; double resistance against non-magical)

entries: The poracha teleports up to 40 feet. It must have line of sight to the space it teleports to. It can't use Jaunt again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Jaunt

entries: The poracha touches an adjacent object of enough volume to contain it. It merges into the object indefinitely, and while it's inside, time moves exceptionally slowly for it and it has only limited perception of the outside world. The poracha can sense what's going on outside the object only using {@ability tremorsense}. The poracha can use only mental actions or Jaunt; if it Jaunts, it leaves the object and appears where it chooses. If a creature {@action Strike||Strikes} the object, the poracha is expelled unharmed.
bot.name: Object Meld

entries: The pteranodon Flies up to its Speed and makes one beak {@action Strike} at any point during that movement.
bot.name: Swoop

entries: 20 feet. Creatures other than animals, gremlins, and gnolls in the aura become extremely unlucky (DC 16 Will save; creature must roll this Will save twice and take the worse result). On a successful save, the creature is temporarily immune to pugwampi unluck auras for 24 hours. On a failure, the creature must roll twice and take the worse result on all checks as long as it is within the aura.
mid.name: Unluck Aura

entries: The purple worm recovers from the {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition slowed}, and {@condition stunned} conditions at the end of its turn. It's also immune to penalties to its Speeds and the {@condition immobilized} condition, and it ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} and {@quickref greater difficult terrain||3|terrain}.
mid.name: Inexorable

mid.trigger: The purple worm would be affected by a condition or adverse effect (such as baleful polymorph).
entries: The purple worm negates the triggering condition or effect. s from artifacts, deities, or a similarly powerful source can't be avoided in this way.
mid.name: Shake It Off

bot.trigger: The purple worm Grabs a creature.
entries: The worm uses Swallow Whole.
bot.name: Fast Swallow

entries: The purple worm can violently regurgitate a creature or boulder it has swallowed to make a ranged {@action Strike}. The {@action Strike} deals bludgeoning damage depending on the size of the projectile: Tiny deals {@dice 2d6+13}, Small {@dice 3d6+13}, Medium {@dice 4d6+13}, Large {@dice 5d6+13}, and Huge {@dice 6d6+13}. A regurgitated creature takes falling damage from the height of the target or from 20 feet, whichever is greater.
Boulders occupy space in the worm's stomach as a creature of equivalent size, and purple worms often have several boulders swallowed. A purple worm can use a single action to swallow a new boulder.
bot.name: Regurgitate

entries: A purple worm can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 20 feet. It can leave a tunnel if it desires, and it usually does.
bot.name: Rock Tunneler

entries: Huge, {@damage 3d6+9} bludgeoning, Rupture 24.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: The worm makes a {@action Strike} once against each creature in its reach. It can {@action Strike} up to once with its jaws, up to once with its stinger, and any number of times with its body. Each attack counts toward the worm's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all the attacks.
bot.name: Thrash

attacks.name: claw
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d6-1} slashing plus {@damage 1d4} evil and quasit venom

entries: When a quasit offers {@action Aid} for an {@skill Arcana} or {@skill Religion} check, it gets the critical success result on any success and gets the critical failure result on any failure.
top.name: Abyssal Knowledge

entries: The quasit's link to a mortal soul gave it birth, but it presents a vulnerability. Once per round, a creature can present an object related to something virtuous or good in the life of the quasit's creator (such as a beloved daughter's doll) as an {@action Interact} action to automatically deal the quasit {@damage 2d6} mental damage.
mid.name: Virtue Aversion

entries: The quasit restores {@dice 1d6} HP to itself.
bot.name: Abyssal Healing

items: {@bold Bat} echolocation 40 feet; Speed 15 feet, fly Speed 30 feet; Melee fangs +7, Damage {@dice 1d4-1} piercing; Melee wing +7 (agile), Damage {@dice 1d4-1} bludgeoning
{@bold Centipede} Speed 10 feet, climb 10 feet; Melee mandibles +7 (poison), Damage 1 piercing plus {@damage 1d4} poison
{@bold Toad} scent (imprecise) 30 feet; Speed 5 feet; Melee jaws +7, Damage 1 bludgeoning
{@bold Wolf} size Medium; {@ability scent} (imprecise) 30 feet; Speed 40 feet, climb 10 feet; Melee jaws +7, Damage {@dice 1d10-1} piercing plus Knockdown

entries: 30 feet. The aura sheds dim light. Creatures in the emanation gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saving throws against {@trait emotion} effects. The quatoid can activate or deactivate its calming bioluminescence as a single action, which has the {@trait concentrate} trait.
mid.name: Calming Bioluminescence

entries: {@damage 1d12+6} bludgeoning, DC 25
bot.name: Constrict

entries: The quelaunt can cast the following cleric domain spells as 8th-level occult innate spells at will without spending Focus Points: {@spell blind ambition}, {@spell captivating adoration}, and {@spell delusional pride}.
bot.name: Emotional Focus

entries: The quelaunt casts up to three spells chosen from its at-will innate spells and its emotional focus spells.
bot.name: Emotional Frenzy

entries: The quelaunt feeds on the emotional unrest of a single creature within 30 feet that's under a harmful {@trait emotion} effect. The target must succeed at a DC 37 Will save or take {@damage 4d10} mental damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 round. If the target fails its saving throw, the quelaunt regains the same number of Hit Points and Feed on Emotion does not cost the quelaunt an action, allowing it to use another action this turn.
bot.name: Feed on Emotion

entries: The quelaunt makes three melee {@action Strike||Strikes}, each against a different target within reach. The multiple attack penalty applies to each attack, but increases only after all the attacks have been made.
bot.name: Rapid Strikes

bot.trigger: A creature fails a saving throw to resist one of the quelaunt's innate spells or emotional focus spells.
entries: As the quelaunt invades the triggering creature's mind and plants the seeds of negative emotions, it also strips away the target's feelings of hope or positivity. The quelaunt can immediately end a single {@trait emotion} effect from which the triggering creature is benefiting.
bot.name: Spiral of Despair

entries: A quetzalcoatlus can move at half.
bot.name: Snatch

entries: The raja rakshasa takes on the appearance of any Medium humanoid. This doesn't change the raja rakshasa's Speed or its attack and damage modifiers with its {@action Strike||Strikes} but might change the damage type its {@action Strike||Strikes} deal (typically to bludgeoning). It typically loses its fangs {@action Strike} unless the humanoid form has fangs or a similar unarmed attack.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: The raja rakshasa's eyes flash green as it projects a telepathic wave in a 30-foot emanation. All creatures in the area are assailed by a vision of evil decadence from one of the rakshasa's past lives. Each non-evil creature in the area must succeed at a DC 29 Will save or become {@condition sickened 1} (and {@condition stunned 1} on a critical failure). The visions last {@dice 1d4} rounds, and while they do, the raja rakshasa and all evil creatures in the area gain a +1 status bonus to all checks. The raja rakshasa can use this ability again only once the previous visions end.
bot.name: Disturbing Vision

savingThrows.abilities: +2 status to all saves vs. magic, +3 status to all saves vs. divine magic

entries: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes {@damage 1d6} piercing damage and must attempt a DC 17 basic Reflex save. A creature that fails its save is exposed to filth fever.
bot.name: Swarming Bites

bot.note: The {@condition sickened} and {@condition unconscious} conditions from filth fever don't improve on their own until the disease is cured.
bot.name: Filth Fever

entries: A ratfolk grenadier carries 2 infused moderate acid flasks, 2 infused moderate alchemist's fires, and 2 infused moderate frost vials. These items last for 24 hours, or until the next time they make their daily preparations.
top.name: Infused Items

entries: A ratfolk grenadier has stretchy cheek pouches that can store up to 1 cubic foot of objects (though no more than 4 light items). The ratfolk can remove or store an item using the {@action Interact} action. As long as the ratfolk has at least one object in its cheek pouches, its speech is noticeably difficult to understand.
bot.name: Cheek Pouches

entries: The ratfolk grenadier draws an alchemical bomb with an {@action Interact} action and throws it as a ranged {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Quick Bomber

entries: The ratfolk grenadier stores one held item of light or negligible Bulk in its cheek pouches.
bot.name: Quick Stow

entries: A ratfolk grenadier can end its movement in the same square as an ally that also has this ability. Only two such creatures can share the same space.
bot.name: Swarming

entries: A redcap's woolen hat is dyed with the blood of its victims.

If the redcap loses its cap, it no longer benefits from fast healing and takes a –4 status penalty to its damage rolls. It can create a new cap in 10 minutes, but that cap doesn't grant its powers until the redcap has turned it red with Blood Soak. A cap has no benefit for creatures other than the redcap who made it.
top.name: Red Cap

entries: If a redcap sees a creature brandish a religious symbol of a good deity (which requires an interact action by that creature) or use one to cast a divine spell, the redcap must attempt a DC 19 Will save. It then becomes temporarily immune to all brandished religious symbols for 10 minutes.

entries.Failure: The redcap gains the {@condition fleeing} condition for 1 round and is {@condition frightened 4}.

mid.name: Divine Revulsion

entries: The redcap dips its cap in the blood of a slain foe. The foe must have died in the last minute, and the redcap must have helped kill it. The redcap gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls for 1 minute.
bot.name: Blood Soak

bot.trigger: The redcap reduces a creature to 0 Hit
entries: Points with a scythe {@action Strike}. The redcap makes another scythe {@action Strike} against a different creature, using the same multiple attack penalty as the scythe {@action Strike} that triggered this reaction. This counts toward its multiple attack penalty.
bot.name: Deadly Cleave

entries: The redcap {@action Stride||Strides} up to half its Speed and makes a boot {@action Strike} at any point during that movement. If the boot {@action Strike} hits a {@condition prone} creature, it deals an extra {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage}.
bot.name: Stomp

attacks.name: claw
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d6+1} slashing plus reefclaw venom and Grab

mid.trigger: The reefclaw is reduced to 0 Hit Points.
entries: The reefclaw makes a claw {@action Strike} before {@condition dying}.
mid.name: Death Frenzy

entries: {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning, DC 17
bot.name: Constrict

entries: 5 feet. A creature that starts its turn in the aura takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. Whenever the remorhaz takes damage from an enemy, this damage increases to {@dice 2d6} until the start of its next turn. Any creature that hits a remorhaz with an unarmed {@action Strike} takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage, and a weapon that hits a remorhaz takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage.
mid.name: Heat

entries: The remorhaz unleashes a gout of flame that deals {@damage 8d6} fire damage in a 30-foot cone (DC 26 basic Reflex save). It can't use.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath

entries: A remorhaz can leave a tunnel when it burrows through ice or snow, and it usually does.
bot.name: Ice Tunneler

entries: Large, {@damage 2d8+5} bludgeoning plus {@damage 2d6} fire, Rupture 12.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: The remorhaz {@action Strike||Strikes} once with its jaws and once with its tail, each targeting a different creature.
Each attack counts toward the remorhaz's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks have been made.
bot.name: Thrash

entries: DC 17
mid.name: Buck

entries: The dog's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal {@damage 1d4} extra damage to creatures within the reach of at least two of the dog's allies.
bot.name: Pack Attack

entries: DC 16
mid.name: Buck

entries: The riding pony {@action Stride||Strides} twice. It has a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed during these {@action Stride||Strides}.
bot.name: Gallop

entries: DC 15
mid.name: Buck

entries: The riding pony {@action Stride||Strides} twice. It has a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed during these {@action Stride||Strides}.
bot.name: Gallop

mid.trigger: A creature within reach of the river drake's tail uses an action to {@action Strike} or attempt a skill check.
entries: The river drake attempts to {@action Strike} the triggering creature with its tail. If it hits, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.
mid.name: Tail Lash

entries: The river drake spits a ball of caustic mucus up to a range of 50 feet that explodes in a 10-foot burst. Creatures within the burst take {@damage 4d6} acid damage (DC 19 basic Reflex save). Those that fail this save also take {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent acid damage} and take a –5-foot status penalty to their Speed. This Speed reduction ends with the {@condition persistent damage||persistent acid damage}. The river drake can't use Caustic Mucus again for {@dice 1d6} rounds.
bot.name: Caustic Mucus

entries: The river drake makes one fangs {@action Strike} and two tail {@action Strike||Strikes} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy
Speed Surge
entries: The river drake {@action Stride||Strides} or {@action Fly||Flies} twice.

mid.trigger: A creature moves from beyond the reach of the roc's wing to within the reach of the roc's wing.
entries: The roc makes a wing {@action Strike} against the triggering creature. If the roc Pushes the creature, it disrupts the triggering move action.
mid.name: Wing Rebuff

entries: The roc Flies up to its Speed and makes two talon {@action Strike||Strikes} at any point during that movement. Each {@action Strike} must target a different creature. Each attack takes the normal multiple attack penalty.
bot.name: Flying Strafe

entries: A roc gains a +2 circumstance bonus to hit with its beak {@action Strike} if the target is {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} in its talon.
bot.name: Snack

entries: A roc can {@action Fly} at half Speed while it has a creature {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} in either or both of its talons, carrying that creature along with it.
bot.name: Snatch

mid.trigger: A creature within reach of the roper's strand leaves a square during a move action it's using.
entries: The roper makes a strand {@action Strike} against the triggering creature.
mid.name: Reactive Lash

entries: The roper extends or retracts six thin, sticky tendrils from its body. While the strands are extended, the roper takes a –4 circumstance penalty to {@skill Stealth} checks, and while they're retracted, it can't use its strand {@action Strike||Strikes}.
bot.name: Extend Strands

entries: The roper makes a strand {@action Strike} with each of its strands (except those that are immobilizing creatures). Each attack must be against a different target. These attacks count toward the roper's multiple attack penalty, but its multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.
bot.name: Flurry of Strands

entries: The roper pulls every creature {@condition grabbed} by its strands toward itself. The roper rolls a single {@skill Athletics} check and compares the result to each {@condition immobilized} creature's Fortitude DC. The roper pulls each creature it succeeds against up to 25 feet closer and each creature it critically succeeds against up to 50 feet closer.
bot.name: Pull the Strands

entries: Any creature hit by a roper's strand is {@condition enfeebled 1} and {@condition grabbed}. Each additional hit from a strand increases the {@condition enfeebled} condition value by 1 (to a maximum of {@condition enfeebled 4}). This {@condition enfeebled} value decreases by 1 every 8 hours. The roper can move while it has a creature {@condition grabbed} with a strand, but it automatically releases the creature if it moves beyond the strand's reach. The roper can release an {@condition grabbed} creature as a free action. A creature can sever a strand with a target attack that hits AC 27 and deals at least 18 slashing damage. This doesn't deal any damage to the roper itself, though it can no longer attack with a severed strand.
bot.name: Sticky Strand

savingThrows.abilities: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: The rune giant gains an additional reaction at the beginning of each of its turns that it can only use for an {@action Attack of Opportunity}.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: When a rune giant casts a mental spell against another giant, the DC is 39, rather than 35.
bot.name: Command Giants

entries: When a rune giant casts its innate {@spell sending} spell, it can also cast {@spell suggestion} on the target.
bot.name: Demand

bot.trigger: The rune giant uses an arcane ability or casts an arcane spell.
entries: The runes on the giant's body flash as they produce magical energy. Each creature within a 10-foot emanation must attempt a DC 35 Fortitude save.

entries.Success: The creature is {@condition dazzled} for 1 round.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition blinded} for 1 round.

bot.name: Flashing Runes

entries: The rune giant invokes one of the runes on its body, causing the rune to spray forth a 30-foot cone of sparks that deals {@damage 6d12} electricity damage to all creatures in the cone (DC 37 basic Reflex save)

A glowing copy of the invoked rune appears on a single weapon the giant holds, granting the weapon one effect listed below of the giant's choice. The giant can't use Invoke Rune again for {@dice 1d4} rounds. The effect on the weapon lasts for 1 minute. If the giant places a new rune on a weapon, any previously placed rune immediately vanishes, ending its effect.

items: {@bold Rune of Destruction} The weapon gains the {@trait deadly} trait with three weapon damage dice of the same die size as for the base weapon, and a creature hit with the weapon is {@condition drained 1} unless it succeeds at a DC 35 Fortitude save.
{@bold Rune of Flames} The weapon deals an additional {@damage 3d6} fire damage on all attacks.
{@bold Rune of Smiting} When the weapon hits, the giant can Push the target back 10 feet, or 20 feet on a critical hit.

bot.name: Invoke Rune

entries: The rune giant makes a single greatsword {@action Strike} and compares the attack roll result to the ACs of up to two foes within its reach. This counts as two attacks for the giant's multiple attack penalty.
bot.name: Wide Swing

entries: A rust monster can smell metal as a precise sense.
top.name: Metal Scent

mid.trigger: A creature carrying a metal item attempts to move out of a square within reach of the rust monster's tail.
entries: The rust monster makes a tail {@action Strike} against the triggering creature.
mid.name: Tail Trip

entries: The rust monster attempts to {@action Disarm} a metal item a creature is holding using its antenna (with the same modifier as an antenna {@action Strike}). On a success, the item is subject to the rust monster's rust ability (see below) in addition to the effects of the {@action Disarm}, and if the check to {@action Disarm} is a critical success, the rust monster drops the item on the ground in its own space.
bot.name: Antenna Disarm

entries: A rust monster's antenna causes metal to rapidly rust and corrode. If it succeeds at an antenna {@action Strike} or {@action Disarm} attempt with its antenna, the rust monster deals {@dice 2d6} damage (doubled on a critical hit) to a metal item the target is wearing or holding, ignoring its.
bot.name: Rust

entries: If the rust monster hits an unattended metal item, the item takes this damage automatically. If a creature uses the {@feat Shield Block} reaction with a metal shield against an antenna attack, the shield is automatically {@condition broken}, but no other item is rusted on that attack.
bot.name: Hardness.

entries: The salamander stokes its internal flames. Until the start of its next turn, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC, and when an adjacent creature touches it or hits it with a physical attack, that creature takes {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire damage} unless it succeeds at a DC 25 Reflex save.
bot.name: Armor of Flames

entries: {@damage 1d8+4} bludgeoning plus {@damage 1d6} fire, DC 25
bot.name: Constrict

entries: A satyr's wineskin magically enchants any alcohol inside. With an {@action Interact} action, a living creature can imbibe the alcohol and gain a +1 item bonus to Will saves and a +3 item bonus to Will saves against {@trait fear} effects for the following hour. When the wineskin is removed from a satyr's person, the magic remains only until the wine spoils. The wineskin holds up to eight drafts of wine.
top.name: Sylvan Wine

entries: When the satyr Plays the Pipes to cast a spell, he can {@action Step} or {@action Stride} as part of the activity.
bot.name: Fleet Performer

bot.requirements: The satyr is holding a musical instrument.
entries: The satyr plays a melody on his instrument to cast {@spell charm}, {@spell fear}, {@spell sleep}, or {@spell suggestion} without expending the spell slot and using his music in place of providing the spell's component actions. The spell gains the {@trait auditory} trait and targets all creatures in a 60-foot emanation instead of its usual targets. A creature that succeeds at its Will save against any spell is then temporarily immune from spells played from that satyr's pipes for 1 minute. Satyrs are immune to this music.
bot.name: Play the Pipes

entries: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes {@damage 2d8} piercing damage (DC 21 basic Reflex save) and is exposed to scorpion venom.
bot.name: Swarming Stings

entries: The sea devil can communicate telepathically with sharks within range. It can communicate only simple concepts like "come," "guard," or "attack."
top.name: Shark Commune

entries: As sea devil scout, 15 temporary HP.
bot.name: Blood Frenzy

entries: When the sea devil deals piercing or slashing damage, it also deals {@damage 1d4} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} if the target was {@condition flat-footed} or if the attack was a critical hit.
bot.name: Bloodletting

bot.requirements: The sea devil baron is in a blood frenzy.
entries: The sea devil baron unleashes a whirlwind of attacks against its foes, making a single melee {@action Strike} with its claws or jaws against each opponent within reach.
bot.name: Hateful Tide

entries: The sea devil can communicate telepathically with sharks within range. It can communicate only simple concepts like "come," "guard," or "attack."
top.name: Shark Commune

entries: As sea devil scout, 11 temporary HP.
bot.name: Blood Frenzy

entries: When the sea devil deals piercing or slashing damage, it also deals {@damage 1d4} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} if the target was {@condition flat-footed} or if the attack was a critical hit.
bot.name: Bloodletting

entries: A sea devil brute can use thrown ranged weapons underwater with no penalty due to range increment.
bot.name: Unimpeded Throw

entries: The sea devil can communicate telepathically with sharks within range. It can communicate only simple concepts like "come," "guard," or "attack."
top.name: Shark Commune

bot.trigger: The sea devil deals bleed damage to a living creature.
bot.requirements: The sea devil is not {@condition fatigued} or already in a frenzy.
entries: The sea devil flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the sea devil gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with its claws and jaws, gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its claws and jaws, gains 7 temporary HP until the end of the frenzy, and takes a –2 status penalty to AC. The sea devil can't voluntarily stop its frenzy. After its frenzy, the sea devil is {@condition fatigued}.
bot.name: Blood Frenzy

entries: When the sea devil deals piercing or slashing damage, it also deals {@damage 1d4} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} if the target was {@condition flat-footed} or if the attack was a critical hit.
bot.name: Bloodletting

entries: A sea hag adds acid arrow, mariner's curse, and water walk to her coven's spells.
top.name: Coven

entries: The sea hag can make a bargain with a willing creature, who must be of sound mind. The creature gives away a special or cherished quality—such as its courage, its beauty, or its voice—in exchange for a boon or a promise from the sea hag. As long as the sea hag keeps her end of the bargain, the only way to restore the lost quality is to defeat the sea hag or make another bargain for its return.
top.name: Sea Hag's Bargain

entries: The hag gazes upon a creature, afflicting it with intense distress and a gnawing sense of impending doom, with a result depending on its Will save (DC 20). The target does not need to be able to see the sea hag.

entries.Failure: {@condition Frightened 1} and {@condition slowed 1} for 1 round. If the target was {@condition dying}, it remains {@condition unconscious} for 1 day. At the end of the day, it must attempt a Fortitude save against the same DC; if it fails, it dies.
entries.Critical Failure: {@condition Frightened 2} and {@condition slowed 1} for 1 minute. If the target was {@condition dying}, it remains {@condition unconscious} for 1 day. At the end of the day, it must attempt a Fortitude save against the same DC; if it fails, it dies.

bot.name: Dread Gaze

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: A sea serpent automatically tries to counteract any detection, revelation, or scrying divination attempted against it, using its {@skill Stealth} modifier for its counteract modifier.
top.name: Undetectable

entries: The sea serpent attempts to capsize an aquatic vessel of its size or smaller that it's adjacent to. It must succeed at an {@skill Athletics} check with a DC of 35 or the pilot's {@skill Lore||Sailing Lore} DC, whichever is higher.
bot.name: Capsize

entries: {@damage 1d10+14} bludgeoning.
bot.name: Constrict

stages.entry: {@condition confused} and, if flying, spends its first action each turn to descend 20 feet
{@condition confused} and, if flying, descends until reaching the ground or water below

entries: The sea serpent extends the spines along its back and Swims or {@action Stride||Strides}. Each creature the serpent is adjacent to at any point during its movement takes {@damage 4d6+8} slashing damage (DC 32 basic Reflex save).
bot.name: Spine Rake

entries: Huge, {@damage 2d10+6} bludgeoning, Rupture 20.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: A sewer ooze can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.
top.name: Motion Sense

entries: The sewer ooze unleashes a wave of filth, covering all creatures within a 20-foot emanation. Each creature in the area must succeed at a DC 17 Reflex save or take {@damage 1d4} acid damage and take a –10-foot penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute (on a critical failure, the creature also falls {@condition prone}). A creature can spend an {@action Interact} action to clean someone off, decreasing the Speed penalty by 5 feet with each action.
bot.name: Filth Wave

entries: An object shedding magical light (such as from the {@spell light} spell) is treated as magical when used to attack the shadow.
mid.name: Light Vulnerability

entries: When a creature's shadow is pulled free by Steal Shadow, it becomes a shadow spawn under the command of the shadow that created it. This shadow spawn doesn't have Steal Shadow and is perpetually and incurably {@condition clumsy 2}. If the creature the shadow spawn was pulled from dies, the shadow spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous shadow. If the creature recovers from its enfeeblement, its shadow returns to it and the shadow spawn is extinguished.
bot.name: Shadow Spawn

entries: The shadow can {@action Hide} or end its {@action Sneak} in a creature's or object's shadow.
bot.name: Slink in Shadows

bot.requirements: The shadow hit a living creature with a shadow hand {@action Strike} on its previous action
entries: The shadow pulls at the target's shadow, making the creature {@condition enfeebled 1}. This is cumulative with other {@condition enfeebled} conditions from shadows, to a maximum of {@condition enfeebled 4}. If this increases a creature's {@condition enfeebled} value to 3 or more, the target's shadow is separated from its body (see shadow spawn). {@condition Enfeebled} from Steal Shadow decreases by 1 every hour.
bot.name: Steal Shadow

resistances.name: all
resistances.note: (except force, {@item ghost touch}, or positive; double resistance against non-magical)

attacks.name: fist
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d4+12} bludgeoning plus Push 10 feet and shove into stone

entries: The shaitan can {@action Burrow} through dirt and stone at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.
bot.name: Earth Glide

entries: When the shaitan Pushes a creature into a stone barrier, the target must succeed at a DC 22 Reflex save or become merged with the barrier (as meld with stone). The victim can attempt to {@action Escape} (DC 28).
bot.name: Shove into Stone

entries: When it's not in danger, the shambler spends 1 minute settling into a pile that looks like a lump of loose vegetation. While it is in this form, creatures must actively {@action Seek} and succeed at a DC 22 {@skill Perception} check (DC 28 in forests or swamps) to detect the shambler's true nature.
top.name: Mound

entries: Whenever the shambler would take electricity damage or is targeted with an {@trait electricity} effect, it gains 12 temporary HP and is {@condition quickened} until the end of its next turn. It can use its extra action to {@action Stride}, {@action Strike}, or {@action Swim}.
mid.name: Electric Surge

mid.trigger: A creature unaware of the shambler's true nature comes within 10 feet.
mid.requirements: The shambler is in mound form.
entries: The shambler makes a vine {@action Strike} against the creature. Then roll initiative.
mid.name: Shamble

entries: The shambler makes a vine {@action Strike} against each creature within reach. Its multiple attack penalty increases only after all the attacks.
bot.name: Vine Lash

attacks.name: jaws (evil, magical, reach <20 feet>)
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d12+17} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} evil and enfeebling bite

attacks.name: pincer (evil, magical, reach <20 feet>)
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d8+17} bludgeoning plus {@damage 1d6} evil and {@ability Improved Grab}

entries: 30 feet. A non-evil creature that ends its turn in the aura must attempt a DC 35 Fortitude save. If it fails, it's {@condition slowed 1} for 1 round, and if it critically fails, it is instead {@condition paralyzed} for 1 round.
mid.name: Paralyzing Gaze

entries: A shemhazian's mutilation is a part of them, and they can't bear to see it reversed. The first time each round that a creature heals from damage the shemhazian dealt on their last turn, the demon takes {@damage 3d6} mental damage.
mid.name: Succor Vulnerability

mid.trigger: A creature within reach of the shemhazian's tail leaves a square during a move action it's using.
entries: The shemhazian attempts to {@action Trip} the triggering creature. On a success, the creature also takes damage as if the shemhazian had hit with a tail {@action Strike}, and if the creature was flying, it falls 30 feet.
mid.name: Tail Whip

entries: If the shemhazian's jaws {@action Strike} damages a creature, the target is {@condition enfeebled 3}. The target can attempt a DC 37 Fortitude save to reduce this to {@condition enfeebled 1} (or be unaffected on a critical success).
bot.name: Enfeebling Bite

entries: The shemhazian focuses their gaze on a non-evil creature they can see within 30 feet. If that creature isn't already {@condition slowed} by the shemhazian's paralyzing gaze, it must attempt a save against the shemhazian's paralyzing gaze. If that creature is {@condition slowed}, it must succeed at a DC 35 Fortitude save or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 round. A shemhazian can't use this ability against the same creature more than once per round.
bot.name: Focused Gaze

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: A shield archon's hands can change into a +1 holy striking spear and a lesser sturdy shield or back into hands. Transforming does not restore any HP to the items, and if either the weapon or shield is fully destroyed, the archon loses that hand until it receives a {@spell regenerate} spell or similar magic. If a shield archon is slain, its weapon and shield can be taken, but they fade into nothingness after 24 hours.
top.name: Morphic Hands

entries: A shield archon's shield is the focal point of its courage and soul. It always has its shield raised without needing to {@action Raise a Shield}, and it can use {@feat Shield Block} as a free action instead of a reaction (Hardness 10, HP 80). A shield archon can trigger its {@feat Shield Block} free action when an ally within 10 feet is the target of an attack, reducing damage to that ally instead of itself but otherwise following the normal rules of {@feat Shield Block}.
mid.name: Living Shield

entries: 30 feet. Enemies that start their turn in the area or enter it must attempt a DC 27 Will save. On a failure, they take a –1 status penalty to attack rolls, spell rolls, and damage rolls against any other target while in the aura for 24 hours or until they damage the archon, whichever comes first. On a critical failure, they can't use {@condition hostile} actions against any other target while in the area for 24 hours or until they damage the archon, whichever comes first. Regardless of the result, a creature is then temporarily immune to further menacing guardian auras for 24 hours.
mid.name: Menacing Guardian

entries: Once per day, if an archon sees another creature cast {@spell dimension door}, it can cast an innate dimension door (heightened to 5th level) within 1 round to attempt to follow that creature to the maximum distance of the archon's dimension door. If the archon's dimension door has enough distance, the archon appears the same distance and direction from the creature as before either used dimension door.
bot.name: Archon's Door

entries: When a shield archon uses its dimension door innate spell, it can choose to move into the space of a willing ally it can see within range. If it does so, the ally switches places with the archon, appearing in the space the archon just vacated, as if it too had cast {@spell dimension door}.
bot.name: Courageous Switch

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

attacks.name: fist
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d4+5} bludgeoning plus {@damage 4d6} fire and {@damage 2d4} {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire}

attacks.name: fire ray
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d10+3} fire, plus {@damage 2d10} positive damage if the target is undead

entries: The shining child is {@condition flat-footed} while in areas of darkness.
top.name: Radiance Dependence

entries: 60 feet. The shining child sheds bright light. Any creature that starts its turn in the aura must succeed at a Fortitude DC 29 save. If it fails, it is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute, and if it critically fails, it's permanently {@condition blinded}. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to this effect for 24 hours.
mid.name: Blinding Aura

mid.trigger: The shining child enters an area of magical darkness or begins its turn in an area of magical darkness.
entries: The shining child attempts to counteract the magical darkness (as a 7th-level spell).
mid.name: Overwhelming Light

entries: 60 feet. A shoggoth constantly voices syllables and mutterings that mortals were not meant to hear. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a DC 38 Will save or become {@condition confused} for 1 round ({@dice 2d4} rounds on a critical failure). A creature that successfully saves is temporarily immune for 24 hours.
mid.name: Maddening Cacophony

entries: {@damage 2d10+15} bludgeoning.
bot.name: Constrict

entries: A creature that begins its turn inside the shoggoth takes {@damage 9d6} acid damage.
bot.name: Eat Away

entries: DC 40, {@damage 6d6} acid, {@action Escape} DC 40, Rupture 40.
bot.name: Engulf

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: Any time the shuln scores a critical hit with a melee {@action Strike}, it also deals the same amount of damage to the target's armor, bypassing any Hardness lower than 10, like adamantine.
bot.name: Armor-Rending

stages.entry: {@damage 4d6} poison damage and {@condition paralyzed} for {@dice 2d6} hours.

entries: Shulns can burrow into solid rock and any metal with a hardness less than that of adamantine like it is soil or loose rubble, leaving a tunnel 10 feet in diameter.
bot.name: Unstoppable Burrow

creature.name: Sinspawn
items: one weapon determined by its sin

entries: A sinspawn can smell creatures that reflect its sin, as the {@ability scent} ability. The GM determines which creatures are appropriately sinful.
top.name: Sin Scent

entries: A creature hit by the jaws of a sinspawn must attempt a DC 18 Will save as it is assailed by sinful thoughts.

entries.Failure: {@condition Sickened 2}.
entries.Critical Failure: {@condition Sickened 2} plus an additional penalty, determined by the sinspawn's sin, while it remains {@condition sickened}.

bot.name: Sinful Bite

entries: A sinspawn gains an additional skill based on its sin, as well as a weapon that reflects the preferences of its kinds' ancient creators. The seven sins and the benefits they confer upon a sinspawn are noted in the Sinspawn Sins section.
bot.name: Sin

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to saves vs. magic, +4 status to saves vs. mental

entries: The giant makes two {@action Strike||Strikes} with its glaive against two adjacent foes, both of whom are within its reach. The multiple attack penalty does not increase until after both attacks are resolved.
bot.name: Broad Swipe

entries: The giant {@action Stride||Strides} and makes a horns {@action Strike} with a +4 circumstance bonus to damage. If the strike hits, the giant attempts to {@action Demoralize} the target.
bot.name: Terrifying Charge

entries: The horse {@action Stride||Strides} twice, with its Speed increased by 10 feet.
bot.name: Gallop

entries: Undead and creatures allied with them can Command a skeletal steed without needing to attempt a skill check.
bot.name: Undead Steed

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d10+14} piercing plus {@damage 3d6} negative and energy drain

attacks.name: claw
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d6+14} slashing plus {@damage 3d6} negative and energy drain

entries: A skulltaker taps into the memories of the creatures whose bones make up its body. This gives it the {@skill Lore||Skeletal Lore} skill, which it can use to {@action Recall Knowledge} of any kind. In addition, it can speak and understand all the languages known by the creatures whose bones make up its body (typically including Common and the regional language of the skulltaker's home region). The skulltaker can use {@skill Lore||Skeletal Lore} as the primary skill check for the legend lore ritual (Core Rulebook 413), and it can cast legend lore without secondary casters.
top.name: Skeletal Lore

entries: 10 feet. A cloud of bone shards surrounds the skulltaker. When a creature moves into the emanation or begins its turn there, shard storm attempts to counteract any death ward effect on the creature (+30 counteract modifier) and then deals {@damage 4d6} slashing damage and {@damage 4d6} negative damage to the creature, with a DC 40 basic Reflex save.
mid.name: Shard Storm

entries: Whenever a creature dies within 60 feet of a skulltaker, the skulltaker draws a portion of the creature's bones into its shard storm. The creature must succeed at a DC 40 Will save or rise as a {@creature skeletal champion} in {@dice 1d4} rounds. These skeletal champions are {@condition controlled} by the skulltaker.
bot.name: Bonetaker

entries: When a skulltaker hits with a melee {@action Strike}, the target must succeed at a DC 40 Fortitude save or become {@condition drained 2} and {@condition doomed 1}.
bot.name: Energy Drain

entries: The skulltaker causes splintered bones to erupt from all solid surfaces in a 100-foot emanation, except for surfaces of worked stone. A creature moving through the bones takes 10 piercing damage and 10 negative damage for every 5 feet of movement. The first time each round a creature takes piercing damage from these splintered bones, it must succeed at a Reflex save or take a –10-foot circumstance penalty to all Speeds for 10 minutes, or a –15-foot circumstance penalty for 24 hours on a critical failure. The bones remain in place until the skulltaker uses this action again or the bones are manually removed, which takes 10 minutes for each 5-foot square.
bot.name: Splintered Ground

entries: The slurk extrudes a slippery grease from its ventral glands to coat the floor under it and in a 5-foot emanation, turning the affected area into uneven ground for 10 minutes, after which it dries to a putrid crust. The DC to {@action Balance} across the slime is 18.
bot.name: Belly Grease

entries: A creature struck by a slurk's slime squirt becomes {@condition clumsy 1} and takes a –5-foot penalty to Speed for 1 hour or until the slime is removed. The slime can be removed with a total of three {@action Interact} actions by the entangled creature or creatures adjacent to the creature. These actions don't need to be consecutive or made by the same creature.
bot.name: Entangling Slime

entries: The smilodon makes a fangs {@action Strike} against a creature it is grabbing. If the attack hits, the creature is knocked {@condition prone}; if the creature is wearing armor with hardness 10 or lower, the armor is {@condition broken}. If this {@action Strike} breaks a creature's armor or damages a creature who is unarmored or wearing {@condition broken} armor, the creature also takes {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage}. This {@action Strike} doesn't further damage armor that's already {@condition broken}.
bot.name: Pierce Armor

entries: The smilodon {@action Stride||Strides} and makes a {@action Strike} at the end of that movement. If the smilodon began this action {@condition hidden}, it remains {@condition hidden} until after this ability's {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Pounce

entries: The smilodon deals {@dice 1d6} extra precision damage to creatures that are {@condition flat-footed}.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

attacks.name: leaf
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d8+2} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} acid and {@ability Improved Grab}

mid.trigger: A creature hits or touches the flytrap.
entries: The flytrap makes a leaf {@action Strike} against the triggering creature. If it hits, the creature is {@condition grabbed} in that leaf.
mid.name: Quick Capture

entries: The flytrap attacks a single target with both its leaves. The flytrap makes one leaf {@action Strike}. On a success, the flytrap deals the damage from one leaf {@action Strike} plus an additional {@dice 1d8} damage for every leaf beyond the first. On a failure, the flytrap deals the damage from one leaf {@action Strike}, but it can't use {@ability Improved Grab}. It deals no damage on a critical failure. This counts toward the flytrap's multiple attack penalty as a number of attacks equal to the number of leaves the flytrap has.
bot.name: Focused Assault

entries: The flytrap makes two leaf {@action Strike||Strikes} at a –2 penalty, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the flytrap's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all its attacks.
bot.name: Hungry Flurry

entries: Medium, {@damage 1d8+1} bludgeoning plus {@damage 1d6} acid, Rupture 5.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: A sod hound can sense crystals or gems within 60 feet as if using the {@ability scent} ability.
top.name: Crystal Sense

entries: The sod hound can {@action Burrow} through any earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, the sod hound moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.
bot.name: Earth Glide

notes: one spoken by its creator (typically Common)

spells.name: one additional spell depending on the donor soul's alignment
spells.note: {@b Lawful Good:} {@spell zone of truth}; {@b Neutral Good:} {@spell heroism}; {@b Chaotic Good:} {@spell heal}; {@b Lawful Neutral:} {@spell nondetection}; {@b Neutral:} {@spell wall of thorns}; {@b Chaotic Neutral:} {@spell grease}; {@b Lawful Evil:} {@spell chilling darkness}; {@b Neutral Evil:} {@spell harm}; {@b Chaotic Evil:} {@spell vampiric touch}

entries: A soulbound doll shares fragments of its donor soul's personality, though none of that creature's memories. This causes a soulbound doll to match the donor soul's alignment and gain the corresponding alignment traits.
top.name: Personality Fragments

entries: Sphinxes are naturally curious, and their love of puzzles and mysteries leads them to gather information on a broad range of topics. Sphinxes have the {@skill Lore||Bardic Lore} bard feat, allowing them to {@action Recall Knowledge} on any topic.
top.name: Bardic Lore

entries: The sphinx rears back on their hind legs and makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} at the same target, using the same attack bonus as their highest melee attack. If both attacks deal damage, the target takes extra damage equal to one claw {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Claw Rake

entries: The sphinx {@action Stride||Strides} and makes a {@action Strike} at the end of that movement. If the sphinx began this action {@condition hidden}, they remain {@condition hidden} until after the attack.
bot.name: Pounce

entries: Once per week, a Sphinx can create a magical symbol as though casting a heightened {@spell glyph of warding} spell. The sphinx usually shapes the glyph to take the form of a written riddle, and sets the password to the answer. A creature that gives the wrong answer or tries to pass without answering must succeed at a DC 26 Will save or suffer one of the following spell effects, chosen by the sphinx when creating the symbol: synaptic pulse (5th), charm (4th), fear (3rd), phantom pain (3rd), sleep (3rd). The sphinx learns the identity of any creature that answers the riddle and tends to be {@condition friendly} to them.
bot.name: Warding Glyph

entries: The spider swarm has imprecise {@ability tremorsense} to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its web.
top.name: Web Sense

entries: Each enemy in the spider swarm's space takes {@damage 1d4} piercing damage with a DC 14 basic Reflex save. A creature that fails its save is exposed to spider swarm venom.
bot.name: Swarming Bites

entries: A sprite naturally sheds light like a torch. The sprite can extinguish, rekindle, or change the color of this light using a single action, which has the {@trait concentrate} trait. While this light is extinguished, the sprite's {@action Strike||Strikes} don't deal fire damage and they can't use their luminous spark {@action Strike}.
top.name: Luminous Fire

mid.trigger: The stegosaurus is targeted with a melee attack.
entries: The stegosaurus leans its dorsal plates into the attack, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, the stegosaurus {@action Step||Steps} after the attack.
mid.name: Dorsal Deflection

entries: Large or smaller, foot, DC 25
bot.name: Trample

entries: The stone giant makes a greatclub {@action Strike}. The target is Pushed up to 10 feet on a hit or up to 20 feet on a critical hit. If the target collides with a solid object or lands on the ground, it takes bludgeoning damage as though it had fallen the distance it moved.
bot.name: Big Swing

entries: harmed by cold and water ({@dice 5d10}, {@dice 2d8} from areas and {@condition persistent damage}); healed by acid (area {@dice 2d8} HP); {@condition slowed} by earth.
mid.name: Golem Antimagic

entries: A {@spell stone to flesh} spell negates the golem's golem antimagic and its resistance to physical damage for 1 round. A {@spell flesh to stone} spell reverses this effect immediately.
mid.name: Vulnerable to Stone to Flesh

bot.trigger: The stone golem hits a {@condition slowed} creature.
entries: The creature must succeed at a DC 30 Fortitude save or become {@condition paralyzed} for 1 round.
bot.name: Impose Paralysis

entries: The stone golem {@action Stride||Strides} up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can attempt to bar the way by succeeding at a DC 34 Fortitude save. On a critical success, the resisting creature takes no damage; otherwise it is damaged as if hit by the golem's fist.
bot.name: Inexorable March

entries: Each creature in a 10-foot emanation must succeed at a DC 30 Fortitude save or be {@condition slowed 1} for 1 minute. The golem can't use Slowing Pulse again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Slowing Pulse

entries: When not touching solid ground, a stone mauler is {@condition slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
top.name: Earthbound

entries: 5 feet. Spikes of rock rise up from all stone surfaces in the emanation, creating {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain}. A creature moving in the terrain takes {@damage 2d6} piercing damage for each square of spikes it moves into (a Large or larger creature takes damage only once for each square it moves, even if its space covers multiple squares of spikes). Creatures with the {@trait earth} trait ignore all effects within the area. The stone mauler can disable or activate spike stones as a single action, which has the {@trait concentrate} trait.
mid.name: Spike Stones

entries: The stone mauler crumbles into the ground, Burrowing down 15 feet. This Burrowing does not trigger reactions. The stone mauler can't Crumble again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
mid.name: Crumble
mid.trigger: The stone mauler takes damage from a {@condition hostile} source while atop rock or earth.

entries: The stone mauler can {@action Burrow} through any earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, the stone mauler moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.
bot.name: Earth Glide

entries: Blade three (electricity, evocation, primal) The storm giant raises one hand to the sky, channeling a bolt of lightning into the blade held in the other. The giant makes a greatsword {@action Strike} with a –2 circumstance penalty against each creature within its reach. It makes only one attack roll and compares the result against each creature's AC. This {@action Strike} deals an additional {@damage 3d12} electricity damage and counts as two attacks for the giant's multiple attack penalty.
bot.name: Lightning

entries: The storm giant makes a single greatsword {@action Strike} and compares the attack roll result to the ACs of up to two foes within its reach. This counts as two attacks for the giant's multiple attack penalty.
bot.name: Wide Swing

entries: 20 feet. Air within the emanation is {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} for Flying creatures that do not have the {@trait air} trait.
mid.name: High Winds

entries: The storm lord disperses. Until the end of the current turn, it can't be attacked or targeted, doesn't take up space, and any auras or emanations it has are suppressed. At the end of the turn, the storm lord reforms in any space in which it can fit within 50 feet of where it dispersed and any auras or emanations it has are restored as long as their duration didn't run out while it was dispersed.
mid.name: Disperse
mid.trigger: The living whirlwind takes damage from a {@condition hostile} action.

entries: The storm lord's movement doesn't trigger reactions.
bot.name: Swiftness

entries: As succubi are beings of pure lust, creatures that reject their lust can metaphysically harm them. When a succubus fails a {@skill Diplomacy} check to Embrace or {@action Request}, or when a creature succeeds at its save against a succubus's mental spell or ability, the succubus takes {@damage 2d6} mental damage. For one hour after causing mental damage to a succubus in this way, a creature can deal {@damage 2d6} mental damage to the succubus with a successful {@action Demoralize} incorporating its rejection.
mid.name: Rejection Vulnerability

entries: 10 feet. Any creature in the aura that could be sexually attracted to a succubus takes a –2 circumstance penalty to checks and DCs to oppose the succubus's mental spells, {@skill Deception}, and {@skill Diplomacy}.
mid.name: Seductive Presence

entries: The succubus can take on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage modifiers with their {@action Strike||Strikes}, but it might change the damage type their {@action Strike||Strikes} deal (typically to bludgeoning).
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: The succubus attempts to {@action Grapple} a creature using their {@skill Diplomacy} bonus instead of {@skill Athletics}. If the creature is willing, the succubus grapples it automatically.
bot.name: Embrace

entries: The succubus engages a creature they have {@condition grabbed} in an embrace or other act of passion to drain its vital essence. The kiss makes the creature {@condition drained 1} or increases its {@condition drained} condition by 1, to a maximum of 4. The creature takes {@damage 3d6} negative damage and the succubus regains Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. The target must succeed at a DC 26 Will save or be affected by a suggestion to submit to more actions of passion rather than trying to {@action Escape}.
bot.name: Passionate Kiss

entries: The succubus on can give a willing humanoid a profane gift. That creature gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, skill checks, and saving throws. As long as the gift persists, the succubus can communicate telepathically with the target at any distance, see through the creature's senses, and target the creature with suggestion through the telepathic link. In addition, the creature uses an outcome one degree of success worse than it rolls on saving throws against the lust demon's suggestions. A humanoid can't have more than one profane gift at a time, and a succubus can't grant more than one profane gift at a time. Removing the gift requires an atone ritual. The succubus can remove the gift as a free action to give the recipient a permanent {@condition stupefied 3} condition. A 4th-level {@spell restoration} spell is required to reduce this {@condition stupefied} condition by 1. A summoned succubus can't grant a profane gift.
bot.name: Profane Gift

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. {@trait magic}

entries: When a creature slays a tarn linnorm, it must succeed at a DC 46 Will save or it can no longer recover Hit Points via any means, such as healing spells, the {@skill Medicine} skill, or natural healing from rest.
mid.name: Curse of Death

entries: Tail only.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: The tarn linnorm can expel either a 120-foot line or a 60-foot cone of acid dealing {@damage 20d6} acid damage to creatures within the area (DC 44 basic Reflex save). The acid creates toxic fumes. At the beginning of the linnorm's next turn, those who failed the breath weapon's Reflex save must succeed at a DC 42 Fortitude save or gain {@condition sickened 4} from the poisonous fumes. A tarn linnorm can't use Breath Weapon or Overwhelming Breath again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: {@damage 3d6+18} bludgeoning, DC 44
bot.name: Constrict

entries: The tarn linnorm {@action Stride||Strides} and then makes a jaws {@action Strike} with each of its heads, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the tarn linnorm's multiple attack penalty, and the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after the tarn linnorm makes all of these attacks.
bot.name: Double Bite

entries: A tarn linnorm uses its Breath Weapon twice. A creature attempts only one save and can take damage only once. The tarn linnorm can't use Breath Weapon or Overwhelming Breath again for {@dice 2d4} rounds.
bot.name: Overwhelming Breath

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: The tengu deals {@dice 1d6} extra precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are {@condition flat-footed} to the tengu.
bot.name: Surprise Attacker

attacks.name: tentacle
attacks.damage: {@damage 4d10+16} bludgeoning plus {@damage 2d6} chaotic, {@damage 2d6} evil, and {@ability Improved Grab} or Improved Push 20 feet (40 feet on a critical hit)

attacks.name: spores
attacks.damage: {@damage 4d8+6} poison plus {@damage 2d6} chaotic, {@damage 2d6} evil, spore blight, and sticky spores

entries: 30 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn there is exposed to spore blight.
mid.name: Spore Cloud

bot.requirements: The terotricus is in a swamp or forested area.
entries: The terotricus drains nutrients from nearby trees and undergrowth while simultaneously infesting them with fungal growth. All non-magical plant life (though not plant creatures) within a 60-foot emanation withers and sprouts foul mold and slimy mushrooms, removing any cover and concealment provided by trees and undergrowth. The terotricus is healed 200 Hit Points.
bot.name: Infest Environs

entries: A creature hit by a terotricus's spores must succeed at a DC 40 Reflex save or take a –10-foot status penalty to all its Speeds for 1 minute. On a critical failure, the creature is {@condition immobilized} until it {@action Escape||Escapes} (DC 40).
bot.name: Sticky Spores

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

attacks.name: wave
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d12+11} bludgeoning plus Push or Pull 10 feet

entries: When not touching water, the living waterfall is {@condition slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
top.name: Water-Bound

entries: 30 feet. Water in the area that is in the same body of water as the living waterfall is {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} for Swimming creatures that don't have the {@trait water} trait.
mid.name: Vortex

entries: The elemental puts out all fires in a 10-foot emanation. It extinguishes all non-magical fires automatically and attempts to counteract magical fires (+20 counteract modifier).
bot.name: Drench

bot.requirements: The adept hasn't acted yet on this turn.
entries: The adept expends the power stored in its staff. This gives the adept the ability to cast one prepared spell it had already previously cast today (choosing a different spell level each time), without spending a spell slot. The adept must still {@action Cast a Spell||Cast the Spell} and meet the spell's other requirements.
bot.name: Drain Bonded Item

entries: Duskwalkers are infused with the same energies as psychopomps. These ashen scions are reborn on the Material Plane to serve as guardians of the cycle of life and death.
bot.name: Duskwalker

entries: The tiger {@action Stride||Strides} and makes a {@action Strike} at the end of that movement. If the tiger began this action {@condition hidden}, it remains {@condition hidden} until after this ability's {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Pounce

entries: The tiger deals {@dice 1d6} extra precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: The tiger makes a claw {@action Strike} against a creature it is grabbing. If the attack hits, that creature is knocked {@condition prone}.
bot.name: Wrestle

entries: When a creature slays a tor linnorm, it must succeed at a DC 48 Will save or permanently gain weakness to fire 20 and {@condition slowed 1} from the agonizing pain it now endures at all times. As long as a character continues to suffer this curse, its {@condition slowed} condition can never be reduced below {@condition slowed 1}.
mid.name: Curse of Boiling Blood

entries: A tor linnorm can breathe and swim freely while submerged in lava and magma.
mid.name: Lava Affinity

entries: Tail only.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: The tor linnorm expels a 60-foot cone of flame and ash dealing {@damage 20d6} fire damage to creatures within the area (DC 46 basic Reflex save). At the start of the tor linnorm's next turn, the area affected by the breath weapon is covered in thick, scorching smoke that burns both the lungs and eyes, dealing an additional {@damage 10d6} fire damage to all creatures in the area (DC 46 basic Reflex save). A creature that spends an entire round in the smoke with open eyes must succeed at a DC 44 Fortitude save or is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. The smoke dissipates after 1 minute; in strong winds, the smoke dissipates in 5 rounds, and in more powerful winds, it may clear even more quickly. The tor linnorm can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: {@damage 3d6+21} bludgeoning, DC 46
bot.name: Constrict

entries: A tor linnorm makes four {@action Strike||Strikes} with its claws, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the tor linnorm's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after the tor linnorm makes all its attacks.
bot.name: Slashing Claws

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

attacks.name: Blackaxe
attacks.damage: {@damage 4d12+15} slashing plus {@damage 1d6} acid, {@damage 1d6} chaotic, and {@damage 1d6} evil, and {@damage 2d6} slashing vs. plants

entries: 120 feet. Plants near Treerazer twist, deform, and transform into thorny or fungoid parodies of their natural shapes. A living creature in this area must succeed at a DC 47 Fortitude save each round or become partially transformed into plantlike matter. Those who fail this saving throw are treated as if they were plants for the purposes of any effect that particularly harms or inconveniences plant creatures more than other creatures, but do not gain any benefits of being plant creatures. This effect lasts as long as the creature remains within the area of corruption and for 1 minute thereafter.
mid.name: Aura of Corruption

entries: Treerazer exudes a pulse of sickly green light in a 30-foot-radius emanation. All plants in the area (including creatures under the effect of his aura of corruption) blacken and wither. Non-creature plants immediately wither and die. Plant creatures take {@damage 20d8} negative damage with a DC 49 basic Fortitude save. A creature that fails its save is {@condition doomed 1} for 1 minute and {@condition sickened 3}. Treerazer can choose to exclude any number of plants in the area from this effect, and generally does so to preserve twisted and corrupted plants or fungi, or plant creatures that are allied to his cause. Treerazer can't use Defoliation for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Defoliation

bot.trigger: Treerazer hits a creature, object, or spell effect with a weapon {@action Strike} or a defoliation attack.
entries: Treerazer casts his innate dispel magic, targeting the creature he hit with his {@action Strike} or one spell affecting that creature.
bot.name: Dispelling Strike

entries: When Treerazer scores a critical hit with a melee attack, the target is {@condition stunned 2}.
bot.name: Staggering Strike

savingThrows.abilities: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

mid.trigger: The rider is targeted with an attack.
entries: Requirements A creature must be mounted on the triceratops. The triceratops intercepts the attack with its bony frill. The rider gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack.
mid.name: Frill Defense

entries: The triceratops {@action Stride||Strides} up to 10 feet and then makes a {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Lumbering Charge

entries: Large or smaller, foot, DC 26
bot.name: Trample

entries: A triceratops deals {@dice 2d6} extra {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} to {@condition prone} targets it hits with its horns.
bot.name: Vicious Gore

mid.trigger: The troll king takes {@condition persistent damage||persistent acid} or fire damage.
entries: The troll king shakes itself to remove persistent {@trait acid} or {@trait fire} effects. The troll king immediately attempts a DC {@flatDC 15} flat check to end the {@condition persistent damage} that triggered this reaction. If the troll king succeeds at this check, it can immediately use Primordial Roar as part of this reaction.
mid.name: Vigorous Shake

bot.requirements: The troll king's regeneration is not currently deactivated.
entries: The troll king regains 15 HP.
bot.name: Forced Regeneration

entries: The troll king unleashes a bestial roar. Each non-troll creature within 100 feet must attempt a DC 29 Will save. The creature is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened 2}.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened 3}.

bot.name: Primordial Roar

entries: The troll king {@action Stride||Strides} twice in a straight line. It can make up to two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} during this movement and one jaws {@action Strike} at the end of its movement. It can't {@action Strike} the same creature more than once.
bot.name: Unstoppable Charge

bot.requirements: A creature is {@condition Grabbed} in the tyrannosaurus's jaws.
entries: The tyrannosaurus flings the creature into the air up to 10 feet up from its mouth and 20 feet away. The creature falls 25 feet (assuming the tyrannosaurus flings it as high as it can) and takes falling damage accordingly. If the flung creature lands on another creature, the creature it lands on takes the same amount of bludgeoning damage. The creature being landed on can attempt a DC 23 basic Reflex save.
bot.name: Fling

bot.trigger: The tyrannosaurus critically hits a Large or smaller foe with its foot.
entries: The creature struck by the foot is knocked {@condition prone} and the tyrannosaurus uses its foot to hold the creature in place. As long as the tyrannosaurus doesn't move from its position, the pinned creature is {@condition Grabbed}. A tyrannosaurus gains a +2 circumstance bonus to attack a creature it has pinned in this manner, but it cannot use Swallow Whole on the target unless it uses its jaws to Grab the victim first.
bot.name: Pin Prey

entries: Medium, {@damage 3d6+8} bludgeoning, Rupture 26.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: Huge or smaller, foot, DC 29
bot.name: Trample

attacks.name: horn
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d10+4} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} good and {@item ghost touch}

entries: The unicorn has a connection to the creatures of the natural world that allows it to communicate with them. The unicorn can use {@skill Diplomacy} to {@action Make an Impression} on animals and to make very simple Requests of them.
top.name: Wild Empathy

entries: A unicorn's {@action Strike||Strikes} have the effects of a {@item ghost touch} property rune.
bot.name: Ghost Touch

entries: The unicorn {@action Stride||Strides} up to double its Speed in a straight line and then makes a horn {@action Strike}. If the unicorn moved at least 20 feet, it deals an additional {@dice 2d6} damage on a hit.
bot.name: Powerful Charge

entries: 40 feet. Air in the aura is {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} for Flying creatures without the {@trait air} trait.
mid.name: High Winds

entries: The uthul unleashes a powerful bolt of lightning and a stunning thunderclap. The bolt deals {@damage 6d12} electricity damage to all creatures in a 30-foot line, with a DC 34 basic Reflex save, and every creature in a 20-foot emanation must attempt a DC 34 Fortitude save. The uthul can't use Lightning Crash again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition stunned} for 1 round.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition stunned} for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

bot.name: Lightning Crash

entries: An uthul's movement doesn't trigger reactions.
bot.name: Swiftness

entries: The uthul transforms itself into a swirling vortex of storm and fury 10 feet wide and up to 40 feet tall. It stays in this form for 3 rounds or until it Dismisses the effect. While in this form, the uthul gains resistance 10 to physical damage and can move through other creatures. Its aura remains active, but it can't make debris {@action Strike||Strikes} nor use Lightning Crash. Instead, any creature the uthul moves through takes {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 2d12} electricity damage. A creature can take this damage only once per round.
