A Large or smaller creature must also succeed at a DC 32 Reflex save or be picked up and held suspended within the vortex. Suspended creatures move with the uthul. A creature can attempt to escape by spending an action to attempt a DC 32 Reflex save (or a DC 32 {@skill Acrobatics} check to maneuver in flight if it has a fly Speed). Upon escaping, or when the uthul transforms back into its storm cloud form, a suspended creature is hurled {@dice 1d4}  10 feet in a random direction, then falls unless it can fly or otherwise remain aloft. After returning to its normal form, the uthul must wait 1 minute before it can use Whirlwind Form again.
bot.name: Whirlwind Form

entries: A bat swarm can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.
top.name: Echolocation

entries: Each enemy in the bat swarm's space takes {@damage 1d4} piercing damage (DC 16 basic Reflex save). Creatures that fail this save also take 1 {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage}.
bot.name: Blood Feast

entries: Giant bat with fangs +15 for {@damage 1d8+9} piercing.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: DC 22
bot.name: Dominate

entries: When Drinking Blood, the vampire regains 10 HP.
bot.name: Drink Blood

entries: Giant bat with fangs +19 for {@damage 2d8+9} piercing.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: DC 26
bot.name: Dominate

bot.requirements: The vampire hasn't acted yet on this turn.
entries: The vampire expends the power stored in its signet ring. This gives the vampire the ability to cast one prepared spell it had already previously cast today, without spending a spell slot. The vampire must still {@action Cast a Spell||Cast the Spell} and meet the spell's other requirements.
bot.name: Drain Bonded Item

entries: When Drinking Blood, the vampire regains 10 HP.
bot.name: Drink Blood

entries: If another creature's reaction would disrupt the vampire mastermind's spellcasting action, the vampire attempts a DC {@flatDC 15} flat check. If the vampire succeeds, its action isn't disrupted.
bot.name: Steady Spellcasting

entries: When Drinking Blood, the spawn regains 5 HP.
bot.name: Drink Blood

entries: The vampire spawn deals {@dice 1d6} extra precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

attacks.name: fangs
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d8+12} piercing plus slime and consume memories

entries: 30 feet. While underwater, a vidileth exudes a cloud of transparent slime. An air-breathing creature adjacent to a vidileth must succeed at a DC 36 Fortitude save each round or lose the ability to breathe air but gain the ability to breathe water for 24 hours.
top.name: Mucus Cloud

entries: Once per round, a veiled master can take on the appearance of a humanoid of Large, Medium, or Small size or resume its true form. While in humanoid form, the veiled master's Speed is 30 feet, and it loses its mucus cloud aura and swim Speed. If the humanoid form assumed lacks the {@trait aquatic} trait, the veiled master loses its own {@trait aquatic} trait as well. In humanoid form, the veiled master can use weapons, or it can make {@action Strike||Strikes} that work like its tentacle attack but use the reach of its current form. If the assumed form has fangs or claws, the veiled master can also make such {@action Strike||Strikes}, but these attacks lack the veiled master's slime.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: When a veiled master makes a fangs {@action Strike} against a creature, it can consume some of that creature's memories. The target must succeed at a DC 37 Fortitude saving throw or become {@condition stupefied 1}. A veiled master regains 5 Hit Points each time it successfully consumes memories. When a veiled master consumes memories, it learns some of the creature's memories (subject to the GM's discretion).
bot.name: Consume Memories

entries: When a veiled master successfully casts dominate on a creature, a {@spell suggestion} spell triggers when the {@spell dominate} spell ends. This suggestion usually causes the target to return to the veiled master, so the creature can cast {@spell dominate} again, but a veiled master can set the suggestion to different orders if it wishes.
bot.name: Delayed Suggestion

bot.note: A {@spell remove disease} spell can counteract this curse, but immunity to disease offers no protection against it.

stages.entry: the victim's skin softens, inflicting {@condition drained 1}

the victim's skin transforms into a clear, slimy membrane, inflicting {@condition drained 2} until the curse ends; every hour this membrane remains dry, the creature's drained condition increases by 1

bot.name: Slime

entries: The veiled master thrashes about with its tentacles. Make a tentacle {@action Strike} against each creature within its reach. Roll only one attack roll, and roll the damage only once for all targets.
bot.name: Tentacle Flurry

entries: A creature touched by the veiled master's tentacles, whether those tentacles deal damage or not, must attempt a DC 34 Will save, becoming {@condition slowed 1} on a failure or {@condition slowed 2} on a critical failure. Each time the affected creature ends its turn, its {@condition slowed} value decreases by 1.
bot.name: Thoughtlance

savingThrows.abilities: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: The velociraptor {@action Stride||Strides} up to 10 feet, ignoring {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} as it leaps over obstacles. It then makes a {@action Strike} with its talons, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.
bot.name: Leaping Charge

entries: The velociraptor deals {@damage 1d4} extra damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the velociraptor's allies.
bot.name: Pack Attack

mid.trigger: A creature ends its movement adjacent to the viper or within the viper's space.
entries: The viper {@action Stride||Strides}, Climbs, or Swims up to 10 feet (or up to the relevant Speed, if that Speed is less than 10 feet). It must end its movement in a location that isn't within 5 feet of a foe. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.
mid.name: Slink

attacks.name: tail
attacks.damage: {@dice 1d4-1} slashing plus {@damage 1d4} chaotic and confounding lash

entries: A voidworm can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants it the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. A creature under the effects of nondetection or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.
top.name: Entropy Sense

entries: A voidworm's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the voidworm takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The voidworm is immune to {@trait polymorph} effects unless it is a willing target. If {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened}, the voidworm automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.
mid.name: Protean Anatomy

entries: The voidworm takes on the appearance of a Tiny animal. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its {@action Strike||Strikes}, but might change the damage type its {@action Strike||Strikes} deal.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: A creature hit by the voidworm's tail {@action Strike} is {@condition stupefied 1} for 1 round ({@condition stupefied 2} on a critical hit). A successful DC 16 Will save negates this effect and grants temporary immunity to confounding lash for 1 minute.
bot.name: Confounding Lash

entries: If the vrock is flying and a creature triggers an attack of opportunity, the vrock can make 2 {@action Strike||Strikes} with its talons against that creature instead of 1 {@action Strike}.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: A vrock's wrath is the heart of their essence, and forcing peace upon them wrenches at their soul. If they fail a save against calm emotions or a similar effect forcing them to be peaceful, a vrock takes {@damage 4d6} mental damage.
mid.name: Peace Vulnerability

entries: The vrock dances in flight and chants to create a ruinous explosion of electricity. If more vrocks within 30 feet want to join the dance, the vrock can delay the dance to wait for more vrocks; in that case, the effect occurs after the last vrock uses Dance of Ruin or one of the vrocks chooses to complete that round of the dance. Each non-demon creature in a 20-foot emanation from any of the dancing vrocks takes {@damage 2d12} electricity damage (DC 28 basic Reflex save). For each additional vrock that joins the dance, the damage increases by {@damage 1d12} and the save DC increases by 1 (to a maximum of four vrocks dealing {@dice 5d12} damage with a DC 31 save). The vrocks can continue dancing by using Dance of Ruin each round, for up to 3 rounds in total. The emanation's size increases by 20 feet each round, and the damage increases by {@damage 1d12} per vrock each round.
bot.name: Dance of Ruin

entries: The vrock emits a cloud of spores from their body, dealing {@damage 2d8} poison damage to all adjacent creatures. Each creature damaged this way must succeed at a DC 28 Fortitude save or take {@damage 2d8} {@condition persistent damage||persistent piercing damage} as the spores penetrate its skin and grow into thick, green vines. The vines cease growing after 10 rounds, and they wither away in {@dice 1d4} days if not shaved off before then. The vines can be destroyed if the creature is affected by a good spell or if holy water is applied to the vines (with an {@action Interact} action). Once the vrock uses Spore Cloud, the ability can't be used for {@dice 1d6} rounds.
bot.name: Spore Cloud

entries: The vrock emits a shrill screech. Each non-demon creature within a 30-foot burst must attempt a DC 28 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature is {@condition stunned 2}, and on a critical failure, it's {@condition stunned 3}.
bot.name: Stunning Screech

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

entries: DC 17
mid.name: Buck

entries: The riding pony {@action Stride||Strides} twice. It has a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed during these {@action Stride||Strides}.
bot.name: Gallop

entries: DC 16
mid.name: Buck

entries: The riding pony {@action Stride||Strides} twice. It has a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed during these {@action Stride||Strides}.
bot.name: Gallop

mid.trigger: A creature within reach of the warg's jaws attacks one of the warg's allies.
entries: The warg makes a jaws {@action Strike} against the triggering creature.
mid.name: Avenging Bite

entries: The warg's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal {@damage 1d4} extra damage to creatures within the reach of at least two of the warg's allies.
bot.name: Pack Attack

entries: Small, {@damage 1d6+2} bludgeoning, Rupture 9.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

attacks.name: animated weapon
attacks.damage: four of the weapon's damage dice +9 of the weapon's damage type

entries: 100 feet, DC 35
mid.name: Frightful Presence

bot.trigger: The warsworn moves into a {@condition dying} creature's space.
entries: The warsworn absorbs the {@condition dying} creature into itself, instantly killing the creature and healing the warsworn for a number of Hit Points equal to the creature's level. As long as the warsworn still exists, absorbed creatures can't be resurrected except by wish or a similarly powerful effect.
bot.name: Absorb

entries: The warsworn assumes control of unattended weapons within 100 feet, forcing them to levitate around it. The warsworn can telekinetically wield these weapons to make melee {@action Strike||Strikes} with a reach of 100 feet.
bot.name: Animated Weapons

entries: When a warsworn hits with a corpse wave {@action Strike} or damages a creature with Trample, the target must succeed at a DC 35 Fortitude save or become {@condition drained 2} and {@condition doomed 1}. On a critical success, the target becomes temporarily immune to the warsworn's energy drain for 24 hours.
bot.name: Energy Drain

entries: A creature hit by a warsworn's scrap ball {@action Strike} must attempt a DC 37 Reflex save. On a failure, the target falls {@condition prone}; if the target was airborne, it falls up to 120 feet, taking damage from the fall and landing {@condition prone} if the descent brings it to the ground. On a critical failure, the target is also held under a pile of scrap (DC 37 to {@action Escape}).
bot.name: Plummet

entries: Huge or smaller, corpse wave, DC 37
bot.name: Trample

entries: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes {@damage 2d8} piercing damage (DC 21 basic Reflex save) and is exposed to wasp venom. A successful save negates the poison exposure.
bot.name: Swarming Stings

entries: The water mephit breathes acid in a 15-foot cone that deals {@damage 2d6} acid damage to each creature within the area (DC 17 basic Reflex save). The water mephit can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The water mephit puts out all fires in a 5-foot emanation. The mephit extinguishes all non-magical fires automatically and attempts to {@quickref counteract||3|counteracting} magical fires (+7 counteract modifier).
bot.name: Drench

entries: The web lurker can speak with spiders, with the same effects and limitations as speak with animals.
top.name: Spider Speak

mid.trigger: A creature touches the web lurker's web while the web lurker is on it.
entries: Requirement Initiative has not yet been rolled. The web lurker automatically notices the creature and {@action Stride||Strides} or Climbs before rolling initiative.
mid.name: Spring upon Prey

entries: A creature hit by the web lurker's web attack is {@condition immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface until it succeeds at DC 20 {@skill Acrobatics} check to {@action Escape}.
bot.name: Web Trap

bot.trigger: The wemmuth deals damage to a creature with Constrict.
entries: The wemmuth heals a number of Hit Points equal to half the total damage dealt by Constrict.
bot.name: Blood Leech

entries: DC 37, {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning, {@action Escape} DC 35, Rupture 36.
bot.name: Engulf

entries: Whenever a creature within 10 feet attempts a melee attack against a wemmuth or uses {@skill Acrobatics} to {@action Tumble Through} its space, that creature takes {@damage 1d12+10} piercing damage.
bot.name: Thorny Mass

entries: Heatsight is a precise sense that sees heat signatures.
top.name: Heatsight

entries: A target that fails its save against the wendigo's nightmare is exposed to wendigo torment.
bot.name: Dream Haunting

entries: The wendigo unleashes a forlorn howl that can be heard up to 1 mile away. Any creature that hears the howl must succeed at a DC 38 Will save or be {@condition frightened 1}. Any creature that critically fails and is within 120 feet of the wendigo is instead {@condition frightened 3}, and is also {@condition fleeing} for {@dice 1d4} rounds (or until it's no longer {@condition frightened}, whichever comes first). A creature {@condition frightened} by a wendigo's howl still naturally recovers from its fright but can't reduce it below {@condition frightened 1} in this way until 1 hour has passed or magic is used. Whether it succeeds or fails its save, a creature is then temporarily immune to that wendigo's Howl for 24 hours.
bot.name: Howl

bot.trigger: The wendigo casts wind walk while it has {@condition Grabbed} a foe.
entries: The wendigo attempts to turn the {@condition grabbed} creature into wind and carry it along as part of the action. If the target succeeds at a DC 38 Will save, it prevents itself from being transformed; in this case, the wendigo still transforms, automatically releasing the victim. A creature forced to Ride the Wind along with the wendigo is exposed to wendigo torment. The target can attempt a new Will save each round to return to normal, though it immediately becomes corporeal and begins falling if it succeeds.
bot.name: Ride the Wind
Wendigo Torment
bot.note: A creature affected by wendigo torment can't recover beyond stage 1 until it has been restored to full HP.

stages.entry: The creature searches for an individual of its own ancestry to kill and devour.

savingThrows.abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d12+7} piercing plus curse of the werebear

entries: The werebear can communicate with ursines.
top.name: Bear Empathy

entries: Medium human with fist +13 for {@damage 1d4+7} bludgeoning, or grizzly bear with Speed 35 feet.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: {@b Saving Throw} {@dc 22} Fortitude.
bot.name: Curse of the Werebear

bot.requirements: The werebear can see or hear the target or is {@action Track||Tracking} it in exploration mode.
entries: The werebear gains a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Perception} checks when it Seeks its prey and a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Survival} checks when it Tracks its prey. The werebear also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within its second range increment against the prey it's hunting. The werebear can designate only one creature as its hunted prey at a time. If it uses {@action Hunt Prey} against a different creature, the prior creature loses the designation and the new prey gains the designation. In any case, this designation lasts until the werebear's next daily preparation.
bot.name: Hunt Prey

entries: The werebear gains a +2 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures it has {@condition grabbed}.
bot.name: Mauler

entries: The werebear deals {@dice 1d8} additional precision damage on its first successful {@action Strike} against its hunted target on each of its turns.
bot.name: Precision Edge

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d8+2} piercing plus curse of the wererat

entries: The wererat can communicate with rodents.
top.name: Rat Empathy

mid.trigger: The wererat is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker it can see.
entries: The wererat gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
mid.name: Nimble Dodge

entries: Human with fist +10 for {@damage 1d4+2} bludgeoning, or Small rat with Speed 30 feet, climb 10 feet.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: {@b Saving Throw} {@dc 18} Fortitude.
bot.title: Curse of the Wererat
bot.name: Curse of the Werecreature

entries: The wererat deals {@dice 1d6} extra precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d8+8} piercing plus curse of the werewolf

entries: The werewolf can communicate with lupines.
top.name: Wolf Empathy

entries: Human with fist +11 for {@damage 1d4+8} bludgeoning, or wolf with Speed 40 feet and jaws with Knockdown.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: {@b Saving Throw} {@dc 19} Fortitude.
bot.name: Curse of the Werewolf

entries: When a full moon appears in the night sky, the werewolf must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of its jaws by 2. When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werewolf returns to humanoid form and is fatigued for {@dice 2d4} hours.
bot.name: Moon Frenzy

entries: The werewolf's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal {@damage 1d6} extra damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the werewolf's allies.
bot.name: Pack Attack

mid.trigger: The wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points.
entries: The wight makes a {@action Strike} before being destroyed. It doesn't gain any temporary HP from drain life on this {@action Strike}.
mid.name: Final Spite

entries: When the wight damages a living creature with its claw {@action Strike}, the wight gains 3 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a DC 17 Fortitude save or become {@condition drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the wraith increases the amount of drain by 1 on a failed save to a maximum of {@condition drained 4}.
bot.name: Drain Life

entries: A living humanoid slain by a wight's claw {@action Strike} rises as a wight after {@dice 1d4} rounds. This wight spawn is under the command of the wight that killed it. It doesn't have Drain Life or Wight Spawn and becomes {@condition clumsy 2} for as long as it is a wight spawn. If the creator of the wight spawn dies, the wight spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous wight; it regains its free will, gains Drain Life and Wight Spawn, and is no longer {@condition clumsy}.
bot.name: Wight Spawn

entries: 20 feet. A will-o'-wisp is itself naturally {@condition invisible}, but glows with a colored light, casting bright light in the aura and making it visible.
mid.name: Glow

entries: A will-o'-wisp is immune to all spells except faerie fire, glitterdust, magic missile, and maze.
mid.name: Magic Immunity

bot.requirements: An enemy is under a {@trait fear} effect or {@condition dying} within 15 feet of the will-o'-wisp.
entries: The will-o'-wisp feeds on the creature's terror. It regains {@dice 2d4} Hit Points, and if it has Gone Dark, its glow reignites. A will-o'-wisp can take this action only once per round.
bot.name: Feed on Fear

entries: The will-o'-wisp extinguishes its glow, becoming {@condition invisible}. It can end this effect with another use of this action. If it uses its shock attack while {@condition invisible}, the arc of electricity lets any observer determine its location, making the will-o'-wisp only {@condition hidden} to all observers until it moves.
bot.name: Go Dark

entries: DC 21
mid.name: Buck

entries: The warg makes a jaws {@action Strike} against the triggering creature.
mid.name: Avenging Bite
mid.trigger: A creature within reach of the warg's jaws attacks one of the warg's allies.

entries: The winter wolf breathes a cloud of frost in a 15-foot cone that deals {@damage 5d8} cold damage (DC 23 basic Reflex save). The winter wolf can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The winter wolf's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal {@damage 1d6} extra damage to creatures within the reach of at least two of the winter wolf's allies.
bot.name: Pack Attack

entries: The wolf's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal {@damage 1d4} extra damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the wolf's allies.
bot.name: Pack Attack

entries: Wraiths sense the vital essence of living and undead creatures within the listed range.
top.name: Lifesense

entries: A wraith caught in sunlight is {@condition stunned 2} and {@condition clumsy 2}.
mid.name: Sunlight Powerlessness

entries: When the wraith damages a living creature with its spectral hand {@action Strike}, the wraith gains 5 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a DC 23 Fortitude save or become {@condition drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the wraith increases the amount of drain by 1 on a failed save to a maximum of {@condition drained 4}.
bot.name: Drain Life

entries: A living humanoid slain by a wraith's spectral hand {@action Strike} rises as a wraith spawn after {@dice 1d4} rounds. This wraith spawn is under the command of the wraith that killed it. It doesn't have drain life or wraith spawn and becomes {@condition clumsy 2} for as long as it is a wraith spawn. If the creator of the wraith spawn dies, the wraith spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous wraith; it regains its free will, gains Wraith Spawn, and is no longer {@condition clumsy}.
bot.name: Wraith Spawn

resistances.name: all
resistances.note: (except force, {@item ghost touch}, or positive; double resistance vs. non-magical)

mid.trigger: A creature {@condition grabbed} by the wyvern critically fails a skill check to {@action Escape}.
entries: The wyvern makes a stinger {@action Strike} against the triggering creature.
mid.name: Savage

entries: The wyvern Flies up to its fly Speed and must both move forward at least 20 feet and descend at least 10 feet. If it ends the movement within melee reach of at least one enemy its size or smaller, it can make a claw {@action Strike} against that enemy. If the claw hits, as a free action the wyvern can either automatically Grab the target or knock it {@condition prone}.
bot.name: Powerful Dive

bot.requirements: The wyvern {@condition grabbed} a creature this turn using Powerful Dive.
entries: The wyvern can {@action Fly} at half Speed while holding the creature in its claws, carrying that creature along with it and dropping it at the end of its movement. Alternatively, the wyvern can {@action Strike} the creature with its stinger with a +2 circumstance bonus.
bot.name: Punishing Momentum

entries: The xorn makes three claw {@action Strike||Strikes}; no more than two can be against the same target. These attacks count toward the xorn's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks have been made.
bot.name: Claw Frenzy

entries: The xorn can {@action Burrow} through any earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, the xorn moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.
bot.name: Earth Glide

entries: 30 feet. A creature that enters the area must attempt a DC 19 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature is {@condition sickened 1}, and on a critical failure, the creature also takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. While within the aura, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the {@condition sickened} condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all xulgaths' stenches for 1 minute.
mid.name: Stench

entries: The target must succeed at a DC 20 Fortitude save or become {@condition enfeebled 1} (or {@condition enfeebled 2} on a critical hit) for 1 round.

Lone exiles of yeti clans have little use for treasure and leave the gear of their slain victims behind where it is quickly covered by snowfall. Clan-based yetis, on the other hand, create beautifully carved stonework, some of which they shape into protective talismans of rare beauty.
bot.name: Weakening Strike

entries: 30 feet. A creature that enters the area must attempt a DC 16 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature is {@condition sickened 1}, and on a critical failure, the creature also takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. While within the aura, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the {@condition sickened} condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all xulgaths' stenches for 1 minute.
mid.name: Stench

entries: A xulgath skulker can suppress its stench aura as a free action to better hide its presence. The skulker can resume its stench aura as a free action.
mid.name: Stench Suppression

entries: If a xulgath skulker starts its turn {@condition undetected} by a creature or merely {@condition hidden} from it, that creature is {@condition flat-footed} against the skulker's attacks until the end of the skulker's turn.
bot.name: Hidden Movement

entries: A xulgath skulker deals an additional {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: 30 feet. A creature that enters the area must attempt a DC 16 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature is {@condition sickened 1}, and on a critical failure, the creature also takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. While within the aura, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the {@condition sickened} condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all xulgaths' stenches for 1 minute.
mid.name: Stench

entries: Hiding, the yeti is {@condition concealed} by any snowfall, even if it's not thick enough to make other creatures {@condition concealed}.
top.name: Snowblind When

entries: Yetis gain a +4 status bonus to saves against fear and against spells and abilities that affect dreams. A yeti that falls prey to a supernatural nightmare loses this ability and becomes permanently enraged, gaining a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls and a –1 status penalty to AC.
mid.name: Nightmare Guardian

mid.trigger: The yeti is {@condition hidden} or {@condition undetected} while not in combat, and a creature would observe it.
entries: The yeti {@action Stride||Strides} or Climbs up to half its Speed to a location where it can {@action Hide}, then Hides. If its new {@skill Stealth} check result meets or exceeds the triggering creature's {@skill Perception} DC, the yeti remains {@condition hidden}.
mid.name: Vanish

bot.trigger: The yeti hits a creature in the first round of combat and the yeti was {@condition hidden} from that creature at the start of combat.
entries: Each enemy within 30 feet that witnesses the attack (including the target of the attack) must attempt a DC 23 Will save. On a failure, the creature is {@condition frightened 2}; on a critical failure, it's {@condition frightened 4}.
bot.name: Grisly Arrival

entries: 90 feet, DC 23
mid.name: Frightful Presence

mid.trigger: A creature within reach of the dragon's tail takes an action to {@action Strike} or attempt a skill check
entries: The dragon {@action Strike||Strikes} with its tail at the triggering creature at a –2 penalty. If it hits, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.
mid.name: Tail Lash

entries: The dragon breathes a spray of acid that deals {@damage 8d6} acid damage in a 60-foot line (DC 25 basic Reflex save). It can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The dragon makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} and one horns {@action Strike} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: The dragon recharges its Breath Weapon whenever it scores a critical hit with a {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Draconic Momentum

entries: The dragon can mimic any sound it has heard. It must succeed at a {@skill Deception} check with a +4 circumstance bonus to do so.
top.name: Sound Imitation

entries: 90 feet, DC 26
mid.name: Frightful Presence

mid.trigger: The dragon is targeted with an attack.
entries: The dragon raises its wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is Flying, it descends 10 feet after the attack is complete.
mid.name: Wing Deflection

entries: The dragon breathes lightning that deals {@damage 5d12} electricity damage in an 80-foot line (DC 28 basic Reflex save). It can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: When casting create water, the dragon can attempt to destroy liquid instead of creating it, turning an equal amount of liquid into sand. This destroys liquid magic or alchemical items if they're of a lower level than the dragon (a creature can attempt a DC 26 Will save to protect all liquids in its possession). This doesn't affect the liquids in a creature's body.
bot.name: Desert Thirst

entries: Snow doesn't impair a white dragon's vision; it ignores concealment from snowfall.
top.name: Snow Vision

entries: 90 feet, DC 20
mid.name: Frightful Presence

mid.trigger: An adjacent creature deals piercing or slashing damage to the dragon.
entries: The dragon's blood sprays on the creature, dealing {@damage 1d6} cold damage. A creature that takes cold damage in this way is {@condition slowed 1} for 1 round.
mid.name: Freezing Blood

entries: The dragon breathes a cloud of frost that deals {@damage 7d6} cold damage in a 30-foot cone (DC 24 basic Reflex save). It can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The dragon makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} and one tail {@action Strike} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a {@action Strike}, it recharges its Breath Weapon.
bot.name: Draconic Momentum

entries: A white dragon can climb on ice as though it had the listed climb Speed. It ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} and {@quickref greater difficult terrain||3|terrain} from ice and snow and doesn't risk falling when crossing ice.
bot.name: Ice Climb

entries: The dragon slams into the ground. It can do this if it's on the ground or Flying within 10 feet of the ground. Each creature on the ground within 10 feet must succeed at a DC 24 Reflex save or fall {@condition prone} and take {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage. The dragon can then {@action Step}.
bot.name: Ground Slam

entries: The dragon reshapes a cube of ice or snow it touches, up to 10 feet across. Any creature standing atop the ice must succeed at a DC 15 Reflex save or {@skill Acrobatics} check. On a failure, the creature falls {@condition prone} atop the ice; on a critical failure, it falls off the ice entirely and is also {@condition prone}.
bot.name: Shape Ice

entries: Until the next time it acts, the zaramuun appears to be a sand dune. It has an automatic result of 47 (50 in sandy terrain) on {@skill Deception} and {@skill Stealth} checks and DCs to pass as a sand dune. Any creature that walks onto the zaramuun moves into its body and is Engulfed.
bot.name: Dune

entries: DC 35, {@damage 4d12} bludgeoning damage and dimensional anchor, {@action Escape} DC 32, Rupture 28.
bot.name: Engulf

bot.requirements: The zaramuun hit with a melee {@action Strike} with its last action, or it has a creature Engulfed.
entries: The zaramuun attempts to {@action Disarm} one primarily metal or stone object from the Struck or Engulfed creature and casts its innate dimensional anchor on the target creature.
bot.name: Raking Sand

entries: The zaramuun can {@action Burrow} through sand and dirt (but not stone) at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnel or sign of its passing. Any Engulfed creatures are left behind when it Burrows. Loose sand and scree are not {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} for a zaramuun.
bot.name: Sand Glide

entries: The zaramuun sprays a blast of sand that deals {@damage 11d10} slashing damage to all creatures in a 60-foot line (Reflex DC 38). It can't Sandblast again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entries.Failure: Full damage.
entries.Critical Failure: Full damage and {@condition blinded} for 1 round.

bot.name: Sandblast

entries: The zephyr hawk Flies up to half its Speed, makes two wing {@action Strike||Strikes}, then Flies up to half its Speed again to return to its original location. The second half of this movement doesn't trigger reactions. Both attacks count toward the zephyr hawk's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after it makes both attacks.
bot.name: Circling Attack

entries: A zombie is permanently {@condition slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
top.name: Slow

entries: A zombie is permanently {@condition slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
top.name: Slow

entries: A zombie hulk can throw corpses at foes. While any Medium dead body will do, they sometimes throw {@creature zombie shambler|b1|zombie shamblers}, who take just as much damage from being thrown as the target they hit. A thrown shambler lands {@condition prone}, but if it's not destroyed, it can rise and use other actions normally.
bot.name: Corpse Throwing

entries: The zombie hulk makes a hunk of meat {@action Strike} and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within the {@action Strike}'s reach. This attack counts as two attacks for the zombie hulk's multiple attack penalty.
bot.name: Wide Swing

entries: A zombie is permanently {@condition slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
top.name: Slow

bot.requirements: The zombie has a creature {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained}.
entries: The zombie makes a jaws unarmed melee {@action Strike} against the {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} creature with an attack modifier of +7 that deals {@damage 1d8+3} piercing damage.
bot.name: Jaws
